Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Adele és un Superhost.","value":"Els Superhosts són amfitrions amb experiència i molt bones avaluacions que s'esforcen al màxim per oferir estades fantàstiques als seus hostes."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Estats Units
reviews: ["You will love Adele and her house!!","Adele's place is a 20 min walk from the convention center, and a straight shot down main roads. The room was much larger than I expected, with a couple of chairs, a dresser and microwave, and a/c in the window (N facing). She has two poodle puppies who are ninja quiet and well-behaved. Adele is a great host, very warm and inviting and with a perpetual smile. Check-in was painless.","The room as exactly as advertised.  Bed was super comfy.   Location was perfect for both downtown and stadium events.","Best place that you can have specially if you want to access downtown and the University. Kindness abounds in this place. Very private and hostess is the BEST!","Adela's house is wonderful. First, the location is super convenient as it is in the downtown area. You can find bunch of markets (Whole food, Trader Joe's, Sprouts) and restaurants just a few block away.  Also, the location is close to multiple public transportations: three blocks away from the UTA Trax station and just 4 minutes walking to the Park City connection bus stop. Second, I really like the vintage decoration in her lovely house. All the decoration are stylish and beautiful, such as the maps, chairs and lightings. She also has a spacious kitchen which is exactly the kind of kitchen that I want to have in my home. Third, Adela is so warm heart. I feel like she toke care of me like my grandma. She gave me many good local tips and always asked me if I need sth. You will feel like living in another warm home.","Adele is a lovely lady with a big heart","Stayed with Adele twice and thoroughly enjoyed it both times. A wonderful host and great person overall."]

Highly recommend and you’ll leave with a few more friends than you had before!!!","Nam is really nice and kind, and the stay was amazing to me. Everything is comfortable and clean. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Daniel is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["As always, great host in a great place!","Once again, Daniel was a great host.  Place was comfy and well furnished.  Conveniently located.  Grab it if you can!","Daniel is an amazing host! He is extremely attentive, responds in minutes, and goes out his way to make sure guests have the best experience they can get. I recommend 10/10! Will definitely rebook when at Salt Lake City!","Great location with easy access throughout the city and to the mountains. Comfortable for an extended stay. Good hospitality and responsiveness from the host.","Great place and a five-star host","Great place (with parking!) near downtown!  We would definitely stay here again.","We had a wonderful month staying here. Daniel's apartment was very clean and cozy. The bed was comfortable, the wifi extremely fast and reliable, and the shower had plenty of hot water for back-to-back showers at good pressure. We would happily return for another stay. Although it is a mostly below ground apartment, it doesn't feel like a basement. The renovations felt homey, providing plenty of light, and the heater is powerful. The kitchen isn't big (it matches the pictures) but we cooked almost every meal for a month with no issues. The shared coin laundry room shares a wall with the back of the apartment. We walked around the neighborhood at least a couple times a week. It feels very safe and the people are friendly. There is a restaurants and grocery shopping area just a couple blocks away and it was also a short walk to the large park. Daniel is among the most hospitable hosts we have had with Airbnb. He responds very fast to questions and went beyond to help us with things unrelated to the apartment. Thank you!"]

Great for one or two nights!","Three Airbnb rooms in basement   The good: comfortable enough bed for one person but noticeable lean on one side would have made sleeping two less optimal.  Easy to get to from airport.  The bad:. super thin pillows, no fan, large gap under door let in light and sound from another Airbnb tenant who cooked food after midnight. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Regina is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Regina is a true super host. Very helpful and makes you feel at home. Location is great very close to bus stop grocery store and Walgreens and other fast food joints. Will stay here again without doubt. Thanks for everything again","I loved staying at Regina’s place! It’s very clean and in a very safe neighborhood. I felt very comfortable staying here and would love to come again!","I stayed with Regina once before and I liked it enough to return. She provides a homey atmosphere, which is more like staying with a friend than staying in an airbnb. As a bonus there's a well behaved, friendly little dog. There are some good hikes within walking distance of the house for people who want to get out and get some exercise.

The location is close to a supermarket and a Walmart, so it's easy to get groceries, even without a vehicle, and the kitchen has all the equipment needed to prepare a meal.

Regina is currently working from home and she starts early, so if you're a light sleeper and you like to sleep in, you might want to bring some earplugs.","Easy keypad entry, Regina was awesome host, and responded quickly to inquiries. Comfy space and an espresso machine! My room had extra blankets, a fan/heater, a place to sit and work on my laptop and hangers & storage rack in the closet; The kitchen has everything you need to cook & the living room couch is comfy to just hangout. I will definitely be back!","Great place and location! Regina was very kind and a wonderful host.","Regina was so kind and lovely! I really enjoyed staying with her and Maverick. She really goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome.","This is the perfect place to stay in SLC. The host made me feel like family! Very generous host, great location, sweet puppy dog, great co-renters, nice neighborhood near highways and university. I won’t stay anywhere else in SLC!"]

I unfortunately could not get a refund do to Airbnb policy when my flight was changed to the following day but Maria, out of her kindness, offered me back what she could which I am very appreciative of. Thank you so much Maria and I will choose your Airbnb again in the future.","This is such a welcoming host family & in a great location.","Great hospitality and perfect for low budget trips! Will definitely come again when visiting Utah again!","check it out","Great place,good people"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Adam is super friendly and accommodating. The space is clean and comfortable. 10/10 would recommend!","Bad stay. Very bad. House is old, cold, cluttered and STINKY! Space heater put out almost no heat. I feel deceived because I had no idea the place was so run down and smelly. There’s a dog (not mentioned in then listing) and an old carpet. It’s a fixer upper that hasn’t been fixed up yet, and the host is seeking five star reviews. As I informed him privately, it’s not even a one star place. I suspect the city would not allow him to even be in business if they inspected the place. The only reason I haven’t demanded my money back is that I DID stay the night. I should have walked out the minute I walked in, but it was late and I didn’t know what the alternatives might be, so I decided to tough it out. Threw on two pairs of sweatpants, three T-shirts and a winter jacket and got a few hours sleep. Good location and price but it’s not worth the sacrifice. I would pay double elsewhere before I’d stay there again.","For a one night stay this place offered me everything I needed, in short, five stars","Good location, nice spacious room, excellent and accommodating host.
Many excellent food and coffee places nearby too.
Thanks, Adam!","Very nice room, spacious, with a desk which was useful for me, and great value. The street is great too, and in a strategic location in the city. You can get to places food walking a few minutes from the house. Adam was very responsive too, so I would come back if I need to stay in SLC again!","Adam was a great host, always responsive when I needed something. The room had all the essentials plus a few nice extras (coffee maker, candy). Overall had a great stay.","I was driving through and got in late and had to leave early, and this worked really well to have a bed for the night. Adam was very accommodating and cut me a break on the cleaning fee as well as had great communication with me even though I was booking at 6pm for that night at 9:30pm. Adam added a few extra items you may need (coffee, water, tampons, razors, face mask, etc.), which was a nice touch. There was some marijuana drawings on the chalk board in the bathroom, which was interesting. I noticed an odd smell that I couldn’t figure out, but I was so tired it didn’t
matter. Hopefully you don’t mind an older, creaky home, that is still being worked on, shared with other people. I didn’t, and it was fine!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Other reviews are accurate, this is a just a bed and go the next day kind of place. Host was understanding when I got the checkout time wrong.(Even though I had left at 4 am the day of checkout, I dropped off the keys at a later time to be sure they receive them).","Khan's place was clean and comfortable!  I highly recommend!","Decent place to crash for night; not huge on facilities or aesthetics.","Great location. The bathroom was not that clean. They let me check in 1 hour earlier which I’m super grateful.","3.5, the -1.5 solely comes from the fact that it’s not very clean.","Could use enhancements & cleanliness was a major issue. I had to ask for the heat to be turned on & with several other rooms in the basement being rented, a portable heater would be handy. My by far worse experience was the communal shower which was something close to what I would imagine a truck stop would be like. My towel smelled like urine which is a serious health threat. I immediately had to wash my face after placing that towel on it & air dried at that point. It took me a while to get over the disgust of that experience to feel like I could finally go to sleep. The smell in the room definitely smells like there are no consistently washed linens but I didn’t see hairs or stains. If I wasn’t so tired from my trip as a flight attendant, I would have gone back to the airport & stayed in a chair for the night. I truly would have wanted my money back and spent it elsewhere. Initial photo presented cleanliness & that it was not.","you will Never be disappointed when you Book with Khanh .. The home is in a Great Location near Grocery Stores & Restaurants . The home has everything you can ask for , It's super Clean , very quite and peaceful ! Everything I need when not at work on the road . Khanh Is an amazing host who responds quickly to any issues or questions you may have . I definitely will book again and again ."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 247 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a private room."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Very nice host.  Friendly & kind.  Comfortable bed.  Good parking very near entrance.  Mobility friendly drive & entrance, only 2 steps.  The shower is problematic, in that it is mounted low & you have to is on the side of the tub to shower.  But plenty of hot water, & the bathroom is conveniently located directly across the hall from the bedroom.  That inconvenience is small, considering the location of the home.  It is so near downtown & the Family History Library, which was my main reason for visiting.  Also near good restaurants.  Try Gourmandise, best bakery in the area, & Red Iguana for outstanding Mexican food.  However it is good to have a car for getting around, although the tram system seems to work well.  Recommend you bring your own toiletries.","Linley and her household were very welcoming and incredibly personable! It’s a great location for a great price, too. Good if you like small dogs and don’t mind being incorporated into a household of sorts!","Linley's place was great for a nights stay. She gave good instructions and checked on me if i needed anything.","Place was perfect, excellent hospitality, great communication!!! See you next year!!! location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Bandaríkin
reviews:
["Our bad experience was mostly my fault—I didn't realize Airbnb was showing me rooms, and not just private rooms and whole houses. This was priced like a private room, but it wasn't very private at all. It was also much smaller than it appeared in pictures. It basically fits the bed and nothing more. To get to the bathroom, you have to walk through areas shared not only by other guests but by the family, which may be fine for some people, but it wasn't what we were looking for in \"private.\" We ended up getting a hotel instead, and wasted our fee, including the \"cleaning fee\" for a room we didn't use.

I didn't realize this because the price was high. Made it seem like it was better accommodations.

Would not recommend unless you're traveling alone and just need a place to sleep and a quick restroom break. But for that, it would've been great. Jacque was super nice and the location was excellent.","Impeccable location, warm, cozy, and comfortable home, I loved my room and it was such a great little retreat from the winter weather. Top pick next time I’m in town for sure! Thank you!","We had a great time. The place was as described and it's in a great location","Jacque’s space is perfectly located to downtown SLC. The space was clean and Jacque is so nice. Jacque does so much to accommodate guests - a great place overall to stay!","Great place, would totally stay here again","Exactly as described! Friendly accommodating host!","Great location and nice setup for a solo traveler."]

highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Yaroch is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]

reviews: ["Super convenient","Great location!","I was very happy with my stay at Yarochs place. Everything was clean and tidy. The house was easy to find and the instructions were very detailed.","I liked our stays","My 2nd stay here--thought I was getting a different room but stayed in the same room, the Sundance Room. Room does not look like picture. The neighbor's security lights from three porches next door light up the room at night to the point of one can see shadows in the room. It is NOT dark at all.  Also, this is an adult hostel-- fine if guests are respectful of their mess and noise. This was not the case for my 2nd stay. The skeleton keys to the rooms are noisy and not convenient & latches on the doors are quite loud unless one takes a few seconds to turn the knob first so the latch doesn't slam into the box--someone using the bathroom at 2am, who isn't respectful, wakes the house. Also, be prepared for people using the kitchen waaay past quiet hours. Lastly, the Sundance Room shares a wall & thus a vent with the bathroom--so you can hear pretty much everything happening in the bathroom. Entire prop needs a deep cleaning. Yaroch cleaned the Fridge the very next day after I asked him to!","Excellent location, close to the bus and train station that gives access to the entire city.  Yaroch responds quickly and is kind.","Very clean and easy to access."]

highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Highly rated Host","value":"Adam has received 5-star ratings from 95% of recent guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great!","Great stay I recommend it to anyone","I've stayed at several of Adam's places when business brings me to the city. He's now my preferred provider, and I'm picky, so that should tell you a lot. He provides everything he says he will, and then there's always a very thoughtful collection of extras. small first aid kit, toothbrushes, blister Band-Aids, stuff like that. The silly little things that help to avert inconvenient mishaps.","Adam was very hospitable. It was nothing fancy, but I needed a quiet place to sleep and work, and that's what I got!","This house is in an excellent location, close to the TRAX and food. I appreciate the amenities provided, the in-room mini fridge and toiletries in the bathroom. Adam was a communicative and friendly host. The bedroom is comfortable, house common spaces are a bit run down but Adam makes it clear in the listing. It is a good choice for budget travelers.
There are two guest rooms in the house and Adam lives upstairs.","Adam, the owner is a very nice man who tries to make the stay a good one, but the house wasn't clean, the keys weren't where they promised to be (Adam fixed it but it took a while), there was a (sweet but incontinent) dog present that kept roaming in front of my door, a lot of things were broken or loose (plugs). My tv didn't work (turned out to be the remote batteries).The railing upstairs for the stairs was loose (a little scary), the bath curtain hung by a thread, the house smelled. The price was low, but you hope to get something better regardless. The house was very conveniently located near the TRAX train system. There were a lot of supplies, fridge was working.","The stay is great value for money!"]

["Fantastic, walkable location in Downtown Salt Lake City right across from the Jazz arena. We were able to walk to most restaurants and places from the apartment. If we go back to SLC we for sure will be staying here again!

The apartment was spotless with nice homey touches. Thanks for the stay Chewy!","Absolutely amazing stay! So thankful we found it last minute! Clean and quiet! Would love to come back!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Adele is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["good location and value","It's about a mile to the conference center; but, bus service is readily available just around the corner for those who don't want to walk. Plenty of shopping and restaurants within a few blocks. Adele is a great host.","Adele is the best! She's a great host, and an even better person. The place is in a central location, super convenient to get anywhere downtown or to the University, right on the bus route. Would definitely live here again! The room is great too, especially for longer stays.","Adele is an exceptionally kind and thoughtful host. She was very responsive to communications and questions, flexible, and even offered to pick me up from the airport if I needed it!","Adele’s place was super comfortable and I really enjoyed my stay!
She went above and beyond what she needed to, and for that I am very grateful!
I was in SLC for a very intense National Convention, and Adele made everything as seamless as possible.
From picking me up and dropping me off at the airport, to making coffee in the morning before my return flight home, she always did her best to make myself and the other guests happy.
The room was spacious, very clean, the house was quiet and homey, and the bathroom was nice and large with a shower, tub, and two sinks.

If I go back to the same conference next year in SLC, I will be sure to stay with Adele again and I would highly recommend her and her place!

Her house is also super close to the Salt Palace Convention Center, a big shopping center with Whole Foods, and a Starbucks nearby. It’s only about 10 minutes from the downtown shopping, restaurants and bars.

Thank you Adele— you are amazing and I hope to see you again in the near future!

-Bella","Adele was extremely helpful during my nearly one-month stay.It was a pleasant experience. Great location and price, I would recommend this place to anyone who looks for a place to rest in Salt Lake City","Adele is a great host!"]

reviews:
["The place is very close to the bus and the trail as well. The place was clean and well organized. Phillip was very attentive, and helpful. Philip is definitely one of the best hosts I’ve had the pleasure of staying with. He will (and did) go above and beyond to make sure your stay is the best it can be. He keeps the place extremely clean and everything in the listing is exactly as it shows. I highly recommend staying here. I’m sure I will again when i come back to SLC.","Phil is hands down the best AirBnB host I've ever had. He really cares for his guests and makes sure you feel like you're at home. I'd give 10 stars if I could.

The location of this Airbnb was great. You can easily walk to the train station which will take you to the airport and downtown SLC. The check-in process was very smooth as well. highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Stayed for one night, check in was easy. I was surprised with how small the space is, it was fine for my toddler and I, but I wouldn’t want to be there with another adult. The room is in a basement, and the light from outside was pretty bright. Also I was very cold, despite turning the heater on high and having an extra blanket on the bed. I would recommend an additional space heater. There was a keurig on the counter, and it took some digging to find the pods in the fridge (which I ended up not using). The freezer had a funky smell, but looked clean. I honestly think the price is okay, but when you add on all the fees $120 for one night in a tiny space seemed overpriced.","Super cute and quiet. Quiet. And CLEAN🥰The shower was amazing too, I didn't want to get out. Also, I was so happy they had my brand of lotion in the bathroom. I had to borrow a bit because I forgot mine. It's dry out here for a melanated gyal. Thanks!","Apartment was as pictured and described! The hosts checked-in via messenger often and the instructions were clear.  Would stay again!","We enjoyed the place very much!","This spot was difficult to enjoy, despite the host reaching out frequently. There is no clothing storage….although there is a rack to hang clothes, there aren’t any hangers to do so. The host said he’d bring some by, but didn’t. The photos aren’t a great indicator of what the place is like… it’s a bit thrown together. There is a keurig, but no coffee pods. We initially liked the steam shower, until we noticed a mildew smell from it. reviews: ["great place and location.  Daniel is a perfect host and is really caring.","I had an extended stay with Daniel and it was awesome. Well done!","Place is nice, great location for walkers like me!","The home is so beautiful and bright, I will definitely be looking to stay here again soon! Bed was comfortable, right near public transportation stops making it easy to get around the city!","I've stayed here a few times, an excellent place clean and a good location","Immaculate and centrally located.","Great place for our trip to SLC. It had everything we needed. The place is just as described. The bed was very comfortable. I’m a light sleeper but somehow I slept through the night perfectly. The place is very clean and well ventilated. It’s located near DT, walking distance to most things but also away from the activity of DT. I would really recommend this place to anyone.","First time in SLC and wow! Such an amazing spot to stay. Getting to and from airport was easy. Lyft was really expensive though. In a really nice area. Shops just down the street and the city about a mile away if you want to walk. The house is great. Very clean. My room was kept nice. Everything was fresh and comfortable. Shared areas weren’t a problem. Only saw 2 other guests and they were very nice. One thing I do have to note is that the house, because it is very old, you can hear everything. Unfortunately there were guests who were loud after 10pm and woke me up. Also, I believe it was the heater or a/c that kept turning on and off all day. At night it was loud and woke me up several times. Friday night not sure if there was a firework show going on close by but sounded like it and it lasted for a while. Aside from those things, I felt safe and my room was nice. Had a weird smell, not bad just weird. Will ask them to clean again and febreeze. Check in and out super easy. Codes were simple. Don’t loose your room key. I wanted to try out public transportation but ended up just doing Lyft. Next time, the stops are right down the street. Overall great stay and will definitely stay again. It was a great deal too! Hotels in the area were very expensive so this was absolutely perfect ! Thanks again Sandra ! Oh also, I had extra file folders so I left them in the drawer in the desk so if anyone needs new ones they are there. :)"]

highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 94 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a common area."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Stuart and Sylvia were very welcoming hosts. This house is in a great location for access to skiing! Not ideal for working from home as there is no desk or chair. Can be very cold in the room during the day so if you are coming during winter bring layers and slippers! Willy the dog was an added bonus for me but would be a lot if you don't like dogs.","Awesome place! I would recommend it to all my friends","Stuart's place was great - the location is so convenient to downtown. His dog Willy was a major highlight - such a kind animal.","Stu was an exceptional host! I couldn’t haven’t asked for a more welcoming experience. He is such a kind and down to earth person. Stu was very accommodating. He shared his home with me and made sure I had everything I needed.

The room itself is lovely. I wasn’t home all too much but it was a wonderful space to come back to. It was very clean. The bed is super comfortable!

Also, the sweetest dog lives here! Willy is a big golden doodle and he made my stay so enjoyable. He loved my company and I loved his. He’s a gentle giant. His brother golden doodle is at the house sometimes. He’s a bit more energy to handle but if you like dogs, you’ll fall in love with him too. Just be assertive :)

I stayed here for a whole month, and would absolutely stay here again! Thank you, Stu!","Couldn’t have asked for a better stay with Stuart! A great guy with an incredible place. ","The host canceled this reservation 29 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.","Everything was great!"]

reviews:

I also really liked the proximity to a big amount of hiking tracks in the mountains behind the house. I would definitely recommend this room for a stay in SLC!","I had an absolutely great experience. Do not hesitate to book this stay, you'll be in great company.","I love every bit of this place! You will have a great night view in the front and the mighty mountain on the other side. Location_city: salt lake city, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Ace is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: salt lake city, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Best Airbnb I've stayed in.

Grocery store, hair salon, coffee shop, gym (F45), Chinese restaurant all less than a 5 minute walk away but not too busy. It's the perfect balance of peaceful isolation with everything you need and access to everything in SLC. Mountains are so close you feel as if you can reach out and touch them. Great in Fall with the changing colors.

Fun and classy antiques in the front room and Ace has 2 mesmerizing reef tanks one can explore for hours.

Room is spacious and very private in the basement with a decent closet and desk. Bathroom shared with only one other room.

Kitchen and deck are accessible and well-equipped. Fridge space can be a little tight but doable unless you do crazy meal prepping like me. There are 3 total bedrooms for guests which can make 4 couples in the house but I didn't find it too crowded or difficult as the house is spacious.

Ace and Shannon are really chill and interesting. Ace is well-traveled, can talk about almost any part of the world, and can fix anything.

Utah sucks. Don't move here. Also, don't stay in this Airbnb because I need to convince Ace to sell it to me.","Great place to stay! I stayed here for 3 months over the summer for an internship and never had any issues. Big room, decent bathroom, and a nice kitchen space! Very quiet and in a nice neighborhood with everything you need in a 10 minute radius.","👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼","Beautiful house, perfect location and awesome hosts!!! This is how we describe our staying at Ace’s ! Thank you so much for everything and for the hospitality!","Had a great time here! Thanks Ace and Shannon:)","Ace was great to deal with. He was personable and helped sort some things out very smoothly. A great host!","Super accurate photos and the hosts Ace are great with last minute needs as well as communication !

The home is in a very serene setting on the mountains edge and it's in a very calm and friendly neighborhood!

Having the grocery store right across the street is a bonus and I would recommend stating here to anyone I know !"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Noelle is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Noelle is an absolutely awesome abnb host! super cool and welcoming. thanks a ton Noelle, I'll see you out on the slopes!","Good location and an awesome host! Felt like a very comfortable roommate situation and she was great with my crazy pup.  Would stay again!","Noelle has been very communicative through the stay, would totally recommend her place!","Noelle's place is well setup, conveniently located and overall a great place to call home base when visiting Salt Lake City.","Noelle’s place was fantastic to stay at! Noelle and her cohosts were super friendly and great hosts. The bed is comfortable and there is plenty of sunlight shining through the window. There were lots of friendly dogs that came through the house! I highly recommend staying here and I would come back if I were to visit Utah again.","Noelle was an amazing Host for me and my cat, Cleo! We drove 12 hours from WA State before we arrived at 9:00 at night! Even though we came in late, Noelle was awake and ready to great us at the door and even helped carry in some Items for my cat. We were welcomed very kindly and offered many snacks and got to have a quick tour around the house so we knew were everything. The Turquoise Room was very Clean and beautifully decorated. I would recommend this host to anyone, especially those who appreciates a unique stay and if I ever come back to Salt Lake City I'll be sure to be booking with Noelle!(:","Staying with Noelle was like clicking in with a really great housemate-friend who has an awesome eye for aesthetics. I loved so many of the little personalized touches around the whole house and in the individual rooms, and also her chill and friendly demeanor. There are animals here (they don’t go in your bedroom), so be loving of four-legged and furry ones if you choose this spot. I would definitely stay here again!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City , Ut, United States
reviews:
["It's a quiet neighborhood on a quiet street. The apartment was a lot larger then we expected. The host was super friendly and had lots of insight to local attractions and good restaurants. Host was also very polite not intrusive and could carry a good conversation. Our host has excellent communication skills, made sure we had everything we needed, also made checking in and out smooth.","Michelle was great to work with. I was in a bind making a last second reservation and she was able to accommodate me. Thank you Michelle! Great location in a quiet and safe neighborhood. It was great to have a separate, private entrance. I would highly recommend this location.","Small space and small bed with little to no room to be with another person. Not even enough room to lay a queen on the floor, just a single size mattress on floor for walking room, and if there’s two people then there’s not room to walk. Make sure that you don’t care in the slightest if you are using the tenants restroom with tenant -who has complete access to the bathroom at any time- on the other side of the door doing whatever she is doing. Also, if you were looking for a private getaway, this is not the place. I def felt like she thought I could read her mind like I was pre-informed of the entire uncomfortable situation beforehand; but was def not expecting what I had walked into. She tries to help out but, when someone is paying for privacy, I feel there should be something that allows for that. The rooms and doors are literally touching, leaving no room for a man and a woman to be together comfortably or to be able to even have a private conversation! If you stay, make sure it’s because you only need a place to sleep and nothing else matters.","We would give Michelle a 6 star review if we could!
This was absolutely the kindest airbnb host we have ever encountered. She was so warm and welcoming right off the bat and made sure we were doing great through our whole stay.
The room is spacious and comfy, and it was nice to have a desk for a remote meeting while we were visiting.
During the corona pandemic, she was kind enough to share some TP and sanitizing supplies so we could be prepared for the next part of our trip. So thoughtful and selfless!","Cozy & good location","Michelle and her family were amazing! A great place to stay, super clean and an overall great environment.","Very nice place welcoming and hospitable. Good location and close to many points of interest."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"90% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Erica was very helpful and friendly. Location is great, only a couple minutes from the Trax station.","My fiancé and I stayed here as a halfway point going home for the holidays. Love the bedroom so much, it has a lot of beautiful aesthetic features that aren’t found in newer homes. It has so much character. Easy to check in/out and the host was really responsive.","This place is fantastic! I’m a cute little neighbor with good restaurants and a small shop for groceries. Quiet, warm, and comfortable","This is a unique layout that has a cozy feel. It looks like a large house that was split into smaller apartment spaces. Because of this, your experience will depend on upstair neighbors. Ours always got in at around 1AM and were very loud. Besides that, the central location is perfect for nearby activities.

The house was a little dirty during our stay. Everything was tidy and put away, but the floor was dusty and had dog hair scattered about. We cleaned it ourselves, but the rest of the house was clean (kitchen, bathroom, bedding and linens).

Our host was very responsive and accommodating. The wifi went out and they quickly fixed it for us (within 20 minutes).

I'd recommend this place for anyone looking for an affordable but comfy stay in SLC. Assuming the cleaning is a little better next time, this is a great find.","I love the feng shui in this place it was decorated perfectly very Serene and comfortable. probably my most favorite stay at an Airbnb so far. I wasn't aware although of shoveling situation there was some salt left in a shovel I almost fell going up the stairs but I took care of the shoveling and the salting. other then that little bit of confusion it was awesome I was late getting out I hope that wasn't a huge problem I cleaned up very well afterwards so I would definitely stay there again if given the chance and needed to. thank you Erica","It’s a charming place. I love the vintage detail.","This is a delightful, quirky place. It’s so perfect for the neighborhood and convenient for downtown. It’s fantastic and unexpected"]

reviews:
["Really welcoming host! I was stuck in SLC during a snow storm and Adam was quick to approve my stay and was very welcoming ! The room was nice and well equipped. I’d stay there again!","Adam is the sweetest.
He was there to say hi when you arrived and made sure you had everything you needed.
Experience was well taken care of","Another great stay in the books. Adam is a good host and I appreciate his flexibility o check-in/check-out.","Solid, comfortable place- would happily stay here again when in town!","Adam is a great host! Very communicative and thoughtful. Check-in/out is a breeze. Everything you need is provided and the room is exactly as pictured. The location is great as well - there are lots of things to do, places to eat, and Traxx is only one short block away. I love staying here when I’m in town!","I love a fun-quirky trip wherever I travel & Adam was nothing short of that!

He met me & friend with the utmost hospitality, offering us a bottle of wine at the end of the night since all liquor stores were closed for Veterans Day.

The house was really cozy…
DVD selection is SOLID
Got to do laundry
The complimentary coffee/tea was delightful 🤌🏻 ☕️ ✨ go pop in his shop and say hi!

Plus, you get to meet “Peaches” the sweetest gal around 🍑🥹

This is NOT for someone who is lookin’ for a 4 seasons, but a genuine experience in a great location for an extremely fair price.

Thanks Adam!","Had a great stay. Adam is very accommodating and responsive. The house is old like the listing says but the price is unbeatable for how convenient the location is - close to downtown and very close to the trolley that goes to downtown if you don’t have a car."]

reviews: ["Perfect place for our family of four to visit Salt Lake City. Great location near downtown, and the grocery store nearby was a bonus. We'd gladly stay here again. Thank you, Karina!","clean and easy access to the freeway and the neighborhood quiet.","Overall, the stay was nice. The location of the home was really close to tons of restaurants and breweries. It matched the description and even had a little library for guests! Our only complaint was noise. During the night, we were woken up by children / dogs upstairs. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 247 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a private room."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Patrick is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]

reviews: ["Patrick’s place is a real gem! I had a lovely time all around.","This place is a fortune, Really! I couldn't believe it when I first read the recommendations, I thought it would be too good to be true, but truth is, it is even way better than you think. Besides those two nice and friendly hosts, you get a clean and tidy room with a comfortable bed. The bathroom is in good condition, too, and otherwise, you can find everything you need during your stay. With Trolley Square in walkable distance, and in between Downtown and the University, you have a great location location. So, there's actually not much to say than to just go for it!","I stayed for 30 days. Everything was great, the room is comfortable and with a good table to work. The bathroom is good too. Both Patrick and Torill are extremely caring and sweet people.","They were one of the best parts of staying in Salt lake, and I look forward to visiting them and their city again","Torill and Patrick are the most amazing and kind human beings. The room is very clean and organized, the bed is super comfy with lots of soft pillows(I love pillows). The bathroom is right across the room and clean. They made a beautiful welcome message for me on the work desk in the guest room. They are always willing to help you navigate SLC if you want. all in all I strongly recommend. Don't miss the opportunity to meet two most amazing human beings and an amazing Airbnb experience in downtown SLC. Thank you both!!","Nice clean room and very friendly and responsive owners of the apartment. You feel at home."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Meg is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great place to stay! Homey and friendly.","Such a cute and quaint stay with Meg. She and her pup Lulu are so sweet and accommodating. Meg was quick with response times whenever I needed to communicate with her, and was quick to solve any issues that I had. The unit is very small, and probably best for 1-2 people max, and the ceiling is short in some spots (anyone above 6ft tall might hit the ceiling in these areas). The house is old, and sound does travel well, so be wary that this unit is in the basement and you will likely hear noise from above (but nothing too bothersome). Laundry is right across the way from where you will be staying. This place is about 10 minutes from downtown by car and is right next to a grocery store and gas. Overall, this is a great stay and I felt safe and well taken care of by Meg. Her dog Lulu never accessed the area that I lived in and was very friendly and sweet when she was outside to greet me.","Meg was kind and very helpful. I grew up in Utah and went college in SLC, so I know the city quite well, but even so she was very helpful. Just be aware that if you bake brownies in the unit, you may want to offer her some because she will smell them. ;)","Great location. Easy check in. Nice host.","place was in a great location meg has a very beautiful yard the apartment has everything you need to prepare food I worked night shift and you could tell Meg took extra effort not to make alot of noise during the day
thank you for the stay","Such a lovely stay! Meg was quick to respond and even offered me muffins and tomatoes from her garden. Her dog is the sweetest thing and I loved when she came to greet me. The garden patio that you walk through is beautiful. The bed was extremely comfortable! Thank you Meg :)","Meg is a wonderful host with an exceptional space. It was great feeling like I had a little apartment all to myself while on the road. The location is ideal, and I had everything i needed for 2 weeks of stay. Meg was a great resource too on things to do around SLC , and was just an all around lovely person to chat. Her lovely dog Lulu was a great companion as well. I would definitely book again and would recommend staying with Meg to anyone!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Sharon is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Perfect location and house! Owners were so sweet and communicative during our stay. Very clean house and easy check-in/check-out process.","Sharon and Steve are incredibly nice. It felt like I went to stay with my Aunt and Uncle, very comfortable and great conversation! I stayed in the small room, but I think it’s a very great size for one person. It’s a little bigger than it looks. The other guest there was very considerate, so I didn’t hear any noise in my room at all. I could hear more in the hallways than I could between rooms, which is true for my own vintage apartment as well. The home is beautiful, very well taken care, and the neighborhood is lovely. The walk to downtown is very short, though I opted to take the bus most days since I came for a ballet intensive and was very tired. The ability to walk is still very nice since the 6 is not a frequent bus on weekends and holidays. Frankie is very cute, a little mischievous, but that adds to the charm. There is a cafe nearby attached to a historical BnB I highlight recommend called 140 B, as well as a neighborhood grocery store, and a liquor store. I would absolutely stay here again!","So perfect and the view from the balcony that extends from the room was breathtaking.","This house is located in a very beautiful and quiet neighborhood. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The shared bathroom and kitchen were also clean and everything was well-equipped. Sharon was very kind and sweet. I highly recommend this accommodation.","Beautiful house with great location, and an excellent value.

The host was amazing, our communication was great and always willing to made our stay pleasant.","Everything was great, we have been very comfortable","Wonderful place to stay! Thank you."]

I would highly recommend Austin's tiny house!","The little cottage with the big yard was a perfect fit for me and my little dog. The cottage was peaceful and quiet. The instructions about the cottage and directions to the site were very clear with great detail which left no question unanswered. We would definitely return.","One of the best air bnb experiences. The place is exactly like the description. Perfect size for a single person traveling alone and wanting a place to stay for a while or for for a couple doing an extended stay as well.
Clean and well taken care of air bnb around a nice area of Salt Lake. You are in Sugarhouse (I believe) and really close to downtown Salt Lake City (10ish minutes). Also a great location to stay at if you want to go snowboarding or hiking some mountains (30ish minutes).

Internet was great for anyone working remote needing a fast reliable connection.

Austin was a great host and was always available if needed. 10/10 will go back the next time I visit."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Mike is the best host we've ever met. He is very kind and a great guy. The conversations with him were really nice and informative. We also met his friends who were also very nice.
Mike has always been very helpful and caring towards my girlfriend and I.
He took a lot of time to help us, when we had any questions.

On the last day Mike invited us to breakfast. He baked a very delicious and fresh bread especially for us. Mike even made homemade vegan sausage and cheese for the bread. It really was the tastiest breakfast we ate in the US.
We felt so comfortable the whole time.

Now to the accommodation.
It was very well furnished and we could use anything in the kitchen. So we had everything we needed.

We particularly liked the fact that it was possible to adjust the temperature in your own room independently of the other rooms. Because we prefer to sleep cold, this was really very pleasant.
It was also possible to heat the room.

Mike is a friend of technology. The whole house is smart and modern equipped. We were also able to use his cinema room, which has a projector and a large screen.

The whole house was very tidy and clean.

Thank you very much for the great time with you.","Very clean and homey! Would definitely say again! Jazz hands was the Cherry on top very sweet cat!","We arrived to an uncleaned bathroom and relatively cleaned bedroom. We informed the hosts and they cleaned it within the next few hours. They fixed the issue and gave us a 50% refund for the one night, but would have been great to not have to deal with that to begin with. Great location however!","Mike's place was convenient and quiet.","Central house that is near downtown and walking distance from Whole Foods, Trader Joe's and other grocery stores in addition to some restaurants. The guys were really nice and I enjoyed my stay.","Mike was a great host. The space was clean and comfortable. I loved the backyard! Would recommend 😊","Comfortable and clean, beautifully decorated. Kitchen has everything you might need. Thank you!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Catherine is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I had a great stay. The bedroom was clean, quiet, and easily accessible. I spent most of my time out enjoying the city but the room would have been great for studying or working remotely as well. For a private room, it did feel very private, I had the space to myself and felt very comfortable.
Would definitely stay again for such a great deal!","Catherine was very responsive, attentive, and friendly. Her home is beautiful and very clean & organized. I had a great stay here and would highly recommend it to anyone.","Catherine is a gracious host. It was my second time staying at her clean, quiet and modern home. A long story short, Catherine took me to the urgent care in Sugarhouse and went back to pick me up. She handled the situation with grace and kindness. Catherine is a thoughtful and caring person. Five stars are not enough for this! I highly recommend her to anyone staying in the Salt Lake area!!","I lived in Catherine’s place for one week. I was shocked by the design of the house, which is so smart and thoughtful. The check in process was very easy. What makes my stay better is that Catherine is very commutable and caring. I was inspired by her a lot. In addition, the cat Mia is soo cute! This is a 6 out of 5 experience! And I will definitely recommend this to all of you!","Catherine’s place is extremely clean and comfortable; it is in a convenient location and a quiet neighborhood. This modern smart house is beautiful with great amenities. I enjoyed my stay so much that I had extended my stay. Additionally, I already booked another weekend to go back before leaving Utah. Most importantly, this is a safe place for a solo female traveler. It was like I was staying at an old friend’s house. Ladies, if you see this place available, you need to book it immediately!","The house was lovelier than in the pictures, and extraordinarily clean. Catherine was flexible with check-in and check-out times and even accommodated my special request.","Catherine’s place is fantastic! Located in a charming, central part of the city, it’s been recently renovated and it shows.

There are lots of great extra features (like a fantastic shower and coffee machine), plus it’s kept spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable as well, and I appreciated having access to a kitchen as well. Catherine is such a wonderful host as well, very friendly, easy-going, and hospitable.

Do yourself a favour and stay at her place!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Shannon is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["The place is located walkable distance from the downtown, which I like it. Also it was clean and has a small kitchen that I can cook.
Shannon is very helpful host. She brought a scented candle when the sewer smelled and exchanged coins when I wanted to do laundry. The laundry room is next to the door, and it costs less than $5(I don't remember exactly). It was convenient.
The building is old, the wall is very thin. I could hear lots of things from the upstairs. But it didn't bother me that much because I spend most of my time outside.","I'd been spending a lot on hotels in downtown Salt Lake for business travel, finally decided to try an AirBnB near the city center that was economical. This was absolutely a great place for me. Parking on 700 South was incredibly easy and abundant. Getting to downtown was maybe a 2-3 min drive. The unit is super clean and modern, feels like it was just remodeled. Lots of Keurig cups, convenient soap/shampoo/cond dispenser in the bathroom. Really clean and well equipped. The bed was comfortable and there were tons of power outlets & USB outlets near the bed. And a huge high-five for the complimentary ear plugs - in any multi-family unit there will be some adjacent sounds, and the ear plugs were a nice touch. Generally my rule is when someone provides ear plugs, use them. I'll probably be staying here often when I'm in SLC for business.","I spend 4weeks in this Airbnb, the location is very convenient to access to downtown. The appartement is very clean with a well equipped kitchen. The shower and drier are also very convenient. The hosts were very responsive very nice and great to accommodate anything I needed. I recommend. ( the temperature is easy to adjust to your own likes and it was very convenient for me).","Good location for my work trip. The accommodations was just like it was described. It was a great value and very clean.","perfect location for my trip to SLC, clean and comfortable apartment 👍🏼","Highly recommended. Got everything I need in a compact space. Will surely my airbnb of choice if I go back at Salt Lake.","Host was responsive! The apartment was clean. Perfect little space for a few nights. My husband and I loved the chance for it to be just the two of us. The location was great, and close to downtown."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great communication","value":"100% of recent guests rated Dale 5-star in communication."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["This place is just what it claims to be - clean, quiet, safe, and basic. Our dog enjoyed walks in the neighborhood and everyone we met was friendly. Communication with the host was exceptional. We spent a month and had plenty of room to work and relax.","It is definitely not luxurious but it made for a perfect home for me and my 2 dogs for 3.5 months while I did some travel work there. You can definitely hear everything upstairs and I had both loud and quiet upstairs neighbors. But The landlords have no control over that. I appreciated their availability and communication.","Extremely nice host who got me food while I was on bed-rest, nice and quiet neighborhood that is close to a beautiful park. Only possible downside is if you have noisy upstairs neighbors (which absolutely wasn't the case for me, my upstairs neighbors were nothing short of amazingly nice and extremely considerate).","Definitely not luxury digs! No dishwasher, garbage disposal, and no way to regulate the temperature—the upstairs guests have access to the thermostat. We were there for 3 months and I might stay there again because the hosts were so nice. The location is close to shopping and Temple Square and Liberty Park. The bed was really comfortable.","Really great host and a very good location. Everything we needed for a comfortable stay.
I would stay again","Dales place was very clean and simple but provided everything you might need for a lengthy (or short) stay. Dale was very helpful and offered his sled and other things when he knew we were going out or might need something. We enjoyed our stay and getting to know his family! Very close to downtown and a nice park in walking distance.","Pros: Dale and Queeni are great hosts and happy to help you with whatever you may need. They were always quick to ask us about our day and share some good suggestions. Also, you can’t beat the location for the same price. I worked downtown and it took me less than 10 mins to drive to work. Also, it was nice have access to a washer/dryer and our own kitchen to cook meals.

Cons: Sound moves very easily through the floor, so we could often hear them upstairs. No control over the temperature unless you bring/buy your own space heater/fan. Many encounters with spiders once it started to get hot in the summer, though that’s likely part of staying in a basement apartment."]

reviews:
["Wow where do I start! Rachel was the most thoughtful host i’ve ever stayed with. She thought of EVERYTHING you could need and then some. The place was beautifully decorated and stocked with anything and everything you could need for a short stay. She even had a cleaner come by and change out my sheets and towels and spruce the place up! I could not recommend Rachel more as a host ! Ten/ten would recommend!!!","Rachel was amazing in responding and making sure our weekend was a wonderful one for our anniversary. She went above and beyond which was very nice and it helped to make our stay in Salt Lake relaxing and wonderful. We appreciate her attention to detail in the way the place was put together. Amazing! We also appreciated her efforts throughout the weekend and contact she had with us. Very very clean and that was much appreciated as well. thank you so much!","For my first experience getting an AirB&B I never felt more comfortable. Rachel and Chris are great hosts and is very responsive, they give you activities to do around the area, especially for me being it was my first time in Utah. If i could i’d give 6/5 stars. I’m looking forward to staying at their place again!!","Absolutely AMAZING location, home and host. Rachel went above and beyond with us and I will forever say what makes a great Airbnb is the host. We will 100% recommend to all our friends and will be back again if we are in the Utah area.","An easy 5-star rating. Rachel has been very communicative throughout our stay and ensured we had a comfortable visit. Rachel provided us with local food recommendations and elevated the experience with personalizing our stay with local treats and drinks. She was extremely accommodating for inconveniences outside her control. Thank you for hosting my husband and I!","I’ve stayed in salt lake a handful of times and I would recommend this place over all others.

Would highly recommend!","Great place to stay!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Lynn is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Thanks for another great stay. Your place is my \"go to\" in SLC.","Lynn’s place is awesome! Stayed here for a month while working remotely and it was everything I needed in an awesome location with great views of Salt Lake and the Wasatch.

And if you happen to be a mountain biker this is heaven. Multiple trail heads basically in the backyard 😎","This was a great little weekend away as I was only in town for a convention. I am a big fan of public transportation so I took the bus and then just hiked up the rest of the way. It wasn’t too bad but it was definitely a trek! I saw a family of deer eating flowers one day while going back up and it was the most amazing thing ever. Some great views to just take in and close by for the trails. A great place to just be and relax. Lynn was an excellent host and very accommodating and a wonderful communicator. Checking in was so quick and easy. Will definitely have to come back.","Lynn was a kind and responsive host, who really went the extra mile to make me feel comfortable.

Her home was in a lovely, quiet area of SLC, with a private backyard, and a breathtaking view of the city, which was exactly what I wanted after all the noise of the event that I was there to attend.

The room itself was well-appointed, with a lot of attention to detail (she even left a lovely bar of chocolate on my pillow!). The bed was very comfortable, the towels were thick and fluffy, the shower was deeply massaging on my head and skin. I loved having my own private bathroom and entrance. On several occasions, I even got to 'visit' with a family of deer in the yard! It was a deeply healing experience overall.

Thank you so much, Lynn, for your lovely space, and all your kindnesses! 💗 I am deeply grateful, and I am looking forward to staying here again!","Lynn was a terrific host, and this was an excellent place to stay. It’s in an ideal location and had everything the two of us needed for a week stay.","Lynn was amazing! First off the place is super clean, quiet and private. Second, Lynn is very communicative and accommodating. I pulled up and she greeted me with a bottle of wine. I went vintage shopping in town found a pair of Levi’s that were ripped and Lynn happens to be a wonderful seamstress! She repaired my pants! Sooooo sweet. I’ll definitely be coming back. ⭐️🕺💕","My father was the guest (for the second time) and he had this to say:

My second stay at City Lights deserves as positive a review as my first stay.

This time I want to make known a feature no other SLC Airbnb can boast. Nearly every day I would walk back from the Shriner’s Hospital, then along 11th Ave leading to The Greater Avenues Water Conservation Demonstration Garden at the base of Terrace Hills Drive, and then on up to City Lights. Aside from the health benefits this uphill climb provided, the view, especially at night turning into sunrise of the lit up Utah State Capital Building far below beneath a starry sky far above, each night was something to behold."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Original historic architectural beauty. Clean, beds are comfortable. Some quirky things about the rentals but to be expected for how old the building is.

If you like original historic architecture, an appreciation for woodland areas and trees , with clean comfortable spaces. This is a good option for affordable rates","We loved our stay. Communication from the host was terrific. The place was toasty warm, even though it was very cold weather. The bed was comfortable. The shower had two options, including a rain showerhead, which we appreciated. Parking in back was convenient. Only warning I would give to others is spots are tight if you have a long vehicle. We drove a truck and the tail was sticking out into the alley a bit, even when pulled all the way to the fence. Was totally fine and worked out. But worth pointing out.","Totally enjoyed our stay felt right at home","An interesting place.. Location was amazing but it definitely feels unfinished. Half painted walls and kitchen was pretty strange. For the price and location, not bad but wouldn't stay again.","It was a great location, but in an extremely old house. The pictures are deceiving in that it appears as a newer place. The codes also work for both sides of the duplex which was very worrisome and the landlord tried to fix it but they both still worked for the same code.
The bed was extremely uncomfortable but they did purchase us a pillow top for the mattress which helped tremendously for our terrible backs. The location was great close to downtown","Great stay! reviews: ["perfect place for a stay in SLC","Just stayed for one night, it was a perfect place for me and my pup passing through! Very clean, nice, and quiet.","Great place for a solo traveler","good","We had an unfortunate stay at this place. The place itself was fine, clean, albeit small (which they mentioned). We had to leave early in the morning to travel back home, and when we tried to leave the driveway was blocked in. There are multiple airbnb units in this house and another airbnb guest must have not read the directions on their account. However, there was also no signage at the house that could have alleviated the issue. We contacted the host who didn’t get back to us for a few hours (it  was 5am when we called) and airbnb support was also not helpful because they couldn’t reach the host. After knocking on all of the other unit doors for about 30 minutes, we got the person to move the car. A frustrating experience. After we left, Airdream messaged saying they “hope your experience of getting blocked in would not reflect negatively on your review” as it would “impact our host count” which felt like they cared more about their reviews than our experience.","Short but sweet visit.","this place was great! quiet neighborhood, super close to downtown SLC, and the host always responded super quick! the bed and pillows were a bit too firm for me but otherwise this place was perfect!"]

reviews: ["Best place to stay","This Airbnb went beyond my expectations! The best place to throw our feet up, shower, get in a great nights sleep in the comfy king bed, and see some of the sights of salt lake. The host is very friendly and the private entry was very easy. We were able to park right near the door making unpacking a breeze. The kitchen had everything we needed and the fridge was very spacious! The location was also only a short walk from a Whole Foods and a plethora of food options. If I ever pass through Salt Lake City again, without a doubt I will have to stop by this wonderful spot again and I recommend to anyone else as well!","This is our third stay! All as described and, as usual, everything went smoothly. Super convenient location the U, downtown. Lots of walkable food options and Trader Joe’s. Convenient to Trax. The pool furniture looked like it got an upgrade and we enjoyed since it was 100 + degrees","Great studio apartment for my daughter and me. We were in SLC for a concert and the apartment worked out perfectly. When we arrived, it was missing clean bedding for the fold out couch. The management responded immediately and delivered brand new bedding practically within minutes. It is a small place. I wouldn't recommend it for more than two people. Otherwise, close to everything, clean, nice pool/hot tub. Thanks!","We really enjoyed the location of this condo. We went there for a concert and we were able to walk to the stadium! The place was super clean. My only compliant is that when the AC shuts off it makes a bunch a super loud noises- that kept waking us up in the middle of the night. The owner was very accommodating and quick to reply to us!","Fantastic stay. They communicate very well also which I love!","Comfortable apartment with well equipped kitchen, within walking distance to restaurants and shops and transportation. And it is quiet too!"]

reviews:
["Todd’s house was very pleasant. My pup and I crashed there for the night as we were passing through the city.

Todd is super sweet and totally made me feel at home.

Thanks Todd!!","Everything about our quick 1 night stay was awesome. Easy location to get to, plenty of street parking, great amenities, and pet friendly with friendly dogs. Tom tastefully decorated for the Halloween season too. I felt at home.","Location was great, the house was comfortable and welcoming, as was Todd. That room shares a bath with one other bedroom, but in 3 days I never even saw the other guest. The price was very reasonable, without the usual airbnb monster cleaning charges. Thanks, Todd!","Spent a great extended weekend with Todd and all was great. We just needed somewhere to shower and sleep, but I could definitely see this being a good place to stay for a longer trip. Bed is a little firm if you’re picky about that, but we slept well and it was great value for the price","Todd has done a great job making this room cozy and cute. It has everything you need and nice touches like a vintage mini-fridge in the room. Todd was responsive and welcoming. We enjoyed our short stay and would definitely come back."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Llegada por cuenta propia","value":"Realiza la llegada fácilmente con la cerradura con teclado."},{"name":"Sharon es SuperAnfitrión","value":"Los SuperAnfitriones son anfitriones experimentados, con evaluaciones excelentes, que se esfuerzan al máximo por ofrecer estancias maravillosas."},{"name":"Excelente ubicación","value":"El 100% de los huéspedes recientes calificaron la ubicación con 5 estrellas."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Estados Unidos
reviews: ["I stayed in the house of Sharon and Steve for 2 months. I had the best time! The room and the house in general is very cosy and is always very clean! The room has a terrace perfect for morning coffee’s with the best view. Also the location is beyond perfect! Very safe and pleasant neighbourhood. The bus i took to university at a daily basis stopt just around the corner and the city centre is within a nice walking distance. However, the biggest reason you should stay here is to get to meet Sharon and Steve, two wonderful, welcoming, kind and caring hosts! I had the best time and would recommend everyone to stay here!","Absolutely wonderful place! Not to mention a great value, too. Walking distance to downtown as well as great hiking toward the Capital. Sharon and Steve were such great hosts, and Frankie was great at giving us love (except when he got mischievous and tried to steal our little Baby Yoda!) 🤣","What a wonderful retreat! I would highly recommend staying at this home if you’re looking for comfort, hospitality, cleanliness and location!","We were in Salt Lake City for a 4 day Argentine tango event.  We loved staying in this house.  Wonderful hosts, with a cute dog named Frankie.  We didn't even need to rent a car. We used the convenient TRAX light rail right in font of the airport to downtown and then took a bus to their location not too far away. All for $1.25 (senior rate). Their quiet neighborhood is called the Lower Alphabet, and it is filled with lovely older homes. There is a Smith's grocery store within walking distance, and also a Tibetan restaurant.  In the evening we took a Lyft to our dance venue about a mile away.","Sharon and Steve were excellent hosts.  They do a great job of making their guests feel welcome in their house, and keep it well equipped.  I enjoyed my two weeks there, and would highly recommend.","Sharon’s place was perfect for my stay. The room is spacious and sunny and the house itself had everything I needed. Highly recommend.","Sharon and Steve are amazingly kind the generous people. Don’t think twice about staying here, just do it !"]
Bathroom: 1 full bathroom and 1 powder room shared

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I stayed and Gabriel's place for a month. Everything was perfect.
Gabriel was very accommodating. Communication was great!
And YES, I did make good use of the Pool, Hot tub and clubhouse.
If I have needs to stay again in this area, I will definitely stay here again.
Thanks for everything Gabriel!

~Randy","I can't say enough good things about Gabriel and this apartment. Everything was perfectly clean and Gabriel bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. Apartment is in a very central location, complete with hot tub, gym and an outdoor pool (which we didn't use because of the weather).
The apartment was quiet and conducive to getting a good night's sleep every night. Kitchen was well stocked, and allowed us to cook at home a few nights. If you're looking to stay in SLC, look no further.","Drinking and a loud music you can’t even sleep. He is bringing a lot of friends in the apartment that are doing parties","Fantastic place in a great location! Gabriel is a super chill guy who is very accommodating and loves chatting about things. Loved that he checked in with me frequently, even though we didn't see each other much. Highly recommend!","Gabriel made us feel at home. The apartment has a great pond/garden view and is in a great location with a gym, a swimming pool, and a beautiful clubhouse. We are looking forward to booking the place in the future.","10 stars
Always a good time with Gabe 👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽","I don't like leaving bad reviews and I really had better expectations based on the previous reviews but that wasn't the case. It felt as though the host was just trying to run an airbnb on the side without putting much effort into it. I didn't like the kitchen floor being dirty as well as the carpet in my room, or that the TV didn't work (not hooked up to internet and is set on Spanish mode) or that there was not extra toilet paper in the bathroom ( like I legit ran out and had to find other means) or that the kitchen was inadequately supplied, food left in open pans in the fridge and dishes left in the sink my entire stay. Also you HAVE to have a coffee maker, come on Even bad hotels have those. The upside is the gym is right down the hall and very nicely equipped. And it is in a nice location, conveniently located to everything you need. overall I wouldn't stay there again though. The host needs to pay more attention to minor details."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Evolve is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great location for exploring SLC, and Barbara, the on-site contact, was kind and responsive and helpful. The mattress was comfortable and the appliances all worked fine.

The room itself was awkwardly appointed (no sink in bathroom, bare walls, loud ac, and could hear neighboring guests talk/music) It was adequate, if a bit overpriced, for a short two night stay.

If you’re bringing a pet, be sure to read the House Rules thoroughly before booking based on the “pet friendly” you see at the top of the listing. House Rules is where you’ll find the $100 pet fee.","I wish I had read the reviews before we booked here. My husband and I came to Utah for our honeymoon and booked this listing, which was billed as a \"Couple's SLC Retreat.\" We paid more than we would have for a hotel. When we arrived, it was set up like a dormitory, with a bunch of adjacent rooms all side-by-side We could hear our neighbor talking on his phone at low volume. We found ourselves whispering and tip-toeing around the room. There was no art on the walls and floor was bare concrete with no rugs. The bathroom didn't have a sink in, so you had to walk to the kitchen to wash your hands after using the bathroom. The towels that were provided all had stains on them. There wasn't a countertop or electric plugs in the bathroom, so there was no space to get ready or do your hair. In the end, we left after 1 night and ended up booking a hotel in (which was less expensive, and much nicer).","Great location, nice and clean, easy check-in process.","great place","Place was well maintained and perfect for a quick stay.","You can smell and hear ever other rental units food and conversation. There is no sink in the bathroom and the room is not well ventilated. There was an unbearable smell when we checked in. We left immediately. Parking is a nightmare also.","Nice place to stay, got everything you need for your stay"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["This place was in a great area with lots around to do and in walkable distances. The home was very cute and clean.","This apartment is homey and secure. It is off the beaten path but within a few blocks of downtown. There is a hill to be aware of if you are walking. As it is a basement apartment, there is a little noise from upstairs and a cold floor. Neither of these detracted from the comfort of my stay. I loved having Keurig coffee. The shower has good water pressure and is nice and hot.","Great place to stay in the heart of Salt Lake City.","We loved staying here! It was a lovely tiny place, just big enough for my husband and I, and despite the parking being public we always managed to find a spot fairly close by. It was a cozy place to come back to at the end of a long day at a book con, and we would gladly stay here again in the future!","Vaughan's place is one of the best all-around Airbnbs I have ever stayed in- super clean, great amenities provided (smart TVs, laundry, shampoo/conditioner). We cooked an entire Thanksgiving dinner in the kitchen for reference. Vaughan is very responsive and accommodating. Everything was great, we will be back!","This Airbnb was perfect for our stay. It was super cozy with beautiful updated floors, fixtures, and appliances. I especially loved the mounted heater/ac in the living room and the couch was very comfortable for sleeping. My friend slept in the bedroom and was happy with how comfortable the bed was. Lastly, the tenants upstairs were nice and had a cute dog and we spoke with them real briefly. Vaughan is a wonderful host who made sure we were well taken care of and gave detailed and updated instructions every step of the way. I’ll definitely consider staying here again if I ever need to come back to SLC.","We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this apartment.
