reviews: ["Michelle was wonderful. She is one of the nicest people I have ever met. I felt safe and secure. The trailer was bigger then the pictures show.  She had great communication. It has everything you need for your travel.","I loved the RV. Everything was perfect, super clean and tidy.  I liked that there were signs on the walls indicating everything. It was easy to follow all the instructions and to get into the RV. I would return without a doubt. Whenever I needed anything, Michelle and Bryan were always helpful. My family and I had a great time. I have told my friends what a great experience it was. Thank you so much!!","I came mainly for work but since my father wanted to see Utah, I decided why not make it interesting. We LOVED the camper! I travel a lot and have stayed in very cheap hotels/motels to expensive ones to hostels and let me say this, the camper was spotless and smelled amazing than most expensive motels. The camper has a functional kitchen, dining area, living/bedroom, bathroom, and bedroom.  The host was very kind and would respond very fast whenever we had questions/concerns. They only thing I will say is that if you or your travel buddy is a very light sleeper, then I don't recommend this place. I slept like a baby and felt safe. Also, the touch of details was perfection!","This place is amazing! Very spacious trailer. The kitchen is a pretty good size. Bed was a Queen I think and very comfortable. Shower had hot water and good pressure. They have a tv in the living room with Netflix on it. We had a small hiccup with the trailer, but the host were very tentative with it and we had it resolved very quickly. Highly recommend this place!","This place is amazing. It’s very clean and it has sufficient space. I am a tiny person but I could have two other people in there and not feel crowded! I loved the shower! The water pressure is amazing. They did a great job in providing all the necessities. Easy check in and efficient communication. I would say that if you’re looking to stay here it would be easier if you have a car because there’s no easy access to public transportation and Ubers get lost and you have to look for them lol. Everything else is perfect. I didn’t get to explore Utah that much because honestly I preferred staying in the Airbnb 😅. The cute finish they provided was the two chairs with the table on the outside if you wanted to sit outside. I would definitely do that again."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Fast wifi","value":"At 67 Mbps, you can take video calls and stream videos for your whole group."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["My partner and I stayed here for over a month.
-Area does not feel safe - I witnessed a car break in on the street
-House itself has good security
-Good wifi
-Clint’s response times are unreliable
-For hot tub, you pay $10 and ask to fill it up - and that takes hours. They drained it as soon as we got out. I’m not sure if this is for cleanliness or what the reasoning is, but we would've liked to use the tub for the duration of our stay.
-Sheets and bedding good quality but bed sinks inward.
-Freezing in the room at points, had to contact twice. Finally asked for the space heater that Clint offered.
-Kitchen has good amenities but garbage disposal clogs.
-Toilet seat not put together properly
-Back entrance infested with boxelder bugs and dead cockroaches on the walking path outside. During the last two days of our stay, we encountered two cockroaches in the room.
Overall, We liked it enough to renew our stay midway through, but probs better options out there.","The location is alright. The house is clean. The sheets are good quality and well done. The communication with host can be better. Overall good place to stay for a short while","A very comfortable stay and it was everything I needed it to be. The bedroom was very relaxing and the house plants really help this.
Its in a quiet area but conveniently located very close to a tram station. You can use this to get into town, and it also stops right outside Utah Jazz's stadium. Also, there is a freezone for the tram so check that out too.
Definitely worth staying here.","It was perfect","Clint's space is very clean and well kept. The August home system keeps everyone safe. Bathroom amenities are amazing. I appreciate the coffee maker!!!

I will definitely want to come back when I visit Salt Lake City again.","The location of Clint house was perfect for me close to my show easy parking in front of the house very clean room and if you like plants like me you will love the greenery in the room. It was nice to have private bathroom with nice shower and a very comfortable bed. I did not meet Clint but we talked on the phone , definitely will try to stay there again in my next trip to Salt Lake City.","Great stay in a great location."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Cozy,Comfy and clean place! Very Hospitable Host.Arthur is great! Would Highly recommended!!!","nice place. I liked it there.","Clean and safe and convenient","Overall if you are looking for a cheap and inexpensive place to lay your head in SLC (and near downtown) then this works perfectly. As someone who biked into the city and its outer suburbs, this place was located perfectly to everything. However, I will admit the bed was a bit uncomfortable, and only having one pillow throughout part of it was also unfortunate.

However, I did ask for questions like an extra pillow or about cancellation and you all responded well enough. However, it was satisfactory for the cheap price. If you need a place to rest your head and need a kitchen without all the luxury of a higher-end hostel or private room than this place works. This is not saying the place is dangerous but simply good for what you pay for in this particular hostel.","There is a newer residence that I would recommend over this one just down the road.

This wasn’t nearly as clean as the other Hostel, and seemed to have some organizational problems when I was there.

Overall the folks staying there were very kind and helpful, and great to chat with.

I met the owners father, who was a very interesting guy, pretty awesome stories he had!

Overall good price!"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, États-Unis
reviews:
["En la noche salió un poco de agua pero muy fría y ya en la mañana no salió ni una gota más…
Había un botón rojo encendido que hacía mucho ruido debajo de la cama y lo apagué en la noche para poder dormir…
La calefacción solo calentaba mi cara mientras dormía pero el resto del lugar está helado, oscuro y con olor a viejo…
Las pocas gavetas o gabinetes que habían abiertos tenían objetos inesperados e innecesarios, el resto estaban cerrados con precintos blancos, no encontré ningún lugar donde guardar nadaaaaaa…
El único enchufe que había en el cuarto estaba demasiado lejos y debajo de la cama me tuve que arrastrar por el piso sucio para poder encontrar usar electricidad…
El gabinete (botiquín) del baño no cerraba. La cortina del shower estaba sucia.
El refrigerador tenía objetos innecesarios vencidos.
La cama era como dormir en el piso con una colchoneta muy delgada…
En general fue desastroso, espantoso, horrible lo peor que me ha pasado en mi vida.","Great stay! Thank you."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Fast wifi","value":"At 216 Mbps, you can take video calls and stream videos for your whole group."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Lauren Assistant is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great place to stay! Perfect","This place was EXTREMELY clean. It had everything we needed and very walkable to downtown with lots of places to eat along the way. The view out the window was nice and the host was very responsive when we had questions. We would definitely stay here again.","I had an amazing stay at this Airbnb! The check-in was very smooth with clear, detailed instructions. The apartment was very clean and comfortable. The location was perfect due to it being in the city. I was near plenty of restaurants and shopping centers. I 10/10 recommend this Airbnb.","Very nice stay. A bit far from Trax if you're not used to walking!","I enjoyed my week-long stay here! Lauren provided really in depth instructions that helped me get in and settled fast. Throughout the whole stay, I appreciated the response time — I had an issue at 6 AM and Lauren responded within minutes.

The apartment is clean and stocked with extra towels, sheets, toilet paper, etc. It also had spices and cookware if you wanted to do some cooking. There’s also a full water filter in the fridge. There’s also a fully stocked Roku TV with more channels than I’ve ever seen. You also get a nice view of downtown SLC. The ABnB is inside an apartment complex, so you need to use a key fob to get around.


Also, you get a parking space inside the building (the garage is in the building) which provides shelter from the weather and gives peace of mind.

Location is perfect if you’ve got business or sightseeing in downtown SLC. I was 4 minutes away from North Temple Square. Despite the proximity, it was blissfully quiet inside. There was no traffic on the road outside.

Overall, this is a great place to stay and I recommend it!","Wonderful stay and location","perfect studio for exploring Salt Lake. clean, easy, and great value"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Appson Corporate Housing is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great place wonderful communication!","I was in town for an extended work trip for a month, and it helped that this place really felt like home. The furniture was cozy, apartment stocked with needs and the building amenities gave me a nice break from the inside of the apartment to explore the grounds. I also loved the trash system, in having to just place outside of the door versus having to take it somewhere specific. I had a few maintenance requests while being there too, and the host responded very quickly and requests were handled by the next day. It was also a great location.

The only ‘downside’ I would say, is that the buildings infrastructure may need some updating because you can hear everything through the walls from toilet water in the drainage system, to full conversations in the next apartment. You get used to it and it wasn’t the worst thing in the world, but if you’re sensitive to sound it could seem to be a bit noisy in that way.

All in all, it was a great stay and I’d recommend!","We really enjoyed our stay, easy comfortable and exactly as advertised thank you for the communication throughout the whole trip.","Great new apartment. Super clean and convenient to most everything.","GREAT location, central to everything, nice apartment with everything you need! Bed is soft and super comfy but I’m used to a hard bed so I didn’t sleep well but that’s not the fault of the host obviously. The communication was the fastest and best of any host I’ve ever stayed with!","Absolute 5 stars. Appson Corp Housing did well in every aspect of my stay! They were quick to reply and flexible in working around my schedules. I had a last minute need to extend my stay and they approved in minutes. Thanks again for hosting me! Highly recommend staying with them when visiting Salt Lake City.","Very clean and comfy apartment. Perfect for a week-long stay. I was able to cook and do laundry as needed while in town for a ballet intensive. Very close to a starbucks, walgreens, a grocery store, and some cute bar/restaurants. An easy 20 minute walk to the more central downtown area, although i had to figure out the right route to avoid some sketchy corners. Also comes with a parking spot in the garage if you've got a car. Would stay again!"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I would rent again let's just say that...","great stay!","Pros
- easy access to freeways
- easy access to premises & plenty of parking
- timely communication and responses from host
- Furniture, bedding, countertops, floor and bathroom were all clean
- Spacious and not cramped
- Heater works awesome

Cons
- Smell: Scale of 1-10, distinct odor @ 5 when walking into the room but didn't notice it once inside room
- Kitchen: Teflon was scratched off the 3 pots and pans I was going to use. Enough scratches to make me not want to use them. Coffee maker didn't have the release spring (?) so the coffee just fell out and cascaded over the coffee pot onto the counter. Almost all the utensils had some food on them.
- Bathroom: Doesn't have a sink so for anyone looking to cook or stay longterm, be prepared to use the limited kitchen counter space for cooking and bathroom storage. There is a medicine cabinet in the bathroom but be careful b/c its located right above the toilet so put the toilet lid/seat down
- Bed: I slept on the futon couch almost every night. I could feel every individual spring in the mattress when laying on it. However, the futon was very comfy","Excellent location. Clean and convenient. No sink in the bathroom.","Pretty clean great location","Be prepared for sleeping on the worst mattress ever.","Great listing, great area close to a lot of good places. Only 1 room with 1 bed and a photon/couch set up. If you want privacy you will want 2 rooms.
Dishwasher, mini stove, shower, and room ac all great for not wanting to spend more than needed."]

highlights: [{"name":"Fast wifi","value":"At 594 Mbps, you can take video calls and stream videos for your whole group."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Kent is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Great find, right in the middle of Downtown Salt Lake. Kent is a very responsive and helpful host. Visited in the winter, I’m usually worried that the property won’t be warm enough, but the place was heated & toasty for my arrival! Appreciate the little touches. As an FYI - the ceilings are low as it’s a basement property, I’m 6ft and could just about stand straight in the bathroom. Not a deterrent, highly recommend (location + friendliness + walkability + amenities) , more for your own awareness.","Thanks Kent! We had a lovely stay—very comfortable and cute space in a great location.","Great location and is easy to find. I would recommend","Beautiful converted basement apartment. Kent was a great host. Very friendly, flexible, and responsive. The place was comfortable and easy to get to with great check-in instructions complete with pictures for us visual people 😊! The only complaint that I had was the height of the bathroom. It has an incredibly low ceiling. To be fair, the host does mention this in the House Rules but I didn’t expect it to be so low. I’m 5’9 and fit but I could barely fit in the shower. This bathroom has a ceiling that is only 4 inches from the top of my head and I had to really scrunch to wash my hair. I would not recommend for anyone that is over 5’11. Other than that, truly a great stay!","Kent was a great host! Gave very insightful instructions on everything. Check in and check out. Wife and I loved the coffee shop recommendations! Greta place next to the convention center, very quick scooter ride! 🛴","Apartment is a basement dive with a plastic and wooden door, does not give a feeling of safety or security. Wrote two messages: one upon making the reservation and another upon arriving and finding out the promised \"free parking\" didn't exist, which forced my family to leave the property early due to restrictive street parking rules (or else get a parking ticket). Never replied to the first, only replied to the second after I had already left the rental to say \"oops\". Gonna assume it's just unprofessionalism rather than an intentional scam, but either way it wasn't great.","Awesome spot in SLC. Will be staying here again!!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Elizabeth is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Overall, I felt unprepared for what to expect and a little bit mislead by the listing. Would have given 5-stars if it was honestly described. Wouldn’t stay here again for the soul reason that my guest and I could hear the people upstairs late into every evening.

The good; easy to find, clear instructions, host is friendly and attentive, nice location, washer/dryer

The bad; not stocked (toilet paper, water, towels, etc), can audibly hear conversation/footsteps/dogs upstairs late into the evening and early morning, one “bedroom” is a bed in the common space/living room, there are dogs on the property","Elizabeth is an excellent host. Check in went smoothly, as Elizabeth delivered instructions for how we check in before the visit via the Air B&B platform. The suite itself was clean, new-looking, and very comfortable. I appreciated that the TV had Netflix in addition to other channels. This part of Murray is so beautiful— in the summer months when we stayed here, the mountains were bright & green. I highly recommend this suite for anyone looking for a getaway with 2-5 people. I’m sure the winter has just as much beauty to offer, too. Thanks, Elizabeth!","Great place to stay for the price! We could definitely hear kids, a dog, and other adults talking at various times during our stay, but that didn't bother us at all. Also, would recommend you bring your own bottled water as none is provided. But other than that, the beds were comfy, and the entire set up was like having a little home away from home!","Great place would definitely stay again","Clean and comfortable. Would stay again.","Elizabeth is a very nice host, very quick and friendly in the communication, she helps wherever she can. Where she unfortunately can not help: the family lives upstairs of the rented flat in the basement and the ceiling is too thin. You can hear every conversation and each step, it is extremely loud, especially early in the morning, kid(s) and a dog are running above your head... :-( Acoustic isolation could improve the situation, because the apartment is quite nice.","Great place. Great host."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

reviews: ["My Friend and I stayed at Suzy's place and it was delightful. The home was very clean and cozy, downstairs where we stayed was kept cool during the hot summer days. reviews: ["To the one concern I had when looking at this listing,  that it’s in a main thoroughfare, we were pleasantly surprised that there was no street/traffic noise. reviews:
["It’s a nice and private place, and a little cold but they have a heater there, just turn it on if gets too cold for you.","The hosts were responsive and helpful. The unit is well-appointed and in a good location.","Good place, nice owners","House was gorgeous and very neat! It got cold as basement units do sometimes but the hosts have a space heater in the unit which was amazing. Very fast response times and overall a lovely stay :)","Dave & Brittney's apartment is so perfect for the traveling couple. We came out to see our daughter graduate from Westminster College, and then help pack up her belongings. The apartment is so conveniently located to local grocery and other stores. A short hop to the highway can Bring you to the other side of the city very quickly!

The apartment is extremely neat and clean. It was especially nice that there are two rooms. The bedroom, and kitchen/living area. The family lives in the home above, however we never saw or heard from them. Very quite home. Parking offers a U-driveway, which is very convenient to be able to drive around and not have to back out into the street. The driveway is wide enough for cars to park on one side, and still be able to easily drive around the U, and we had a large truck.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with Dave & Brittney. They are conveniently close to our son who lives around the corner with his housemates. We are keeping this home in mind to book for future stays in SLC.","Great place and location. Easy to the mountains, downtown and some great eats near by.","A great stay in a cozy basement unit with everything you need."]

highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Andrew is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Andrew's place is a small, cute space close to downtown but out of the fray, so it's nice and peaceful. He's also a very communicative and helpful host. Very happy with my stay.","A short distance to vivint arena where the JAZZ won 2 out of 3 during my stay","Great location, didn’t need to go far at all to get to where we needed to during the stay. The amenities were great, the height of some of the cabinets made it a little awkward, but there was a step stool provided for reach.

My only issue is the neighbors sharing the bedroom wall seemed to have a small child that was permitted to stay up to nearly midnight and make noise most nights, and at times the parents’ impatient voices came through as well , which wasn’t ideal when we were there for a surgery and the week-long recovery prior to the post-op visit. Otherwise they were to themselves and there were no issues. I don’t necessarily fault them for this, I understand the difficulties of parenthood, and it’s no different than what you might get staying at a hotel, but this is also something we hoped to avoid by getting an Airbnb instead.

The floor has a slope to it, it didn’t pose any problems for us but it might for some.","Awesome place to stay at","We had a really great experience. This was my second AirBnB experience...far far far better than my first....Thank you for helping to make our time in Salt Lake an awesome time. We would love to come back and stay again.","Cute, homey space that is located perfectly for hiking/ rock climbing excursions. The hosts are very kind and are great about communication. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Evolve is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Very updated dimming light switches. Compact , yet comfy nice room, could have been mopped.
They didn’t inform us there was construction going on in the front house. The contractor was a little rude.
The first night there was a problem with a barking dog from someone else staying there. The rep from Evolve told us there has been many complaints about it and he was trying to get it under control.","A convenient place to spend the weekend! The place is one of a number of studio apartment style rooms on what appears to be an addition to a conventional Salt Lake neighborhood single-story home. Self check-in with both exterior and interior door codes was convenient and felt safe. Kitchen is VERY well stocked with dishes, utensils, cookware, and containers. The bed was SO comfortable, and I appreciated the conveniences of the AC unit in the room and the smart tv! The bandaid-colored epoxied cement floors were a weird choice, but the room was well-furnished and comfortable. I did have a mild issue with cleanliness, but after some communication with the host, the problem was resolved. The host is a real estate group that has 453 listings on Airbnb (as of this moment anyway), so be aware that you should just reach out to the local contact they provide instead of using the Airbnb messenger. I would stay here again in the future!","Nice place to stay. Very nearby of the shopping center, park and coffee shop.
I highly recommend it.","The place is as-advertised. Well situated and close to almost everything. Parking isn’t an issue. The residence is shared amongst 4 rented units, but each is a private room with a kitchenette and bathroom. I never noticed any other guests and I sleep during the day.","Location is good to ski resort around SLC.","functional unit","Great stay, great host.
We has a good time and they were very accommodating."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Highly rated Host","value":"Evolve has received 5-star ratings from 90% of recent guests."},{"name":"Great communication","value":"95% of recent guests rated Evolve 5-star in communication."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great spot. Would definitely stay here again","Great location. Central to tons of options. Super clean. Lots of room.","Pros: Easy to get to
Easy to check in
Everything a solo traveller needs inside the unit

Cons: The second night at the Airbnb my vehicle was parked in the driveway of the unit and someone wandered through the backyard, broke into my truck and stole most of my personal belongings. The Airbnb does not have 2 cameras as it claims to. The host was largely unhelpful in the matter. The only camera they have has poor visibility. Pretty much ruined the rest of my trip as I still have no ID, credit cards, etc.. This is on top of all the personal items that were stolen that I will never be able to replace.

Conclusion: If you don’t mind the possibility of someone breaking into your vehicle (it was my second night of the first stop of a solo cross country road trip) and not getting any help from the rental company then maybe this place is for you. I personally wouldn’t ever come back or rent from this company again.","Located in the perfect area with secure and easy check in and check out. I was not sure what to expect and after 20 hours of driving it was such a relief checking in and setting our stuff down with no snags. This place is located in the perfect area with lots to do all around. I felt like I was in the heart of SLC without the traffic and noise.","Such a great space and very convenient for a ski getaway! The drive to the resorts was east and quick. Would definitely stay again!","Great place to stay. Nice location near downtown and easy drive to Park city as well! Would definitely stay here again","Great spot!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 400 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a common area."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Lauren (Assistant) is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Nicely decorated, nice to have a washing machine and dishwasher, large comfortable bed.

*Lots* of dust in non obvious places, like the crack under the dishwasher, under the carpet, behind the couch, on top of cabinets.

Very weird litigious rules threatening extra fees for things like being too loud. They admit to having a *microphone* in the unit to record noise levels, but somehow not record conversations.

The doorbells have cameras on them, sure that's fine. They also record audio, though. There is a whole historical record of videos on the security system unit, probably also stored on the Vivint company database. These happened to include private conversations from the neighbors across the hall, which was very weird to stumble on. The company which runs this apartment has access to all the videos. This is a very troubling intrusion of privacy.","Location location location!!! We walked to multiple great restaurants and a nice park! Be aware this unit is on the second floor and the stairs tiny. Would stay again!! Very comfortable mattress!!","Great plaçe and great host. She responds quickly. Everything you need is in the unit. Will definitely return.","Great location and accommodations. Lauren is great about communicating in a timely manner. Everything was as expected, very comfortable and clean. Love the location, easy walk to shopping and restaurants.","Older building. Cute comfortable clean unit. Right off of busy street, traffic kind of noisy. Parking behind building is pretty tight especially if you are driving a big pick up. A mile + from downtown. Staff very kind and responsive. Check in/check out very simple!","Cute place walking to trolley square.","Definitely the location was awesome. Just right out of downtown but, the city is so small that you can get there in 5mins. Such a cozy place, definitely will be staying again!"]

reviews:
["Brilliant stay at Daniel's place. Location was ideal, parking is easy, communication with the host was top notch. The space was perfect for my needs, as I was on a bit of an extended work trip. Would book again.","This apartment in downtown SLC is awesome. It’s a short Walk to City Creek or any of the downtown attractions. Convenient to the freeway and all the beauties Utah had to offer, this is the perfect place for a solo traveler, or couple who just needs a place to stay at night. Would definitely book there again!","I was in town to view some apartments downtown, as well as do some hiking and photography. This apartment was perfect for my trip as I was looking for something economical, minimalistic, and centrally located.

The apartment is comfortable, safe, quiet, and in a prime location. Walkable to stores, eateries, and parks. I think City Creek park right next to the building might be one of my favorite urban parks in the US.

Thanks again Daniel for your hospitality!","Daniels place was centrally located to everything you could need/want.","Great location, great space for the cost. It had everything I needed and was decorated so fun! Great communication from Daniel too. Parking was super easy, there was tons of street parking and covered parking for 1 car. Really close to downtown and very central to cool spots. Would stay again. As a solo traveler I felt comfortable too.","Perfect spot for SLC, especially if you have a car! It was so nice to walk right by city creek to get to and from the place, too. The place is small, and it’s definitely someone’s living space, but Dan was really nice and helpful throughout the process. The bed is actually quite comfortable, even though it’s kind of an awkward placement—the space is certainly limited, but enough for a couple. Definitely recommend.","Daniel's place was the perfect location and setup for some downtown business I had. It was close enough to walk to anything I needed--groceries, restaurants, the convention I attended--and covered parking is included! (Major perk for me. Have you seen parking garage prices lately?) The apartment is just as Daniel describes it--read the description all the way through--and he is very conscientious about communication. Definitely looking here first next time I need to go to SLC."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Great location","value":"90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"90% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["It is a nice unit in a good location.","Place is overpriced for the value. Lots of half-measures: bedroom is very hot but you’ll be provided with one of the cheapest fans on the market. AC is intensely loud. You’ll be sharing a narrow driveway with strangers (other guests, visitors, etc) who probably won’t proactively care enough to make sure you can get in and out of the driveway. Construction was happening on the site with lots of debris (including broken glass) left in the yard for several days. Sidewalk path overgrown by branches and weeds but when it was trimmed, all the clippings were left on the path/steps. You’ll be encouraged to walk through the lawn to get in and out of the unit; the path will be dark and often wet/muddy. Several of the pots & pans had scratched coatings or missing handles. Overall, no unsafe issues, but I don’t think the hosts were as proactive as I’ve experienced elsewhere or interested in excellence. For this price, you can get better in the SLC area.","The house is pretty and in a nice location. But I needed iron to straighten my cloth for the conference. I asked them if they have it and they said yes. There was none.","Very cute and a great location. We would stay here again !","Great place for a couple to stay when you just need somewhere to sleep and recover!","This is such a cute place. It’s very neat. The location is great as well.","Dallin’s apartment is in a lovely building surrounded by roses in a very pretty neighborhood. It is comfortable, clean, and well equipped, and was a great place for us to spend a weekend in SLC. There was an issue with the apartment not being ready at checkin, and Daniela handled it really well and made sure we were well taken care of. Would definitely recommend."]

Location_city: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."}]
location: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
reviews:
["the place is very nice and as described. parking is easy and the bed is comfy. the neighborhood is quiet. check out time is at 10am, but if you plan for that it's no issue. would stay here again.","DO NOT STAY HERE! The host accused me of peeing in drawers and around the unit and accused me also of pooping in the tub. i WOULD NEVER DO SUCH A THING. he demanded i pay him $1200 to clean a tub which is completely ridiculous . He claimed he needed to hire a hazmat cleaning crew...NONSENSE Lies. in the airbnb report he showed the tub and complained bout some empty plastic bottles i left on floor. He charged a clenaing fee YET complained bout cleaning. The host asked me to do the following which i did: wash the bedding, take out trash , wash the dishes which i all did YET he wanted $1200 on top of the cleaning fee i already payed before i booked. why is there a cleaning fee if im being asked to do half of the cleaning? The tub was left dirty by me being there 11 days and i used it alot but it was NOT damaged in any way and I'm sure the host will lie otherwise. I did not clea it myself because again...i dont clean tubs when i go stay at hotels so why would i here and also i was charged a cleaning fee. The tub can easily be cleaned with bleach and scrubbing. i know because i cleaned tubs myself many times.

1. The host does NOT live near or on premises. very sketchy.

2. several ppl have access to the code he gives you making your safety questionable.

3 the unit is considered abandoned and NO MAIL will be delivered here. i lost $$in packages

4. the host kept claiming there were pots in drawers..none were found when i arrived. i looked everywhere.


LIES LIES and LIES.

The host was obviously looking to scam airbnb and take advantage of them or of their insurance","Josh and the co-hosts were always available and answered our messages quickly. The apartment is functional and had everything that we need. It is also a 4min walk to the bus stop, which makes things easier for those who don't have a car. The swamp cooler also worked very well!","The pictures are accurate to the inside.

It's pretty good if you need a quick place to crash, BUT...

While the place is clean and the bed was really comfy, I could tell there is a pretty serious mildew issue that I could smell each time I entered the apartment and would suggest getting that checked.

Also, the location is not great. While we were able to walk and get groceries, on our last day, my wife and I separated for a mere couple minutes walking on the same road this Airbnb is on only to have a creepy guy pull up to her offering her money to get inside his car. We had to call the cops.

While this is a superhost, I really liked their automated messages at first to make sure we were having a good stay, but one of the automated messages was to kindly offer suggestions for improvement. We suggested something but was never acknowledged. It doesn't matter if the suggestion was implemented, but to be ignored rubbed me the wrong way. Especially since there are three hosts that could have responded and they were relatively quick to respond on everything else. A simple \"thanks for your feedback.\" would have gone a long way.

We almost tried to stay one more night so we didn't have to pack up yet, but glad we didn't. The cleaning fee is almost the same price as advertised for the place itself. We were charged $55 for the cleaning fee which we sucked up when we booked the place, but upon checkout, the host sent an automated message for cleaning instructions! Now we aren't trashy people and we did wash our dishes, but to be expected to wash our own sheets and take out the trash? Why are we paying for a cleaning fee? I would either charge significantly less for the cleaning fee or not expect the guests to do the laundry or take out the trash. One or the other. Airbnb shouldn't allow hosts to do that.","nice place to crash","Josh’s place is as described, please make sure you read it. There is no A/C but a swamp cooler keeps you comfortable even in almost 100 heat. Nice layout and appliances, clean, good parking in back. It’s a little narrow to get to the back but is good. Very convenient location. I had to end my stay early for a plumbing issue that happened but Josh and his co hosts were super responsive and easy to work with. I’d stay again if in town.","The hosts were lovely and this spot is super nice and quiet."]

["Fantastic neighborhood. Super nice hosts. A great choice for an SLC visit.","Joe's place was clean and cozy. Felt like home. Access to a full, modern kitchen, private bathroom, dog friendly and the one issue I did have (I broke the shower head) was fixed within minutes of alerting them. Great folks, great neighborhood and plus Ken was kind enough to brew me coffee every morning. How's that for service?!","I would have to say this is the best place to stay. Joe went above and beyond by miles for my family. I needed a location near the hospital as that was the reason for the visit, and happened to find this place. When I booked it I had no idea how good a choice I made.

After complications at the hospital I had to extend the stay and book another place. l was shocked at the difference in the other host rated just as high. Joe is 100% superior, 100% nicer, and better all around. Really nice place, very good host.

If I could give a higher rating, I would.","Joe and Ken are very welcoming and the private room was perfect for my short visit to Salt Lake City.

the perfect balance of being close to the city as well as a peaceful place to rest for the night.","Joe has a wonderful home in a beautiful neighborhood. He goes out of his way to make you feel welcomed, like one of the family, including my dog!

The shared kitchen and bathroom was fine.
I would definitely stay there again.","Joe's comfortable home is in a great location! Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Fast wifi","value":"At 97 Mbps, you can take video calls and stream videos for your whole group."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Lauren (Assistant) is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["great place","Stay a week in Salt Lake City for family reasons was great, quiet and comfortable, I highly recommend","This place was GREAT. One of my all-time best Airbnb experiences, exactly what I needed. I loved the location—within walking distance to downtown AND the capitol building and City Creek Canyon. Checking in and out was super easy and communication was extremely prompt and helpful. Kitchen was stocked enough to do a little cooking, there are smart TVs in every room, and a body wash/shampoo/conditioner dispenser in the shower. WOLRD. CLASS. Loved it, thanks, Lauren!","This place was really well decorated, well kept & homely. All amenities were as described in the listing. Its a great location with parking & is close to downtown. The host was very communicative, detailed & polite in their communication. I would highly recommend anyone visiting SLC to consider staying at this place.","The apartment was well kept and clean. The management of the apartment was easy to deal with and professional!","I was very excited when i found this place. Unfortunately it did not work well for my friends and I.


1. We checked in just fine. Although we had to carry our heavy luggage up stairs to the 3rd floor of the apartment complex.

Right after we checked in, we run into a problem - the lock didn't work so we couldn't leave the apartment. I reached out to Lauren and it took me a couple tries so she would believe me that the lock is not working (both, my friend and I spent about half an hour trying to lock the door). Finally, the handyman came.
It was about 8pm, we were tired after long distance driving and wanted to rest. But instead were listening the noise while handyman was trying to fix the lock. After he finished he just walked through the living room without even asking us if it was ok for him to walk in inside.

After that i reached out to Lauren asking if there will be some reimbursement for our troubles. She assured me that they would take care of it as customer satisfaction is their top priority. Unfortunately, it never happened.

They charge additionaly for each guest and for each extra hour of you staying there but they will not reimburse you for wasting your time and discomfort.

2. The second problem appeared right after. The air conditioner was running all the time non stop just blowing air. In the morning it was 74 degrees. All 4 of us woke up in the morning with a headache as apartment was overheated and there were no fresh air.

I reached out to Lauren and asked if someone could come and fix it. She just offered us to control the heat ourselves.

So, since the air conditioning was not working we had only 2 options: to turn it off or to listen to the loud noise non stop that was doing nothing. So we turned it off.

We were waking up with headaches 2 mornings in a row. Than i gave up and paid for an additiona hotel room and moved out 3 night before the end of stay.

This stay was a total nightmare.
Since it was nonrefundable i ended up paying for 2 places and it cost me almost $2 000 for 5 nights in Salt Lake and headache because of overheating for 2 days.

I travel a lot and usually stay through airbnb and i ALWAYS have great experience. Unfortunately not this time. I paid way over $200 a night staying in this place as they charged additionally for each guest plus they are very firm for you to check out before 11am or you will be charged additionally per each hour ... for this money i could stay in a very nice room at Marriott or Grand America and would have a much better experience and i could even extend a few more hours free of charge.

Positive things: the appartment is clean, well equipped and well furnished. But other than that - dont waste your money and time.","Great place to stay, very comfortable."]

reviews: ["Fantastic place to stay","I really enjoyed staying in this beautiful apartment.  It is very comfortable and welcoming. Also, the building is very well maintained and parking in the building was super easy and convenient.  My only regret - not having time to try the golf simulator.   Thank you again for everything.  I'll be back!  Jim","It’s a nice place","The condo was nice and clean and communication was great with the owner as well. The bathroom lighting could be brighter. Over all very nice and we enjoyed our stay.","The condo is located in a very convenient area. It’s not directly in the city center, but it has a lot of restaurants and stores in the area. When trying to find the condo, use the address for the apartment building, not the Mexican restaurant next to it where you park when you first get there.  I highly recommend staying in this condo!","Convenient location and great facilities","Great this place . I love near diferente stores ."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

reviews:
["Great location and cozy unit - was perfect for a getaway! Very clean and thoughtfully stocked.","Everything is as Kevin described and so much more. Very friendly and prompt with communicating through messages and in person.

Kevin's place is immaculate, beautifully decorated, and very comfortable. His home and neighborhood is quiet, peaceful, and feels very safe.

It is obvious that Kevin takes the greatest care and pride in providing the best experience for his guests. I appreciate his special attention to detail which include, but not limited to:

Detailed instructions and pictures on how to get through the alley on H Street to park in front of the Airbnb entrance. The kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room are fully stocked with everything (and more than) you need for a long and comfortable stay.

The location is prime, within walking distance of Downtown Salt Lake City, with many local shops and restaurants.

I highly recommend and would definitely re-book. Thank you for an excellent Airbnb experience, Kevin. Happy Holidays!!","Great basement apartment in the upper avenues","If you need a great place to stay in with an awesome Host in Salt Lake City, stay at Kevin’s place. It’s clean, comfy and has lots of extras that make the stay very convenient. Also, Kevin is very responsive.","Kevin’s place has everything you need for a comfortable stay. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great communication","value":"90% of recent guests rated Michael 5-star in communication."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Most comfortable bed thus far in an Airbnb stay. Location was perfect. Close to everything in the city center but with a neighborhood feel. The house has tons of character. Very very homey.","nice quick business stay","This place is comfortable, clean and in a great location for access to interstate and downtown. Beds were comfortable and kitchen had everything we needed.","Very spacious place at a great price!","My friend and I were attending a continuing education course at U of U and needed a place to stay close to campus (about a 15-minute drive) and large enough to have separate work spaces since we work remotely. This charming apartment was the perfect home base for our week in SLC.

The apartment makes up the second floor of the house and is full of character—a turret, arched entryways, chandeliers, ceiling medallions. That may not matter to some, but it appealed to me.

Beyond the aesthetic, the place was also practical. It is spacious (the two of us had loads more space than needed) and is well stocked. The kitchen has cookware, silverware, appliances, etc. to make cooking and eating in easy. The bathroom has a good stock of toilet paper, towels, and hair/body wash. In addition to the three bedrooms, there was also a nice living room area with a tv.

The apartment was also comfortable as it had nice bedding and furniture. The space has air conditioning which was a nice bonus during a week of 100-degree weather in July.

Michael was an excellent host who made check-in simple and convenient. He also communicated with me throughout my stay to update me about a minor internet issue. I was so appreciative of this.

I cannot express how at home I felt in this apartment. It was a little difficult to leave! It was everything I look for in an Airbnb experience.","Michael's home was extremely clean and more spacious in person than on pictures which was amazing 🤩. Whole home has a neat vintage home decor , King Bed and Pillows were super comfortable 🤗 Michael is always prompt and great with communication when you need, everything from kitchen utensils, cleaning supplies, bathroom linens etc were well stocked ! wifi was extremely fast as I was also working remote , commute to town and shopping centers were super convenient!, neighbors were very friendly would definitely recommend to anyone visiting SLC! , I definitely am going to come back to this place again!","Really enjoyed our stay here.
Close to everything we wanted and a fun, old-style home to stay in.
The king bed and pillows were extremely comfortable too.
The Internet was out the entire last day of our stay and I did not receive any communication or answers about it, but it was not a major issue for us.

Overall we had a great experience"]

Bring a navigator and the printed 8 page multi megabytes of instructions to get in. Coming in the dark, also a flashlight. Took me 40 minutes including getting a key fob with drained battery, lugging my stuff up do to broken elevator.

Bring your own paper goods. No tissues, napkins or paper towels here either. Tv remote batteries out also.

A bit of noise between neighbors and stairwells but elevator was broken. Strong cover scents in hall and apartment. Won’t be returning.

It's a nice quiet place to relax and unwind or to work your business or write. Anthony is really helpful and willing to help. reviews:
["what's not to love .. great location . quit and peaceful . most people don't review beds and comfort I do and rachs place is so comfortable I sleep like a baby . loved the washer and dryer as I was out of clean clothes when I arrived . loved the location near downtown .. loved the little couch and Hulu tv and Netflix !! loved her coffee and kitchen .. love love love how it's 45 minutes from Brighton .. love the little soaker outdoor tub !! I can't wait to come back !!","the little studio was the perfect size! it was cozy, clean, and safe. we could not be more pleased with our experience.","This was my favourite air bnb I’ve stayed in! So cozy and warm in the freezing weather. Comfy bed and a lovely kitchen and bathroom. Lots of ammenities and extras provided - cooking oil and spices, makeup removers, shampoo, conditioner, moisturiser and laundry detergent for washing. Rachelle was very friendly and responsive and check in was easy. It is also walking distance from local restaurants and a coffee shops. I highly recommend this cozy studio!","Rachelle's studio was spotless and the bed was comfortable. All of the check in/out instructions were prompt and easy to follow. She has many special touches and all the little details are taken care of right down to a yoga mat and make-up wipes. A lovely studio 5 minutes from downtown. I would definately stay here again!","Rachelle’s place was great! Perfect for a remote worker wanting to be close to downtown and in a safe, peaceful location. I especially appreciated all of the complimentary toiletries! Her gift package was also such a generous touch. The coffee was delicious! Can’t wait to try the waffle mix and berry jam :).","An absolutely adorable studio apartment! Very cozy, clean and modern! Rachelle has so many extra touches that make this airbnb stand out: full size GOOD shampoo and conditioner, flat iron (!!!), make up remover pads, french press coffee maker (with instructions: thank goodness 😊), ‘fancy’ coffee beans with a grinder, creamers, ‘fancy’ teas, Perrier water, a huge tv with access to Netflix, Paramount and other apps, full size washer/dryer, and so much more! I felt like I was at a spa! And Rachelle is so responsive! Truly the best airbnb I have stayed at. Oh and the murphy bed is COMFY!!!! I have paid so much more at other airbnbs, and gotten so much less in terms of comfort and amenities.
The location is awesome too. Walking distance to Liberty park, coffee shops, restaurants.
Thank you for being an awesome host Rachelle! I felt so pampered during my stay 😊
~julie","The place was super cute, clean and quiet, perfect for my needs. There were many little touches from super fluffy towels to a gift basket with coffee, jam and waffle mix. Rochelle was great about communicating and the place was exactly as she described. A good price for a nice place."]

The bathroom is luxurious and the room itself is VERY comfortable.

I loved the comfortable bed and the plush pillows! It really helped me recharge after a long trip into the US from Singapore and I slept very soundly.

The area around his place is quiet and if you are a fan of Mexican food, the Red Iguana (which was featured in Guy Fieri’s Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives) does not disappoint and it is just a 5 minute brisk walk to the main street. Their food is awesome and service is impeccable!

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Arrivée autonome","value":"Vous pouvez entrer dans les lieux avec une serrure à digicode."},{"name":"Excellente communication","value":"95 % de voyageurs récents ont attribué 5 étoiles à Presidio pour la communication."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, États-Unis
reviews:
["Presidio,

I’m extremely glad for the time I’ve spent in your property. I LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT THE APARTMENT!. Communication with presidio was easy and quick, I had several questions before booking and throughout my stay and I always got a kind and fast response. The location is perfect, lots of restaurants and food options in walking distance, there is a Trax line station ( Utah’s train system) just in front of the building. the building is modern and really nice and have lots of amenities. There’s a hot tub and pool included, Gym 24/7, and game rooms and clubhouses. Building is quite and there’s no noise inside the building which makes it ideal when you want to sleep or have a peaceful place to stay. Residents are kind ( some of them said hi to me in the elevator and garage) The apartment is modern and feel so cozy, kitchen have all you need, nice bathroom with great light and bed is foamy and super comfy. Description is exactly what you will see. Parking is secure and covered ( good for any time specially the winter ) Without any doubt I would love to stay here again when I come back to Salt Lake City. If you’re reading this review and trying to decide where to stay in salt lake , don’t think it twice. You won’t regret it!","Very nice modern building. Presidio was responsive and even ordered additional coffee when I ran out. Good value compared to nearby hotels.","Great location and very nice apartment with a comfy bed","I stayed here & worked remote for 3 weeks. I had a very positive experience and had no major issues with the apartment. The instructions provided were extremely helpful and Presidio's responsiveness was great, especially during the check-in process. The location is pretty good, a short walk to downtown or Liberty Park, walkable to a Smiths grocery store, Trader Joes, and a few restaurants, and easy enough to get to and from the airport via car, rideshare, or taxi. The building has a nice pool & hot tub & a lot of outdoor space (hopefully a roof deck in the future?). The building's gym is small but gets the job done and was never particularly crowded, especially in the morning. If I come back I may look for something a little cheaper and in a different neighborhood but only because I stayed in this area already.","Everything was great. Great value.","Beautiful, clean, nicely furnished condo. The location was convenient for us and was a comfortable place to stay for two nights before we flew home.","Really there best value you will find. I needed to travel far north in Utah for a funeral but wanted to be central for loved ones to visit while I was in town. I was able to get the food I needed walking distance at Trader Joe’s and relax in a nice, clean, air conditioned space. Everything was very clean, manual super helpful. One little hiccup with the wrong parking space number on the tag - host responded within minutes and all was resolved. Saving for my next visit in less sad circumstances! Thank you!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Sonoe is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["A lovely hideaway, with everything you need, including peace, quiet, a good reading light, comfortable bed, a real bathtub, and ultra clean everything. Location and atmosphere are perfect.","This house was the most pleasant surprise during my time in SLC. The house is exactly as advertised and very comfortable, clean, cozy and very well located. I, who don't know how to drive, used Uber and public transport and everything went well. There are many household items and you can cook perfectly. There are lockers to store our things and a small room to store our luggage, which kept the house super organized while I was there. The bed and blankets were super comfy, the house temperature was perfect (on the hottest days I turned on the AC). I had a desk that I used to work on every day, the table was very good and spacious. The bathroom was also very nice, extremely clean, and Sonoe left shampoo, conditioner and bath lotion. Other important items such as an iron and a hairdryer were in the house, which helped me a lot. The value for money was great, the house is in a great neighborhood and if you want to walk a little, in 30min you will be at City Creek. The house made me so happy, that even though I was going through some personal problems in life, that house welcomed me and made me feel at home in Brazil.
Thanks for everything, Sonoe.","Really awesome place! Cozy, outdoor patio for meals, very central, super wonderful host, easy street parking right in front of the unit, cute neighborhood, clean, homey apartment! We stayed here for several nights and wish we could have stayed longer. We'll be back when we're in SLC - fantastic value! Thank you thank you for everything!","My wife and I spent two months summer in this room. It is a compact room, but very clean and comfortable. We enjoyed chatting and drinking beer at the outside table space. The area around this apartment is also safe and beautiful. We could find very nice caffe restaurant around there. Sonoe, the owner, was very nice and easy to communicate with. She was always quick to respond to our requests.","Wonderful apartment in great neighborhood.
This apartment had everything I needed. A comfy bed, good internet with a desk to work from, a little outdoor space and a small kitchen. I liked the serene style of the decor and instantly felt at home. The neighborhood is great - quite and green to walk in, close to the big cemetery, nice coffee shop a couple of blocks and if you are so inclined you can walk to downtown even though it's a bit longer walk. Accessing the Wasatch mountains from here was easy as well. Highly recommend!","Nice place, well maintained, great location. We would stay there again if we were to return to SLC.","I stayed at Sonoe's while in SLC doing short-term work with the University. It was very clean and had everything I needed for a 10 day stay. She was very communicative and available when I messaged her. She also accommodated a few special requests I had, which was very helpful. It was the perfect place for me. Thank you Sonoe!"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Clean and cute apartment in a great location. Only draw back is that there are some neighbors that seem to smoke near the entrance. I wasn’t bothered if I kept the fans on but someone sensitive may notice","Great place.","The Airbnb was NOT as listed - the listing said there was a window AC as well as a portable ac, but there was a portable AC only, and it was configured improperly, so hot air was flowing back into the apartment. It was uncomfortably hot, and it smelled like smoke in the apartment, which is dangerous and hazardous.

We reached out to the hosts to get a refund, but they would not cooperate. I reached out to Airbnb support to try to get a refund, but they were very slow at responding and ultimately did not respond to my final query. Exasperated, I gave up on trying to get the refund, and we made do with what we had.

The apartment is also in a very seedy apartment complex, and it doesn’t feel safe to be there. I suggest that the hosts install AC properly and get rid of the smoke smell. AVOID!","It was very cute and cozy place to stay. Location was great. Definitely recommend to everyone!","My husband and I stayed for a month while I completed an away rotation for school. Everything was absolutely great - the space, the hosts, check-in/out, parking, amenities, location, etc. It was clean, well stocked, laundry access was cheap and easy. Crystal & Mauriona were super accommodating and amazing at communicating/answering any questions. Our only complaint was the lack of AC. The last 2 weeks of our stay, the temperature was 90s-100s, and we baked inside the apartment with just 2 fans. I would still highly recommend staying here!","great, well-located place! excellent communication!","What a cute place! There are so many thoughtful touches throughout. It was so nice to have coffee, shampoo, conditioner, soap, and even Q-tips! Location, location, location! We were so close to the Salt Palace, Trolley Square, and so many great restaurants. Crystal and Mauriona are very communicative and took great care of us."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Cute cozy place, Callie was a great host!
I would stay again. 😁","Best stay ever! We immediately felt right at home at Callie’s place - it was spotless, comfy and cozy. She really goes the extra mile with homey decor that doesn’t feel cluttery and thinks of the essentials like extra blankets, iron, extra dishwasher pods/detergent/trash bags/paper towels etc. The neighborhood is quite,safe, easy access to the rest of the city and has great views!

For a quick stay - this place will have more than you’ll dream of needing.
For longer stays - we stayed for a month and it was a great, well-equipped, homey spot! Do keep in mind that this is a basement unit, so you will hear the family above living their lives from time to time. It never disturbed us and Callie was always respectful and considerate of our stay.

The host communicates quickly and kindly. She was always there if we needed something and was great to work with.

Overall, this might be the best Air BnB I’ve stayed in. We will definitely be coming back!","Awesome location. Callie responds to your needs very quickly. Happy with how clean the place was and felt at home.","This stay was great! This place was cozy and clean.","Great place to stay. We recently stayed for 3 weeks and had no issues. reviews:
["Very comfortable and clean, well decorated space. Also loved the location close to shops and restaurants in walking distance. One thing I was slightly bothered by was the loud clicking noise the heater made- I did get used to it after a day or two but perhaps would be aware of this if you are very sensitive to noise or an extremely light sleeper.","Everything you need and more! 9&9 area has everything you need and is perfectly situated for everywhere Salt Lake City+.","Great spot in a great location","A great space to stay! Sandy is super thoughtful and helpful and keeps the area stocked with snacks and beverages.
Everything is very clearly labeled, and she even has a binder with recommendations/information on the neighborhood.","Super clean and cozy spot. Great location. Perfect place to rest while traveling. Minor nitpicks: I did have trouble operating the lock especially with a key but eventually got the hang of it. Also, there is a curtain dividing the living area from the entrance staircase. It would have felt cozier and more comfortable with a door that I could lock. I realize that the space is a bit narrow and installing a door could be a challenge, however. Would definitely stay there again regardless but only if I was staying alone.","Comfortable and airy despite being a basement. Check in super easy with the keypad lock and nice to have seating on the deck with the hot weather. Cute restaurants and coffee shop a short walk and the neighbourhood is very welcoming.","The place was quiet and cozy. There were just two things that bothered me. There is no ventilator inside the shower, and it’s hard to breathe when you are taking shower.
I have seen some insects in the unit :("]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I could look past the steep outdoor stairs being covered with snow when I arrived, or never being greeted by the host, or the keyless entry not working and the furniture being old and a chair broken. I looked past the used bars of soap and the spraying leak of the broken handheld shower and the creaking floors when I arrived there late at night after caring for my Ill sister all day long. (The bed was comfortable after a long hard day though). But I can not look past the horrible fight that went on above my head late one night and woke me from a deep sleep. I will not get into the specifics as I have with Airbnb but suffice it to say I was so afraid of my own safety that I threw all my belongings in my suitcase and left in the middle of the night with no intent of returning.","Wonderful stay! The space was beautiful and cozy, and the location was fantastic. Rick & Lisa were the most gracious and kind hosts, and made sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. Definitely stay here if you're traveling to SLC! -Rebecca & Mehrdad","Rick’s place was perfect for my brother’s stay since we had a house full at our place nearby at Christmas. Rick was extra communicative, made sure the place was shoveled and salted - we had quite a bit of snow and cold temps. Perfect place in the best neighborhood in SLC. Thanks Rick!","Cozy little place for a couple; wouldn't want more than 2 people - Also, the ceilings are low in the bathroom entry and shower, which is fine if you are under 5'10\". Very friendly host, and a great location! Thank you.","Great little place. This is in the NICEST area, super safe and convenient for the city. Would definitely stay here again.","Great location and hospitality. Probably the best value you can find in salt lake.","I stayed in Rick’s basement unit for just a few days and my son* stayed for a whole month while looking for a permanent place to live. The apartment is lovely - it was super clean and Rick and Lisa are wonderful hosts.

The small corner desk was perfect for me to get work done. It was nice to have a fridge, a microwave and coffee maker since there is no kitchen. The house is in a quiet and safe neighborhood and there’s easy parking on the street. Rick and Lisa were friendly, responsive and helped not only with anything we needed while in the house but also with advice about the area and the city.

*I stayed in this unit for 1 month. It was extremely comfortable, clean & overall a wonderful stay. The unit is spacious with a full bedroom, living room & bathroom. The air conditioning is also fantastic in the salt lake summer! Rick & Lisa were incredibly helpful, friendly, & made the stay great! I can’t thank them enough for the hospitality. A true 10/10 stay."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Isabeau is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["10/10 would recommend! Incredibly clean. Great location with a designated parking spot. Close walk to great restaurants, bars and coffee shops but also felt private and quite.","Great place to stay!","Great neighborhood and location! Very clean and affordable!","Isabeau/Cassandra's place is affordable and conveniently located by downtown SLC and 40 minutes to Park City. The extra perks are the toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, body wash), coffee beans, and water bottles. Cassandra is kind enough to extend check out to 12pm so be open to communicate.

Something to note before booking this place: bring ear plugs! You will be able to hear everything upstairs (*sounds will start around 6:30am) and the furnace sounds like a garbage disposal every time it starts. Also, if you are taller than 5'10, you might want to take in consideration that the bulkhead is low.","We absolutely loved this place. It had everything we needed and they even provided coffee. We plan on booking every time we come to town. Perfect in every way!","Great, comfortable place that's super walkable. Would recommend.","This was my second time staying here. This place is awesome and it has absolutely anything you need. Super clean and comfortable. The bed is very comfortable and having a kitchen is always a plus. Location is ideal. I highly recommend staying here. If I come back I know where I will be staying!"]

["Jana’s place is clean, safe and comfortable.","Perfect location to explore SLC and the ski areas. Large unit, very comfortable. Reno's were going on in the attached house (other side of the wall) which was a surprise to me - caused water to be shut off for a period on one day, other minor nuisances. The laundry is coin-op/laundromat style so have $1.50 to wash clothes (plus dryer) in a \"community use\" location for several houses, which means checking a number of times to find the machine unoccupied to do laundry. All places have pros and cons, and the convenience of location, nice neighborhood, and quiet area made this a good rental.","Great cozy place! Super simple check-in instructions. Only thing is, I couldn't find any coffee filters ):
This place is definitely worth it! 10-minutes from downtown area. Uber's were cheap!","very welcoming host. brought an extra air conditioner during a heat wave to make sure I was comfortable. have stayed with them several times. good location if you need to spend time at the university.","Place is okay for short term stays for two or so people. Wasn’t as clean as anticipated on arrival, and we had air conditioning issues, however Madison was very responsive and willing to help with anything I communicated with her."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Hailee is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great location, close to bus lines and TRAX, walkable to two local coffee shops, very short trip to Sprouts Groceries. Such a cute and nicely put together space. SUPER CLEAN. Easy drive to ski areas and Park City. So comfy! Perfect place!
Hailee is one of the most responsive and organized hosts I have encountered.
I didn't want to leave :)","Awesome stay and wonderful host!","This is a cozy, comfortable place to stay, and it is a great location for getting around Salt Lake City. Hailee was a pleasure to deal with and responded quickly to any questions we had. The water pressure is a little quirky and the outside stairs are fairly steep (we're a couple in our mid-60s), but Hailee was up front about that in her description, so there were no surprises. Highly recommend this for a stay in SLC.","Such a cute place! So fun and decorated. So nicely! The 1pm check out time is so convenient too","Such a lovely apartment in a totally incredible location. She’s thought of everything for your stay from the kitchen supplies to the towels and hair dryer to the bedroom fan and extra comforter. I loved having the bud stop just down the street to get anywhere i needed to go. I stayed here for a two week rotation at the University hospital and it was a 10-15 minute bus ride, very convenient. There is also a Trax station not too far away, too! And a cute little cafe and coffee shop within easy walking distance. The neighborhood is quiet and safe. Hailee is also very quick to respond to messages and super helpful. Highly recommend!

Something to note: it is an attic apartment so in the summer it does get very hot during the day and takes a long time to cool down at night, so just be aware. There is a fan in the bedroom and there is AC but when its 90 degrees outside it has a hard time keeping up. But that’s expected in an attic apartment!","It was a half a block from my sons house . So it was very convenient . We didn’t have to drive . The unit was equipped with all the basic needs .","Very cute and clean unit in a great location in SLC! We stayed for three months and Hailee was an amazing host."]

The kitchen was well stocked and there were some teas and other nice things left for us. In addition to the wonderful stay, the extensive art displayed throughout the home was just the extra touch that added to our awesome experience in Salt Lake City!

Keep up the great work and I hope to stay with you guys again soon!!","My daughter and I truly enjoyed our stay at Erica’s! For my daughter and I, it was the perfect size. If you’re a bigger group, the single small bathroom may be a challenge. But otherwise there is plenty of room and privacy for everyone.

We will definitely be staying here again on our next trip to Salt Lake."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Bailey is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great locations and house!","Place to stay in Salt Lake City. Very close to ninth and ninth where all the fun shops and restaurants are the place was big enough for my family yep, very cozy. I will definitely stay here again.","Great stay!
Great experience!!
Great host!!!","We had a great stay of 6 nights at this house and appreciated that it felt more like a place to live than just a place to stay.
The house is beautifully furnished in a modern style and decorated with spectacular photos of the canyons of southern Utah. The living room and dining room are very comfortable with large windows to watch the continuous flow of joggers and dog walkers in the beautiful park across the street.
The designer kitchen is not only attractive with a large island and gas stove with hood but is also fully equipped for cooking any kind of meal. For morning coffee, there is a choice of both a coffee maker and a Keurig single serve with coffee supplied for both.
The two bedrooms upstairs have very comfortable beds (a king and a queen). The smaller bedroom has a desk with chair next to it, perfect for a laptop. With a door that can be closed, it would be perfect for doing remote work or Zoom calls while other people enjoy the rest of the house.
The bathrooms, 1/2 bath downstairs and full bath with separate tub and shower upstairs, are large with nice touches like a table in the full bath for laying out toiletries. The upstairs bathroom would get a little cold at night (outside temp was low 20s) but was warm in the daytime.
The location is perfect - walking distance (1/4 to 1/2 mile) to restaurants and a supermarket. The park and surrounding neighborhoods are great for walking with some great views of the spectacular Wasatch Mountains.
Negatives were some traffic noise from the street out front especially at morning rush hour. The bedrooms are fairly well sound insulated, but we used the earplugs provided in a jar next to the bed by the host to eliminate the noise. As others have mentioned the stairs are somewhat narrow adding some difficulty to carrying luggage upstairs, but I didn't have any trouble with height and I'm 6'2\". I did have to bend a little going around the bed in the larger bedroom because of ceiling slope, but this was not really a problem.
We loved staying in this house and highly recommend it to other couples or small families.","I had a great stay. Loved the house and experience provided by Bailey. Definitely recommend booking here!","Cozy and decorated very cute!","Great space. Great home. Great location. We will be back!"]
