reviews:
["Jenna’s place is perfectly situated in the SLC area. The neighborhood is safe and close to grocery stores, library and the Capitol. We were within 5-10 minutes away from nice restaurants which made exploring the city fun.
Jenna is also very prompt and was quick to give us what we needed during our stay.
Would stay at this lovely place again someday!!","Good place. Good location. Good responsive owner","Jenna is quick to respond with queries and suggestions even in the late evening when arrived. The place is immaculate and very close to restaurants. Will use her place again when we come back to Salt Lake City","Very comfortable apartment in a great location. Charming neighborhood, very walkable. Easy access to downtown and the freeway.","I really enjoyed staying here as my first airbnb experience.
Highly recommend Jenna","Jenna’s home was a nice apartment. I stayed for 4 nights with my cousin in law as we were attending convention. The place had everything we needed, very comfortable bed, appliances, and the apartment was cool with 1 air conditioner and 2 ceiling fans. The neighborhood was quiet which is important for a good night sleep. We were just a 8 minute car ride to Salt palace convention center/ Vivint Arena and we went food shopping to Whole Foods, Trader Joe’s just 12 minute car ride. We used Uber/Lyft. Absolutely loved eating at Zao restaurant which was in the same area. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Jenna’s home and she was always a text away and responded quickly if we had any questions. Thank you so much Jenna for a wonderful stay.","For most folks, the studio should be fine. I had some issues with my stay that were temporary and likely resolved by the time you’d book. Upon arrival I learned the toilet wasn’t functional which made the first 24 hours quite unpleasant. However, Jenna came over quickly when the toilet flooded and did reimburse me for the first night which I appreciated. The next day there was very loud noise all day from demo-ing the apartment above which made it impossible to work remotely. Luckily the public library is on the same street, but it would have been nice to have a heads up about the work being done on the house. On the plus side, the bed is really comfy and the kitchen is well stocked."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Dayna & Tim is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Great location, perfect sized space, comfy bed! Would definitely stay there again.","Great place, really friendly hosts that were very helpful. Really comfortable bed. Also the neighborhood is beautiful. I really enjoyed my stay.","Location is fantastic near Sugarhouse park.  Coffee shop walking distance.  The unit is spotless.  We will be back again for sure.","I loved this airbnb! It has been one of my favorite airbnb stays so far. The space was both cozy and elegant--such a comforting space to return to after a day out and about--and it's clear Dayna and Tim put a lot of thought into the design, flow and details. The location was perfect--in a charming neighborhood with only a 10-minute walk to Sugar House Park and Parley's Trail, and a 15-minute car ride to downtown and everything in-between. I really enjoyed chatting with Dayna and Tim on the occasions we crossed paths--they are very friendly people and excellent communicators. Their dog is adorable and friendly, and kept me company a couple of times when I was working on the private patio (another bonus!)  I will certainly see if their airbnb is available again next time I visit SLC - I give it my full recommendation!","very clean and cute location. shower has great acoustics for singing. 😁 would happily come back. I wish we had more than just a night.","A cozy guesthouse, very nice.","I stayed here for about 20 nights and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Salt Lake. The location in Sugar House is perfect, especially how close it is to Sugar House Park. The apartment itself is very clean, comfortable, and well equipped, including a full kitchen. Bed and pillows were especially comfy! It is also conveniently close by to WholeFoods, Target and other stores if you need to get your necessities. Dayna & Tim were very friendly and enjoyed chatting with them on my way in and out of the apartment. Overall great stay!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Airdream is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Well, to honestly say. . .I am an international traveler and I tend to stay in some of the best accommodations around the world. Therefore, I am not sure if I can provided the best feedback of my stay here. I stayed here because my relatives were already renting the place so I just piggy backed on their duration here. The place was tidy and suitable for a short-term stay, as I mostly only slept there and work through the night. I did enjoy the spacious king bed and many pillows that made my sleeping process comfortable. It was a bit of a challenge to keep the downstairs warm with the space heater, but the bathroom was warm and cozy with heat. I was not fond of the bathtub and it appearance, so make sure you bring a pair of shower shoes to wear, as the tub, give the impression of being less then clean. However, I found the apartment to be close to many restaurants, shops, city center, rail, and a couple of laundromats nearby. And the commute for everything was within 4-miles or less.","The stay was fine. The beds are comfy!","This was one of the cheapest places I could find on air bnb here, without staying in an RV or tent. This place was cozy, and aesthetic. I could definitely live here permanently, it is honestly an adoring little space. They were so easy to communicate with. They even offered to help find amenities in the area, for all of your needs and desires. There are plenty of gas stations, restaurants, coffee shops and even a grocery store near by, and if you don’t have a car, everything is in walking distance pretty much. The Trax station and bus are near too. The only down side, is no washer and dryer, and no dishwasher. This place would be perfect if it included those things and if some of the appliances were upgraded. You still have a working stove, toaster, even a rice cooker which I was excited about, and cleaning supplies if needed. Also they provided extra exceptional toiletries for the bathroom, I always appreciate that kind of attentiveness. ❤️❤️❤️","The flat is great, spacious and reasonably priced compared to other offerings in SLC. However, walls are unfortunately very thin so you hear everything coming from the other apartment. Not ideal.

The host is otherwise responsive but I didn’t really like being sollicited for real estate investment (see Molly’s comment from August 2022; I completely agree with her).","I just want to say that this place is amazing. The starry sky was absolutely mind blowing for me and my 3 yo kid. Clean, charming, well decorated and located. Definitely I’ll go back. It’s feels like home.","This stay was warm and cozy, and the hosts were extremely communicative. I’d stay here again anytime.","Prompt responses and a fun little spot close to everything you need!"]

Location_city: North Salt Lake, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great communication","value":"100% of recent guests rated Eddie 5-star in communication."}]
location: North Salt Lake, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Amazing view and it was clean an spacious very comfortable while I was there","Place was nice, clean, bed comfortable. Great Communication","Beautiful view , place is very nice","It was nice that Eddie has a parking spot on driveway for you. Which made me feel safe as residents seem to drive a good speed around the curves of the incline road and they will honk at you if you hold them up.","What a beautiful space! Eddie’s home is really on the mountain overlooking SLC. I spent every evening watching the sunset and viewing airplanes landing at the airport.
Wi-Fi works great for remote work! The sleeper futon is easily one of my favorite parts of this home! Very comfortable for a couch and a bed. The bed was also very comfortable.
The kitchen had everything I needed. I stayed by myself, but can see 3 comfortably staying. I was also able to do laundry in the main house after scheduling with the host.
VERY private and quiet. I never once saw the host or was bothered whatsoever.
There is road noise because you are seriously on the side of the mountain, but I didn’t mind at all!
15 minutes to SLC airport, 10 minutes to good food and grocery shopping.
Couldn’t have asked for a better 2 week stay. Thank you so much!","Eddie's apartment was lovely. Check in was a breeze and the apartment was clean and cozy. We had a small issue with the TV and Eddie responded via email very quickly and the issue was resolved. I hope we're able to stay in Eddie's apartment again.","Great place to stay!"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Megan’s place is worth crowing over ; )

Besides the beautiful hens in the coop outside, the apartment is super clean, very comfortable, and a nice place to crash/rest/work. I did some of all of that, and enjoyed my stay. It’s definitely got the vibe of a basement apartment, which means it’s a little darkish, and there are footsteps and voices heard from upstairs. But it’s a family home, and those things were fine by me. To top it off, Megan was very friendly and responsive—a top-notch host.","This perfect little apartment is comfortable, convenient and cosy. Megan was responsive and we had everything we needed right from the start. A nice walk to the grocery - and chickens to eat our apple cores. What could be nicer?","The place was cute, well stocked kitchen. The bed was soft and comfortable. Would love to stay here again.","A lovely place for a couple to feel at home! Loved the unit, the bed was super comfy and the whole unit inviting. A well stocked kitchen with tools and appliances took great care of us. The chicken coop was neat to check out too!","We stayed here one night at the beginning of our trip and almost two weeks later on the way back we were so thankful to be able to spend a couple of nights here to rest up. The place is beautiful, they really hit it out of the ballpark with a great place to stay. Thank you!!!!!","One of the best airbnbs I’ve stayed in so far.","Megan's place is absolutely beautiful! Unfortunately we were just passing through, really wish we could just hang out here for a few days. The chickens are so cute, got to feed them out of my hand and the fresh eggs were amazing! If you are passing through we highly recommend staying here, you will not be sorry."]

reviews: ["Todd is an excellent host, friendly, proactive, and helpful! He let us choose our door code and provided coffee and creamer. The place is beautiful, comfortable, and in a very convenient location. We would love to come back!","The accommodations were nice and the location was perfect for me.  Close to the University of Utah and the 9th and 9th neighborhood.","Fantastic hosts and a great space. Would definitely recommend to others and stay again.","Clean, comfortable basement apartment in great location! Nice neighborhood close to 9th & 9th restaurants & shops. Walking distance to Guardsman way and Rice Eccles stadium for tailgating & the games. Bed was very comfortable, nice quality linens & towels, variety of pillow styles. Fully stocked kitchen - including coffee & creamer which was a nice touch. Todd is super nice & available for any questions. We would definitely stay here again & recommend it to others.","Todd hosts a wonderful basement apartment with private keyless entrance in a fantastic location. The bed was comfortable and I love that there are so many pillows from which to choose.  It is a quiet and welcoming place to stay.  Given the chance to return to SLC, we would definitely stay here again.","Great place","Todd’s place is convenient, quiet, clean, spacious and comfortable. His warm welcome and personal touches were appreciated. It’s definitely my top pick for my next visit to SLC!!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Courtney & Brian is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Cute place to stay! Super close to downtown. Stephanie was very responsive and super nice! The location is the best.","The location was great. Due to construction, the bus stop across the street was not operational, but just a street away was another bus stop. Had a small issue with the shower head not being stable, but the owners  were very helpful in trying to get someone in to fix it. I didn’t have the time to be in the house for the work to be done, but I appreciated that the owners offered to get this done. I also had problems with check in- , but this was totally on me. I misunderstood the directions. I arrived really early, around 1am and I’m so happy that one of the homeowners answered my call. Overall, a good stay.","Lovely little basement unit! 🖤","Great place and close to down town and all kinds of places to visit. Could use some updates but overall a great experience.","It is a very cute space within less than two mile walk to downtown and most of what Salt Lake City has to offer in a safe neighborhood!! Fully stocked kitchen with a lot of space. Also keep in mind this is a basement apartment. In 3 nights I’ve captured 2 centipedes, 1 silverfish, and about a handful of different spiders. The only complaint I have was that this listing originally stated “parking on premises” and I had asked the hosts if there was parking in front of the house as I live in a camper van and was staying here while my mom visited. When I get there I realized “parking in front of the house south side” which was the original response I received when I booked really meant across the street down the block and a pitch dark road with barely any lights. I was uncomfortable with this and I’m sure the neighbors were as well with a strange van parked in front of their house for 4 days.","Great location! Very cute neighborhood!","A reasonable option for the budget-minded traveler, with all the necessary kitchen facilities. A lovely location a few minutes to downtown in one direction and the foothills in the other."]

Location_city: North Salt Lake, Utah, United States

reviews:
["Great place! We felt right at home. Loved that there is 2 bathrooms. The place is very roomy and light. The house is stocked with everything you need and more. The neighborhood was quiet and the view is awesome! Overall a great place to stay and would love to stay there again.","The location is very convenient. The host is available and was very helpful. These accommodations were so comfortable and clean and I would absolutely stay there again.","Nanoshell's Basement Apartment was fantastic, having a capacity for 3+ and two full baths made it perfect for us. The apartment was clean, tidy, and has a well equipped Kitchen. The quiet neighborhood is in the foothills with beautiful views. We were pleasently surprised one evening by a group of Deer greeting us in the front yard. This aprtment is a great value, we hope to be able to stay here in the future.","This place is very spacious. The view is amazing. Beautiful sunsets and views of the mountains. Beds are comfortable. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Britta And Meelad is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["The studio was thoughtfully appointed and very clean. The owners are great too. I will definitely return without a second thought. Highly recommended.","I loved this place so much! It’s so quaint, beautiful decor, extremely comfortable bed, gorgeous neighborhood. It was everything I needed and I look forward to staying there again next time I need a spot near downtown. Thank you so much Brittany and Meelad!","We loved our stay here! The house is in a lovely, quiet neighborhood...we enjoyed walking around in all directions over multiple days. There were beautiful historical homes to enjoy, as well as city parks within walking distance. Sometime it's hard to find places to stay with bathtubs, and we really appreciated this one...plenty of hot water to soak in! The bed was very comfortable, and I was delighted with how well we slept every night. There was beautiful light that came into our room, especially through the interesting little stained glass piece above the main window. We appreciated the ROKU stick and got to see a good movie every night. It was easy for us to have food delivered or go to the close-by Trader Joe's. The minute we stepped inside, we were immediately comfortable--and we would definitely come back to this cozy place again!","Super cute place to stay! Location was great and communication was easy. Super cute for one person or a couple.","Having stayed here for three months as a travel nurse, I must say this place was perfect. The neighborhood is beautiful and felt so safe, the studio had such charm and was very clean, and Britta and Meelad were very responsive. I’m very thankful to have been able to stay here during my time in SLC.","Britta and Meelad's apartment is cute, cozy, comfortable, and centrally located in the Avenues. The space is well appointed, including a VERY comfortable bed, and the kitchen had all of the necessities for a week's long stay. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting in the front yard and chatting with the neighbors and meeting their furry friends. The central AC and window unit kept the space extremely comfortable as was quite hot during our week in SLC. Just a great experience all around and would definitely recommend this apartment for a stay.","Perfect stay! I booked this at the last minute and Britta and Meelad were so accommodating and quick to respond to all messages. Clear instructions for an easy check-in and the place was comfortable and sparkling clean. In a beautiful, quiet neighborhood close to Temple Square. Will definitely stay here again next time I’m in SLC!"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We had an amazing month long stay here! This place had everything you need for a comfortable stay of any length. The kitchen was well stocked and made it easy to cook meals regularly. We enjoyed the location in Sugarhouse as we were able to walk to coffee shops, grocery stores and restaurants as well as easily get to Sugarhouse Park. The rest of the review relates mainly to longer term stays.

-Wifi: Very reliable, both of us worked while we were here and had zero issues with the Wifi.
-Kitchen: Well stocked and nice appliances for regular cooking
-Bed: Very comfortable, slightly on the firm side. The bedroom also had blackout shades which was nice
-Workspaces: we used our own 2 tables (one in the bedroom and one in the dining area), but there was one provided desk to use. The dining table would be tough to use as a desk as the tabletop isn't attached to the legs.

Overall, I highly recommend this place for anyone visiting Salt Lake!","Great location, host was helpful and responsive. Would stay again!"]

I enjoyed the neighborhood and location","Very cozy and functional apartment. I enjoyed my stay. And the host is very responsive.","A lovely European influence in this charming apartment. As an architect, I appreciated the designerly touches throughout. Wonderful big bed with great linens and pillows - I slept very well here. The location was very convenient and  the neighborhood is great for walking and looking at charming older houses on tree-lined streets.","Sevda’s place was very clean. In a nice little neighborhood and only a 5 minute walk to a cute little cafe down the road. We used her place to stay while we visited my sister and had a wonderful time. Thank you Sevda! We will stay here next time if it’s available!!","Comfy, cozy and quaint. Perfect for my stay in SLC. Thank you, Sevda!","very nice and communicated great."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Kylie is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Kylie’s place was clean and comfortable. Nice kitchen, has all the basics for meals in. Netflix and comfortable bed was great! Appreciated the larger soaker tub & community hot tub. Close proximity to ski resorts. Thanks for a great stay!! - S&J","Kylie was a great host! The place was clean and cozy with awesome amenities and wonderful neighbors. The location had easy access to freeway along with great adjacency to SLC and Park City. Can’t wait to go back for another visit!","Super clean, nice amenities, gym, hot tub, covered parking, has dishes/spices/coffee maker 10/10","With an exception of entry issues, the place was overall pretty good. The rain can be rather loud when it’s hits the sills around the window when trying to sleep and the thermostat was off, but not really an issue. Comfortable place. Thanks!","Rooms decent and very clean. Nice kitchen. Late fee sounds aggregious but cleaning people need paid. Be aware. Stay here, BUT DONT CHECK OUT LATE! 75$/30min Yikes!","Wonderful place with a very thoughtful and responsive host! I will stay here again when I come back to the area.","While the place was \"okay\" and has the basic needs met, I must admit it was a solid disappoint overall for a few reasons.

1) The place is basically one of those confusing massive maze-like student housing type of complexes. This was not conveyed in the listing, which makes it appear to be a nicer complex with easy access to its amenities... not the case. It was confusing to check-in and find the place, and confusing to park using the gate card (which didn't even work). The hallways were dirty and covered in sticky spills of some sort ---not Kylie's fault, but this isn't as nice of a place as advertised. The elevators and staircases for the gated parking are not at all convenient to the unit, and we often had to wait for another guest to come park and open the gate just so we could get in. The bed seemed like a full-size not even a queen --- so a bit small for a couple to sleep. The toilet seat was not latched down properly and shifted off the toilet with use -- gross.

2) The amenities are so far away from the unit it was impractical to use them. Additionally, the pool is only 3 feet deep, so you can't really swim --- and it was closed for some unexplained reason --- and even if it was open, it wasn't something worth paying extra $$$ for. The FOB to get into the game room didn't work either. So, we paid a lot of money for basically nothing.

3) And this is the one that really gets me... Like many travelers arriving via air, our flight arrived in the late morning/early afternoon, nothing unusual. After receiving Kylie's confirmation email, which asked for approximate check-in times and accommodations, I kindly responded with our info and asked for a very reasonable early check-in (around 12 or 1pm) as we had nowhere to put our things. Most hotels/AirBnBs will graciously allow for an early check-in assuming the room is ready and there are no guests prior. I would completely understand if that were not the case, and they needed the time to prep the room. However, the apartment was in fact *ready* with *no guests* the days prior to our arrival. So rather than being kind and helpful towards us, Kylie up-charged me an additional $35 fee for an early check-in and for no good reason. Prior to this, she threatened a $75 up-charge and implied it should be a whole extra day's extra charge for some unknown reason (...again, I was only asking for two hours early --- insane --- try reading your guests' messages fully and comprehending them before being so rigid and unkind).

If you are not going be accommodating, and are going force your guests to either wander the city hauling their luggage around or pay more money for a just a couple of hours, then please don't send an initial email kindly asking for check-in/ETA only to then exploit your guests for more money. We had no choice but to pay this ridiculous fee as we had nowhere else to put our things. After explaining that we had nowhere to put our luggage or anywhere to go for a couple of hours, Kylie showed no concern and just said \"you are welcome to pay the $35 fee\"). While prompt, I found her email responses to be lacking in helpfulness, kindness, and genuine concern for her guests. This is entirely her choice to be this way, but it would have been helpful to have explained how rigid and unaccommodating you would be in your listing, rather than waiting until I had already booked it through AirBnB and you had taken my money. It felt like I had to ask Kylie to confirm everything once I paid this fee, rather than her confirming and making us feel welcome. After paying this fee, she did allow for an extra hour to check-out on the last day, but I also had to respond reconfirming the extra hour to check-out as her exit message threatened additional fees --- not cool and your guests shouldn’t have to remind you of *your* agreements --- you should be keeping track of that.

4) Overall, the unit is \"okay,\" but the cost per night, with a rather hefty $100 cleaning fee (unusually high for AirBnB), and a ridiculous $35 early check-in fee with no understanding or help for us to put our valuables, all made this experience pretty bad overall. I would encourage Kylie to work on her communication and customer service skills as her rather \"tongue-in-cheek\" responses made us feel unwelcome and anxious prior to and during our trip. I am having a hard time believing all of the positive reviews are even real, as this was not even remotely close to our experience."]

reviews: ["Very comfortable, felt like home after a couple days.","Perfect place, just as advertised. We really appreciated Alan's pet friendly (medium dog in our case) policy.  Our daughter was in the University Hospital (reason for our visit) and Alan's place could not be more convenient for hospital access. The neighborhood is quiet, great for walking around.  It's an older neighborhood with interesting architecture,  also a great dog park just a few blocks away, 9th and M if I recall.  The \"Avenues\" is a great place to stay, hope we can come back for just a vacation. PS,  not a long drive away, The Red Iguana for some of the best Mexican food we've ever had, Mole sauces!","Was very relaxing, and had lots of space! Close enough to get downtown, but far enough away from all the downtown noise. Would stay again. We also loved all the helpful notes around the house.","Clean, bright, spacious and delightful.  We can highly recommend.","Large clean space. Great location. Comfortable beds and fast WiFI. Alan is a great host and very responsive. I would love to stay again while visiting daughter at the U or for work or vacation.","Wonderful place for a stay in the Avenues of Salt Lake City for a couple.  Views are great.","Myself and my two small children (ages 6 and 3) stayed for a week in Alan's duplex. Our stay was very comfortable, and the property was very fairly described in the listing. The rental is in a very nice, safe neighborhood that is close to downtown and the University of Utah. The wifi was very fast and I was able to work remotely during my stay. Overall, this was a great value and we would look to reserve again the next time we visit Salt Lake City. Thanks again for a great stay!"]

highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 297 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a common area."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Bill is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Location was excellent. Communication was clear and thorough. No problems during stay.","Bill’s apartment was a wonderful place. It’s a unit in a large apartment complex. Neighbors on the floor were quiet. Check-in was easy. Convenient underground parking. Fast wifi and streaming TV services. Bed was super comfortable and lots of closet space. Great to have a washer and dryer as well as dishwasher in the unit. There is a whirlpool and bbq grill in the common area on the ground floor. And Bill was very quick to provide pool towels when I notified him that they were missing. Location is wonderful: easy access to everything. Definitely recommend this place when you're in downtown SLC.","Great location just a couple blocks from downtown and great restaurants. At first the door keypad hated me lol but with both instances Bill was able to get back with me right away.","Centrally located to dow town! Easy access to public transportation! The memory foam bed and pillows were super nice! The shared hot tub was a nice surprise!","This apartment has it all! It's in a great location - a block away from the Lower Avenues - in a very walkable area. The apartment had the furnishings I needed - a comfortable bed, a desk, and a comfortable sofa in front of the tv. The kitchen was well stocked and the in-unit washer/dryer was a welcome touch. The building is very secure - and you get your own parking space inside the garage! It made me much more comfortable coming back to the unit after dark.
Bill was very accessible and was quick to answer questions. I had a bit of a glitch checking in - and he quickly fixed the problem as soon as I called. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone staying in the Salt Lake area.","What a gem and a great find!! Bill is an incredibly kind and attentive host who’s very responsive. The space is well thought out and you can tell he considered the needs of his guests as he prepared this space as it was more than comfortable for our small family of 3. Everything you need for a short stay is provided even if you’re like me and “remember” just before bed you require a third pillow to sleep.. all potential extras had been considered and were provided in advance.

The location was great and next to some adorable cafes though we didn’t quite realize we were a solid 15/20 min walk to city center. However we did have a car and the provided parking spot was a HUGE and much appreciated perk!

Wi-Fi was great and in no way spotty. The building was quiet and secure. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would absolutely stay in one of Bill’s places again.","Great location, very clean modern apartment. Smooth check in and excellent communication with the owner."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"92% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Highly rated Host","value":"Skyler has received 5-star ratings from 90% of recent guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Pros:
- Skyler was very responsive, even answering our text right away at 11:30 pm when we had an issue checking since the space we had reserved was not clean
- Skyler quickly arranged an alternate space for us
- The alternate space was good and clean
- Good value and great location

Cons:
- It was a little creepy when we tried to check in to our original space and discovered it wasn’t clean, towels were wet, and stovetop was still warm
- Skyler didn’t just give us the alternate space, we had to accept a reservation modification and somehow got billed accidentally for both the original space and the alternate space.
- It eventually got resolved through Airbnb getting involved but was a bit of a hassle
- Also, we got billed a higher price for the alternate space since apparently it normally rents for more than our original space
- I felt that we shouldn’t have to pay extra for the alternate space since it wasn’t our fault that we had to change","Skyler was extremely responsive and communicative. The unit was in a great location and well taken care of. Thanks!","Skyler's place is centrally located in a quiet neighborhood near downtown and is with in safe walking distance of Vivint Arena!","Great apartment! Really enjoyed our stay:) I can only recommend this location!!","Fair value. Decent place. The bed did have quite a few box elder bugs in it. It also had a lot of remaining hair in the bed and on the pillows from previous guests. Not exactly ideal to try and lay your head down on a pillow with long foreign hair all over it. I’m assuming they weren’t washed? Anyways, just slept on top of the comforter not in the bed. All other areas of the place seemed to be clean and in order. Received two towels that were located on the bathroom vanity. One towel definitely had a musky/wet smell to it, so it was not used. Parking is not ideal. The driveway was completely full and I had to park in the “2 hour” street parking. During check in, the code to the unit was not provided. So needless to say I stood outside the unit trying to make contact with the owner to get the code. Response was fast but check in was not ideal either. Definitely stayed in much better places for less money.","great location and a cute room","decent location, quick replies, good host!"]

reviews:
["Cute space, nice variety of appliances, Clean. There were some mystery stains on the duvet and the duvet also kept slipping and getting jumbled up which was a bit annoying. Convenient location, overall good stay.","Great host and place to stay.","The Sugar House Studio was clean, spacious, bright, and comfortable for my husband and me during our 4 night stay to visit our son in SLC. The contemporary decor is serene and the king-size bed made for Goldilocks, not too soft, not too hard, but just right! Though we spent most of our time hiking and biking, we enjoyed a couple of happy hours on the little deck overlooking the lovely backyard and dinners in the city. We will definitely come back here if it's available during our next trip to Salt Lake. Thank you to David and Aaron for their kind hospitality!","Such a great place! Wonderful neighborhood, centrally located, private, quiet, clean and cute. We loved it and the area so much we stayed an extra day. Will definitely be back and will be recommending to our friends!","I absolutely loved having this cute bnb all to myself!
Such a comfortable and relaxing place to come back to after a day out and about.","Amazing stay. Bed was comfy! We loved being 5-15 minutes away from everything. SLC has so much to offer!","This rental was clean, comfortable and in a great location. The hosts were very nice. We would definitely return if we ever need a place to stay in Salt Lake City."]

location: 노스 솔트레이크(North Salt Lake), 유타, 미국
reviews: ["AMAZING. Beautiful Airbnb and an amazing host. Lesley has been so flexible with us and have solved any issues we have had immediately. 100% recommend any Airbnb she is hosting.","The check in was easy, the space was wonderful, the location is great, and if you come during the 4th of July weekend check out what day they have fireworks behind the house which are incredible!","Responded quickly, place was spacious, if you are driving through Salt Lake City you should stay here!","Lesley’s bnb is so cute, I loved the decor. It also has everything you need and smelled lovely. Having a washer dryer while on a cross country road-trip while camping and hiking national parks along the way was a game changer. The carpet was also so soft, my dog knocked out immediately. This place really felt like my home, would definitely stay here again.","Easy, lovely stay while passing through SLC. Would absolutely stop here again.","Everything was great! I really appreciated being able to park in the garage, as I had a pack on top of my car. The space was very cozy, and the view was amazing. Wish I could've stayed longer! Will definitely book again when back in town","Everything in this place was perfect! It was clean, comfortable, and very cute. As a young female traveling alone, I felt extremely safe and being able to park my car with all my stuff in the garage was an added bonus. I also had a bike rack on the back of my car and was fully prepared to take off the bikes to park in the garage, but the doors were tall and wide enough that I was able to leave them on. The view on the drive to this house was also incredible and there is a lot of hiking trails within 10 minutes. Lesley is a great host and a fast responder, I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Jason is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I appreciated this quiet, safe, little hide away during my recent trip to Salt Lake City. I was helping a relative who was in the University Hospital. The apartment was an easy drive to and from the hospital. It was nice to come back after a long day to a nice, quiet, retreat.","The place is clean, cute, and in safe location. Conveniently close to highway, shopping center, and Temple square.","this was my second time staying here and i love it! i was so excited when i was able to book it again for this trip","The basement apartment in this charming old Sugar House home is quiet and cozy. It feels substantially larger than it is thanks to the layout; my wife could have breakfast while I was sleeping in.

There's a reasonable amount of natural light

Jason is a very thoughtful host, even working in the dead of night to address an automatic water shut-off performed by the city. The suite has been well apportioned for longer stays. There's access to a garden, liquid soap, shampoo, and conditioner, a change of sheets, and plenty of towels.

Although there is some TV available, you'll mostly need to provide your own entertainment. The location makes it relatively easy to do that, although there's street noise. A desk, table, and bed complete the setup.

All in all, it was brighter, better, cheaper, cleaner, and nicer than the hotel we had been staying at nearby, while still being an easy walk to many restaurants, a park, and good grocery stores. Five stars.","Really nice place to stay, convenient to all of Sugar House's amenities. Parking is so convenient. The apartment is clean, nicely furnished, well equipped and once us old folks figured it out the ROKU TV was a treat to watch. Would have no problem staying here again.","Jason was great, he was accommodating and very responsive. The space is good for one person . The bathroom is a little tight and kind of has an oder, but all around it was a good experience.","Cute little apt. Great location."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["It is just as described and very clean. The bed is very comfortable which is a huge plus for vacationers. You can walk around the neighborhood and there are quite a few eating establishments around the area.  Some were just opening up due to Covid restrictions and some were still doing take out only. Liberty Park is close by and a beautiful area to walk or jog in.  We spent most of our time with family and exploring Utah so we weren't in it except to sleep.  We highly recommend it!","Mirinda was great - very considerate and responsive. Even reached out after the earthquake to make sure everything was alright. The location is awesome - easy walk to downtown and local shopping and restaurants. I would only recommend timing your visit to not coincide with the outbreak of a viral pandemic.","Very convenient location for quickly getting onto the highways towards the local ski resorts.  Located in a mixed neighborhood with street parking on a fairly busy road.  Local chain grocery store (Smith's) within 1 block, as well as Whole Foods within several blocks.  Very spacious duplex with separate living room with TV, kitchen with full fridge/freezer plus range/oven, bathroom with washer/dryer, and bedroom with foam mattress.  It's an older house as reflected in the doors and pipes, but interiors have otherwise been nicely renovated and furnished.","A great place to stay in a great location. The host was very helpful with recommendations about the city and I felt safe having my daughter stay there alone. All in all, a charming little place!","Mirinda's place is great!  Pictures are accurate, very clean, tv with apps (netflix, amazon prime, etc), comfortable seating in living room, nice size kitchen, small bath yet equipped with everything one needs, including LG w/d.  First time sleeping on memory foam bed.....very relaxing. Cute restaurants and shops within walking distance.  I was able to park in front during my 10 day stay.  Mirinda is quick with responses to any question or concern.  Highly recommend.","clean, spacious, cozy, near to our son and his family.","Great place for a quick ski weekend getaway!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City, United States
reviews:
["Perfect location, clean and modern space, very helpful and responsive hosts. The only reason I’m not giving 5 stars is the small bathroom, and especially the shower is very narrow. If you don’t mind that, this property is perfect.","perfect for a cpl or one person.","Jen offers a beautiful and comfortable space. I rented her Airbnb for a photography event, all of my clients were thrilled with the location and decoration. It was very clean, comfortable, and had everything I needed for a weekend in Salt Lake City.
I will be staying here again and recommending it to friends who travel through the area!","Great place to stay at. Felt like home","This place is just heaven to me. By one unit to perfection close, it matches my taste home wise. I want to live there.

The host Jen was amazing, extra-flexible and very friendly. Thank you again Mx Jen

I recommend this place and the services that come with it anytime. But one advice if I may; Because this place is so wonderful, do not stay for just a night, you’ll certainly regret it😁","The host told me to leave 3 times and seemed put out by having to deal with the loud neighbors upstairs and the dog that growls and barks at you… I had to finally tell her I was not leaving and to handle the complaints and that I didn’t feel comfortable with seeing the dog again so if the tenants upstairs could keep it in the backyard which didn’t happen. I have heard of friends having issues with air bnb and I wouldn’t recommend this place to stay . Rude host. Rude neighbors upstairs with there loud music","My stay here was wonderful the house had all the amenities that a good ARBNB would have. Everything from the living room to the kitchen was well thought out. The location was great if you plan on being close to the city but not directly in the city. I would definitely stay here again."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We’ve stayed with Starfire for two vacations in apartments #45 and #46.
I enjoy the view of the cathedral from #46 and the sunset view from #45.
We will stay here again for our next pilgrimage.
This has become our beloved home away from home.
The gas fireplace warms the whole apartment and is so cozy for Christmas time.
I enjoy the convenient walking distance to groceries and all necessities.
I’m not accustomed to paid street parking and having to regularly move my car around. But staying in this beautiful, peaceful, pet-friendly retreat is worth the inconvenience and hassle of city parking.","Great apartment close to downtown. Spacious one bedroom, comfortable, quiet and well appointed. Lack of parking was only tough part, but if you’re visiting and don’t have car, not really an issue. Would def stay here again!","Fabulous apartment. Great location - walkable to everything. Lovely large bed (UK super king size) and very comfortable. The kitchen was well stocked if you want to eat in. The apartment is spacious and has tons of light. Communication with the hosts was fast and the keyless entry is great - saves having to carry a key around. We loved everything about it!","Great location, beautiful place. A+ all around","I recommend this place. Be mindful of the parking. Communication with the host is above expectations and the location was perfect for us. I would not recommend the pullout bed but that’s just me. The king bed was comfortable and we slept well. We will return to this place.","Perfect Airbnb. Absolutely pleasant, convenient, and we’ll designed. I’d definitely stay here again."]

["Very nice apartment...close to downtown...and garaged parking...very quick host response and enjoyed our stay!","This space was a great location and amazing to have a designated parking space. It's great place for 2 or a family with small children. Kitchen stocked with spices, utensils, pots/pans, etc you need to make a meal. Plenty of room to cook and space to eat comfortably.
The walls are thin where you can hear others washing but not thin that you can hear conversations. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to bring some headphones as the street outside is pretty busy.

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Don’t stay here unless you’re on a low budget. The place looks cute but it’s super unkept and bugs around the apt., etc.
Good location and quiet neighborhood.","Really nice stay. There was an issue with the AC when we arrived but the hosts were able to fix it right away!","The place was perfect for my needs. Coffee shop on corner was great. The place was a bit neglected and could use some improvements.","Very clean, comfortable, recommended","This is a nice place, but - at the time we were staying - there were some things we noticed: there were quite a few bugs in the apartment, and they kept seeming to get in. It was also very warm as the A/C in the living-room/kitchen didn’t work. Luckily, the window unit worked so sleeping wasn’t hot. Finally, the shower was quick to clog. The location was great, and the place itself was really nice and - if these things are taken care of - this would be a great Airbnb. The host was also very accommodating and I have faith that it is something they will deal with.","The place was very nice and well kept. There were snacks and plenty of dishes to use. The place is an apartment within a house of other people, possibly other airbnbs so not an entire building to yourself but the walls are pretty soundproof. However there are plenty of issues. The mattress is pretty firm so if you’re someone who doesn’t like a hard bed this isn’t for you. The roku remote for the tv does not work so you’ll have to use the app on your phone to control the tv. The swivel chairs at the table are uncomfortable and not practical for most people (I’m small and I barely fit). The heater / ac system is kind of tricky and took some finessing to get it to work properly. Finally, the sofa is missing 2 baseboards in the middle so it sinks in. Overall, for the price it’s worth it if you can look past all of those issues and don’t plan to be in the airbnb much.","Great location and an awesome place to stay for a trip to SLC!"]

reviews: ["Kylie's place is beautiful and centrally located (about 10 min drive to downtown and 10 min drive to airport). You can see the mountains from her living room window which was breathtaking especially during sunsets. Her space was very well kept and I had everything I needed for my stay there! Kylie was responsive to all my messages which was super helpful for me as I was flying in pretty late at night! Would highly recommend her space for anyone travelling in for a short or even long stay in Salt Lake City!","Kylie's place was close to everything we did! Very clean and very clear instructions on what to do!","Fantastic apartment right near the airport and about 10 minutes to downtown. Park City is about a 30 minute drive. I stayed while visiting my daughter and used the apartment as a jumping off point to all Salt Lake has to offer. It was a great stay.","Beautiful airbnb, cozy and the location is great! Gives you detailed instructions that makes your stay easy.","The community is gated, quiet, and safe. The home has everything you need for a trip: hair dryer, towels, laundry in unit, kitchen, tv, sofa, etc - yes, I mean everything. The room is clean and organized. The location is also very convenient if you are going to SLC for a trip. There are gas stations, 7-eleven, Mc Donald’s, danny’s nearby. The host is also very responsive.","Clean place good location","Kylie was a great host and very informative. The place was great and the accessibility to the light rail network was very nice. However as someone who was getting around by foot, the surrounding neighborhood was more run down than I was expecting, and definetly didn't instill a sense of safety as I was out walking. If you're not planning on getting around by foot/ public transportation, then I wouldn't say this is an issue though. The apartment itself was very nice and much more \"upscale\" than the surrounding neighborhood might make you believe. I would absolutely recommend staying here if you want somewhere that is very accessible from the airport and downtown."]

reviews:
["I enjoyed my stay. The host is very responsive and accommodating. They also keep the piece very clean with ample instructions.","Worst AirBnB I have ever stayed in. Communication was fine, but the apartment did not have the standard cleaning.
First, you have to go through a garage storage area protected by a wooden fence to get to it (didn’t seem the safest). Then, the front main door to apartment only shuts when locked and was open upon arrival.
Bath Tub was clogged and wouldn’t drain. Had to turn off water multiple times to allow for drainage during my shower. The shower curtain was disgusting and looked like it hasn’t been changed for months. The coffee pot was dirty with old used grounds in it and the pot itself was dirty. I couldn’t clean it because there was no sponge. Silverware had old crusted food on it. Pillows were stained and dirty which could be seen by the naked eye since the pillow cases didn’t cover the pillow.
Lastly, the hosts are very strict with no noise past 10pm, which was fine since I needed to be up so early for work. However, the main bedroom must be under their room as I heard VERY LOUD footsteps all night long into the early morning. You could also hear them literally using the toilet (you can hear the pee). So, I didnt get sleep. The hosts clearly aren’t mindful that we can hear everything - that or they didn’t care.
I usually never complain nor leave reviews, but everyone should know before booking this apartment. I don’t know how it got the stars it did, but I checked out the very next morning and called AirBnB for a refund.
The hosts did try to contact me and say sorry, but they blew it off as “you should have let us know and we could have fixed the issues” and “the cleaners dont drink coffee so they probably didn’t know to check it haha” - they literally gave this excuse and said haha after all the chaos I dealt with, it is not funny. This is not okay behavior and I really don’t care why the place wasn’t clean…it should have been cleaned.","Lynne was wonderful to work with as I needed a location close to our sons university and easy access to the stadium.","It was a very nice stay. Our host Lynne was very helpful and accommodating. Thank you!","Good place to stay it’s a 10 minute walk away from the trax which is nice","It was an amazing stay at clean and cozy home!!","Great location, particularly for our needs. We chose this rental because we have family that lives on the same street, but one of their cars was broken into one night we were there, and they have reported multiple car break-ins. But I assume this is just the side effect of a neighborhood close to downtown.

Note it’s a basement apartment in an older home, so you will hear a lot of noise from people above. It’s a good value for what it is. It could definitely use a really good cleaning.

Also note that there is basically no seating. The seats on some of the barstools were wonky. And the futon is very uncomfortable. But it was well stocked and we appreciated the access to a washer/dryer. You also don’t have access to the thermostat, so if the hosts aren’t home, it cannot be adjusted (at least this was my understanding)."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Naquita is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great place. Clean and comfortable. Great location and hosts were welcoming and helpful. Stayed for a month during and an A plus experience.","Beautiful home in a great location. Close to hikes and downtown.","I cannot say enough good things about this place. It was spotless, well-appointed, quiet, and the location was phenomenal. I could walk to the University for my classes, walk to a grocery store, and I could get things delivered if I wanted to, which I did once to save me time. The kitchen was great for cooking, the laundry easy, and Naquita and Jamie couldn't have been nicer. That's really key. They care that you're comfortable, that the temperature is right, and though I didn't have too many requests, they were always open and responded warmly when I did. You seriously can't do better in this area. Don't wait. Nab it!","My partner and I stayed here for almost 4 months and it was the perfect space for that. It was clean, well stocked, and had lots of space to store our bikes, skis, etc. Not to mention beautiful views and lots of natural light. Naquita was an awesome host! She was very responsive and made sure we were ok throughout our stay. We would definitely come back in the future!","We stayed five weeks and found the unit to be a perfect fit for our needs. Well located, exceptionally clean, nice views, a desk and a great storage room for all your bike/ski gear made this a perfect place for two people.

We had some challenges with the dogs barking the first night but Naquita was highly responsive and this was not an issue the rest of the stay. We look forward to staying again in the future.","This is a perfect place to stay in Salt Lake City! The location is extremely convenient. Naquita is so easy to communicate with and was so helpful with giving suggestions on activities and places to eat! The place is very clean and so modern. We hope to stay here again!","This place was an incredible stay that i would recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay in SLC. The decorations and amenities provided were second to none. The location is prime being that you are incredibly close to both the city and the mountains. Naquita and Jamie are both very easy to talk to, accommodating, and and friendly, which helped make this beautiful stay that much better. It is hard to imagine staying anywhere else after the 3 months i spent in their AirBnB."]

reviews:
["The place itself was cozy and welcoming. Had everything we needed.
A great stay! highly recommend","Dustin is a great host , responsive and flexible .
Will come back if we back in Salt Lake.","Dustin’s place was lovely! Clean, good light, and the hot tub was great. Would definitely stay again!","We savored each day spent in this apartment. The furniture, especially the extra large blue couch with the fuzzy blanket, is so comfortable and inviting. We loved reading and watching tv there. The decor is also perfect. I love the blue accent wall and how everything matches or complements that color. Somehow, the pictures on Airbnb don't do it justice. It really is a beautiful and functional space! I also really appreciated the high quality small appliances and the well stocked kitchen and bathroom. I brought my own coffee beans and grinder so the special filter on the Keurig coffee machine was absolutely perfect! The Ninja blender was also a handy surprise. And the towels match everything and are also high quality thirsty cotton. Plus there are extras in the dresser! We used those to go to the hot tub which also really enhanced our vacation. Dustin is so attentive to the small things! There was excellent shampoo and conditioner for the shower, and Qtips in the bathroom. Also a beautiful pan set, an excellent knife collection, and olive oil on the kitchen counter. Dustin really put a lot of effort into making this apartment luxurious, and we definitely noticed and enjoyed our time there.","Easy going all around. Will stay here again. Thank you much Dustin.","Great start- very responsive!","I would absolutely stay here again! Great location. Spacious and comfortable!"]

reviews:
["What this space makes up for in its’ outdated amenities is its location: very close by to downtown, with secure building and safe parking. Check in instructions straightforward and fairly simple to follow.
While the space was cute and decorated minimally, the kitchen was very outdated with an old and noisy fridge. All kitchen chairs were loose and felt unstable, there were a few cooking supplies available but no amenities: no coffee or teas, and no soap/shampoo/body wash in the bathroom. Internet barely worked and the cooling/heating system in the unit would not turn on or cycle during our stay. Could really use some updating for the cost."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I stayed over for my wedding weekend and it was lovely. This place is sooo cute inside and was the perfect place to get ready before the wedding. they've really put some thought into it. The host left super cute mini cupcakes and there was coffee and tea. We did have hiccups coming in. First, I do not know how I missed it on the listing, but this is a back house behind the garage, not a main house. Also due to the wedding eve chaos I didn't read the check-in instructions on time, so when we arrived I got on the driveway but saw a car in there which prompted me to read the instructions. Trying to back up and turn around, I got stuck in the snow. The host graciously helped us get it out. Also, I didn't realize the bedroom is in the basement. it's kind of cold even with the heater, but the bedding is heavenly so it was fine once I got in the covers. 100% recommend!!! PS: if anyone finds my gold/pearl wedding earrings, tell the host? pretty please?","This airbnb is a true treasure! We just came back from Italy and almost felt as though we were back in Lake Como! It was wonderful!","Exactly as advertised, this place is adorable. Extremely well decorated and well appointed. A homemade welcome pastry, well-designed lighting, quiet, cozy. All the details were thought of. The bedroom is a little chilly in the winter but then I found the space heater and it got things toasty in no time.","Adrian and Jordan’s place was perfect! It was by the far the best AirBnB I’ve stayed in so far. They were wonderful hosts…available if we needed anything, but respected our privacy. They thought of everything, including greeting us with homemade cupcakes and there adorable dog Tater. 10/10 would recommend their place to anyone visiting Salt Lake.","Great location. Super comfortable. Adrian and Jordan made us feel very welcome!","Staying with Adrian and Jordon was a wonderful experience. They were kind, caring and very warm hearted. 10/10 would recommend to anyone","My parents came to visit from out of town and had a great stay. My mother's specific comments:

My husband and I recently stayed at this charming spot and found it very clean and comfortable, as well as a safe and quiet location. We appreciated the attention to detail --room decor, tasty treats, informative literature for local restaurants and things to do. The bed was super comfy and we slept very well! We would definitely stay here again when visiting in Salt Lake City!"]

Sarah was very responsive and kind! Would definitely stay again!","This listing was so much better then what was said on the add. Beautiful kitchen, bedroom and living room. You really felt like you were living at home. Had everything you would need, as for cooking wear to prepare good meals. Had great complimentary popcorn and candy’s of sorts to help brake the ice. Having your own Laundry room is a excellent bonus , with added toilet paper , paper towels, laundry detergent and fabric softeners. I would never hesitate by staying here again. It’s so worth the price and then some.
I want to thank you again for having us..: Shaun and little senior citizen Patty."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few days while we were in town for a UT game. The location of this spot was perfect for getting to the stadium as well as having access to the city. The house itself was very clean and provided all things you might need. We were especially thankful for the washer/dryer. Only note is that there is a couple who lives in the basement unit and you can hear them (if they're loud) through the vents. Thankfully we only heard them during the day though! Otherwise, I would definitely recommend this spot!","This place is ok. It had been cleaned before I arrived, but seemed surface level. Had to go buy air fresheners when I got there. The location is great, but unless you're on a tight budget, I would find another place nearby.","Cute, clean space close to downtown SLC. The management was quick to reply and were very accommodating!","Great affordable spot near downtown!","Great place! There is a downstairs that is also an airbnb and you can hear everything if someone is there. also, the back yard is shared and not accessible from the main level of house unless you rent both up and downstairs.

we would stay again! Its in a great location!!!!!!! 👍 👌","Great communication. Parking on the quiet street was easy, but there also is a driveway you can use. With a keyless entry, we were able to check in whenever we wanted. I definitely will stay here again!","Good place. Clean, comfortable beds, great kitchen and wifi. reviews: ["I needed a last minute place to stay and work from home for a few nights. The basement suite was bright and clean and had everything we needed, including a workspace and really fast wifi! Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Myers Enterprises is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"95% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I stayed here for 4 nights. The place is exactly as described and pictured. I fully appreciated the well equipped kitchen as I do work remotely and liked to make my own meals from time to time. Walking distance to a coffee shop and local restaurant/bar and you can see the capital beautifully lit up at night. It was also very quiet during my stay. Would highly recommend staying here if you’re in town!","The place was the perfect size for my husband and I. However, the bed is very firm (I’m sure it’s hard to get a mattress that will appease everyone) and it squeaks with every movement. The walls are very thin so there was many times during the night that we heard our neighbors talking and laughing. I did contact once about the WiFi and that issue was able to be resolved. This morning we woke up to no hot water so my husband had to take a cold shower.","Worked as the perfect spot to come home to after skiing all day! Thankful for the washer and dryer as well as the big bed!","The place is a lot smaller than the pictures. I didn’t feel like it was cleaned great, was just dusty, had to rewash the dishes bc they were noticeably dirty, didn’t smell great, & some hair around. We tried to use the oven & I think they put some cleaner in it, but never actually cleaned it out so it ruined our food. The place seemed really cheap too, cabinets didn’t open right & there were stains on them. You can also hear everything from the guests in the other units, walking, cooking, phone calls, tv, children, shower running.

The bed was nice & the host seemed nice just took a bit longer to respond.

We asked to do early check in & it’s $30 to expedite the cleaning, which is understandable. We ended up deciding against it, then we arrived we were just a bit let down because it wasn’t cleaned great.","Awesome place that's a short distance from downtown.
Communication with the hosts was excellent.
Highly recommend this for a couple or trio looking for a nice getaway to SLC","Perfect stay if you want to walk downtown to an event or restaurants. Coffee shop down the street was great.","This place was perfect"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Lake City Flats is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Another super easy and great stay!","The Place: While this isn't your \"downtown loft\" or anything, I loved this place. The apartment was super clean and well set up. The kitchen was great and had everything I needed to cook. The host was incredibly communicative, preemptively knowing the things guests would need or ask. The building was quiet and clean. Great all around.

Location: This area was great. I was \"working from home\" during my stay and having the coworking space in the building was awesome. I could also walk to some of Salt Lake's coolest coffee shops in the neighborhood too. Seems like this area of town is up and coming with a new brewery across the street and some great restaurants a few blocks away. Be sure to check out Laziz Kitchen for dinner and Dough Miner (just downstairs) for some baked goods!

I'd happily stay here again!","Great host, very easy to get in touch with .","Great location right across from TF brewery, a two minute walk to the public train (Trax) station, which can take you anywhere around the Salt Lake Valley, and a super clean and new apartment with great light!","This place was amazing! Very clean and well furnished. They thought of a lot of little details that made it a great place for an extended stay!","Very well built and decorated! Great stay","All good.
The place was perfect for me... I love uncluttered Zen! Everything looked new, lots of great things furnished in the kitchen. The neighborhood is an up and coming area (still a bit of construction going on nearby)... with a perfect coffee place you can walk to in 5 minutes... the really fun Beer Tap Joint across the street has a surprisingly huge backyard hangout that you would never know was back there. Owner responds quickly if you need them!"]

Would recommend and will stay again if in the area.","Great affordable stay, would reccomend to anyone looking for a place to stay!","I only spent a quick night here … got in super late, road weary from driving in from Portland.  I was worried that it would be difficult to find, given that it was dark and I couldn’t see the house number. Thankfully, the directions were very clear - Toni is a wonderful communicator and very thoughtful. The space is super cute and well maintained, with modern and convenient amenities.","We stayed here for about 2.5 months and loved the place! The apartment is a good size for 2 people and there is a large storage area / closet that was perfect for us to keep extra things! We had endless food, bar, store options close by. We appreciated some of the local touches as well! The place definitely felt like home by the time we were leaving."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Espace de travail dédié","value":"Un espace commun avec wifi, bien aménagé pour travailler."},{"name":"Arrivée autonome","value":"Vous pouvez entrer dans les lieux avec une serrure à digicode."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, États-Unis
reviews:
["We had a lovely stay at the Laconia house while passing through SLC on our drive from California to Colorado. Sarah and Brian were so kind and left special treats for our dog (she rated them 5 out of 5 stars!). Not only is the house super cozy, the decor is next level. I got so much design inspo for my own home! The only downside was that the house faces an electrical substation so the front porch doesn't have the best view. Overall, would definitely recommend!","If SLC history matters to you - book it.
If cleanliness matters to you - book it.
If safety matters to you - book it.
If walkability, a full kitchen, laundry, and enclosed dogproof back space matter to you - book it!
And lastly - and this is vital for me - if DECOR and ~vibes~ matter to you - book it! (no grey farmhouse live laugh love stuff here! 😂)

Thank you Sarah and Brian!","Wuch a cozy space! Stylish, and excellent location. We really enjoyed our stay!","Place was great. Just a tad outside of walkable distance. But a fast Uber/Lyft to all the spots.","The Laconia was exactly what we needed after a 7 hour drive! Comfy beds, plush towels, a warm cozy space, a safe neighbourhood (to park our car full of stuff as I move cross country), and easy walkability. We walked to a restaurant for dinner and a delicious bagel shop for breakfast (thank you for the amazing recommendations!). House has adjacent drive way that fit our two SUVs no problem.

Sarah & Brian we’re super responsive, easy to communicate with and allowed us a bit of extra time at checkout to load up our car and get sorted - such a kind additional gesture. The house is beautifully decorated and well maintained on a quiet street. The renovations to this older house are very modern while still maintaining some of the older details that are lovely. House was very clean, had a nest thermostat (which we loved) and kitchen was fully stocked with supplies (extra bonus: tea & coffee for the morning!).

Would 100% recommend and would absolutely stay here again.","Sarah and Brian’s place in SLC was like visiting someone’s home, cozy, nice furnishings, super comfy bed (most important ) all the plants and art work were a nice touch.

If cooking with fiends , huge kitchen to work in…if eating out, house is close to plenty of restaurants and bars.
Sarah was great at suggesting breweries and pizzerias to hit up close by.

We would happily stay here every time we visit SLC","The bed is very comfortable and the street is very quiet. I brought my dog and he was happy there was a doggy door! Sarah and Brian were the friendliest."]

Location_city: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Lieliski piemērots attālinātam darbam","value":"Ātrs Wi-Fi (84 Mb/s), kā arī īpaši iekārtota darba vieta privātā istabā."},{"name":"Pašreģistrēšanās","value":"Iekļūstiet mājoklī, izmantojot viedatslēgu."},{"name":"Lieliska saziņa","value":"Jereme no 95% neseno viesu saņēma 5 zvaigžņu vērtējumu par saziņu."}]
location: South Salt Lake, Jūta, Amerikas Savienotās Valstis
reviews: ["Jereme place is the most comfortable private place for family. We had bad experience at the end checking out because the cleaner lied on us. We stay for a week at jereme’s. We stay in so many places but we never broke anything, yes we left some dirty dishes. But we never smoked inside or break anything. We saw a broken wall when we came in and we thought they knew about it but when we checked out they said we did it and that we smoked in the house when they saw us on the camera going outside at all hours. I would advise anyone staying there to check the place first before checking out. Other than that it’s a great place.","Jereme’s place was exactly what we needed for an overnight stay! Easy to find, close to grocery stores and gas stations, and the interstate. Jereme was also quick to respond and friendly. Thanks for hosting!","We were in Salt Lake for Thanksgiving to visit family, and this house was perfectly located for us.
