Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Özel çalışma alanı","value":"Wifi bağlantısı bulunan ve çalışmaya uygun ortak bir alan."},{"name":"Kendi kendine giriş","value":"Tuş takımıyla kendi kendinize giriş yapın."},{"name":"Kylie Süper Ev Sahibi","value":"Süper Ev Sahipleri, kendilerini misafirler için mükemmel konaklamalar sunmaya adamış deneyimli, yüksek puanlı ev sahipleridir."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Amerika Birleşik Devletleri
reviews:
["Great location, very secure with FOB entry access into building and the garage. Views from the room are incredible, mountains all around. Kylie was super responsive to the questions I had and was extremely helpful. The deck is great, nice to have outdoor space but just a heads up they’re close to the neighbors across the building. Had the cooking essentials and cleaning supplies as well - plus laundry in the unit, very convenient! Great stay 👍🏻","Everything is as advertised! Great location and great stay. Would recommend.","I am dividing my review into two parts, the room itself and the building it is located in. While the room had a few inconvenient problems I have serious concerns about the building and its security and safety.

The room-
The room was clean although beware that the room does have an essential oil diffuser which is problematic for people with allergies and asthma. The room does have very little storage space, there is no dresser to unpack clothes and only about 4 clothes hangers in the closet, so if you have clothes you need to hang or sort it is not the easiest to do. Also, there is no storage closet beyond the small one for your clothes, so if you have any gear you need to store there isn't space for this. There is also no bedside table or shelf for storage of nightly medical items. Otherwise, there is everything you need.

The building-
I am a female who travels alone on the regular. I take a few very specific precautions when I do. The biggest one being that I look for secured parking structures when I know I will be coming and going at late hours. The building is suppose to have a remote access garage door. The door was in the up and open position the entire time of my stay. This made the parking area feel very insecure. After my first night, I noticed a wall next to the door I was using had been vandalized with a drawing referencing the parking structure, and \"death is coming\". Let's just say I always had mace in my hand after that. Add to that, there is no signage pointing you towards which doors will get you to elevators, stairwells, etc. so you are left to wander and try doors in order to locate the correct one. The stairwells themselves are also problematic as the doors leading from the stairwells into the garage are difficult to open. One that I tried to use was stuck making me feel trapped in the stairwell. Additionally, there was garbage in the stairwell that was not collected or moved during my stay suggesting that no management or security was monitoring the stairwell. During my first night stay, there was a group down the hall yelling and screaming at midnight with sounds of items being tossed about. While it says the unit enforces noise through decibel level monitors, it did not seem to do much good. The morning before my checkout, I was awakened by the fire department banging on the door a few apartments down. I am not sure why they were there, but it seemed like there was a major water clean-up occurring as I checked out and left the premises.

All in all, while Kylie's space is fine, but the building it is located in and their practices makes this a very unsafe space for women traveling alone.","生活和交通非常便利顺畅。","Very, very cozy spot. Visited SLC for the weekend with a friend. Both the pull-out couch and the bed itself we very comfortable. Parking was easy and hassle free. Working with Kylie was very pleasant. Everything was perfect!","We loved this beautiful Airbnb. The view of the mountains was gorgeous! And the location was fantastic with just a short distance to the Oasis restaurant where we enjoyed a few breakfasts.
It was great having the lovely kitchen with all the conveniences of home, including the coffee machine with the coffee pods that Kylie provided.
The apartment was immaculately clean. And I liked the leather couch and the balcony.
Kylie communicated with us clearly and got back to us right away when we had questions.
I would definitely recommend this Airbnb.","Perfect location, cozy home and the bed was very comfy! The Wi-Fi was speedy, in unit laundry was very convenient, and loved that we had a parking spot. Kylie was the perfect host and was very responsive and helpful with our questions. Thank you for having us!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Daftar masuk sendiri","value":"Daftar masuk sendiri dengan kotak kunci."},{"name":"Bridget adalah Superhost","value":"Superhost adalah hos berpengalaman dan bertaraf tinggi yang komited untuk menyediakan penginapan yang hebat untuk tetamu."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Amerika Syarikat
reviews:
["This place was clean, convenient with friendly hosts; if needed, we will book this place again.","What a wonderful spot in Salt Lake!

I stayed here for a few months with my tiny dog. This basement in-law unit still gets a nice amount of natural light throughout and feels at once clean and home-y. And the fenced in yard is SUCH a bonus for folks with sneaky small escape artist dogs like mine!

The space is a true one bedroom with a full kitchen and bath, though couples should make note it's only a full bed in the bedroom!

The location is *excellent.* Street is quiet, completely serene. Though you're only just around the corner from a great little coffee shop (with wine + sandwiches in the afternoon) and about 2-3 blocks from both wonderful Liberty Park and a convenience store + gas. Truly, ideal location if you're a walker, jogger, or just looking for a supremely quiet and peaceful space in the heart of a great residential neighborhood.

Bridget was super helpful *always*! Was great getting to know both our hosts throughout our stay.","This stay was perfect for my four week medical rotation! Was just the right amount of space for two people and was in a lovely area to get to know Salt Lake City. Our hosts were super friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Highly recommend!","I loved staying at Bridget's Place. The garden apartment is super homey and comfortable. The location is convenient-a couple of miles from downtown but situated in a cute neighborhood with plenty of dining and shopping options. The apartment had everything I needed plus extra touches like artisanal local coffee and teas. I would stay here anytime I come to SLC!","This place was a perfect home base for our ski vacation. Very clean, cozy and well equipped. Bridget was easy to communicate with. The backyard was great for our dog to run around in. Would stay here again!","The host canceled this reservation 7 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.","Very nice, cozy apartment in a quiet neighborhood. Perfect!"]

Location_city: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."}]
location: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Nice","10/10 recommend , definitely coming back and staying here. Great area , very quiet. Close to alot of options","This tiny home is cute but not great for longer stays. There are a few adjustments, like adding a shade to the door and sharing the front pedestrian gate code, that would make this stay better.

Cool experience, but not a great place for comfort.","Talk about a dehumanizing experance. I work in the hospitality industry and have had nothing but positive experiances with Airbnb, Till now.
I should have left the monent I arrived. the grounds were a mess. An entite fallen tree, busted up concrete, awning laying on the ground and a refigerator sitting outside. I look trashy like nothing had been done since the fall.(even a pumpkin still there) I woundered if they knew i was coming. After a 9 hour drive i'm greeted by an ice box. no heat at all. A space like that will take hours to warm up. Yes the place was clean and yes they did provide a space heater but at $150.00 per night should't need a space heater.

The space was far from \"chic\" as described. It looks like it was done as cheaply as possiable. All white, blazingly brights lights, no color, not a single decoartive element., no table lamp NOTHING that woud show they were trying to provide a pleasing environment. Only hard wooden chairs to sit. Not a relaxing space after working all day.

So many odd things about thing place like the two electric gates that you had to get out of your car twice to open eack one. Their soultion\"Park on the street\". The water presure was usualy a trickel and then it would be fine. There was a spot light aiming into the glass entry door (no shade) that i asked several time to have turned off because it made it diffucult to sleep. It was turnd off then later turned back on. I was angry to discover it was a camera.

The entire time i had a sense I was being watched. after a week I just hated the place.I finaly had it when returen after a hike sunday and the door key pad to be compleatly inopeerative. My imediate reaction was they were not happy that I covered the camera facing the door and deactivated the lock. When i texted, it was working again.

It was just too weird and trashy. It seem the only interest the owner has is $$ and not about his guests.I packed and went to another hotel.

They have made it dificult to get any resoultion by giving me the runaround. I wanted a refund for 5 days. I also discovered structures like this do not require to meet code or inspection.

all around bad!","We arrived to find the home with dirty linens on the floor. We contacted the host and they offered us a new place or this one cleaned promptly. We chose the cleaning option, and they had it “cleaned” by 9pm. We initially thought all was well, except the heat was off in <30 degree weather upon our return and the house was very cold with only a quick cleaning job done. The next evening, we realized there was no laundry detergent in the house and the washer defaulted to the last used setting, rinse + spin, indicating the linens had only been rinsed. When we attempted resolution after the stay, the host accused us of lying about our complaints and refused any refund. My husband and I do not typically leave reviews unless they are positive as we understand that mistakes happen and try to give people the benefit of the doubt. However, given their gross misrepresentation of the cleanliness of the home and their blatant disregard for our concerns, we opted to leave an honest review. Hopefully they will change their behavior after this event and your experience will be better.","Loved my tiny home stay!! A really fun experience as a solo traveler. It was a cozy stay in the winter, I’m sure it’s just perfect in the warmer seasons when you can use full advantage of the deck! Also conveniently located 10-15 minutes from pretty much everywhere in SLC.","Sadly, this is the first negative review I’ve ever written since joining AirBnb. There is no malice intended in this review- it’s just that I would hate for anyone else to have to experience the physical discomfort and stress that we unknowingly signed up for when we booked with this host. Communication with the host was stressful and frustrating- their apathy made it apparent that their guest’s comfort and experience is not a priority to them. I don’t want anyone else to be left with the choices we were left with: to either suck it up and freeze by seeing their stay through, or taking on the unplanned financial burden of having to find a new stay at the last minute…in addition to the inconvenience of having to relocate.

While the tiny home was clean and as pictured, what isn’t pictured is how cold it is inside and that there isn’t hot water in the shower. It was January- both of those things are crucial.

We arrived late our first night, which is when we realized there was no hot water and that the unit isn’t sufficiently heated. Out of respect, we waited until the AM to reach out to the host. The host wasn’t at all helpful- one of the responses I received re: the fact that there was no hot water was,” There is unlimited hot water available. It's a tankless unit. Just move the shower handle to the hot side by rotating it counter clockwise (to the right). Let the water run for a moment and then you'll feel the hot water.” I’m not an idiot, and I had done this before reaching out. The host then offered me another unit for the night, but when I asked to see the listing for the unit they had in mind (to see if it would suit our needs), the host sent a string of texts such as,”The mode choices are Heat, AC, Off, or Auto. Select either Heat or Auto. Then choose a higher temperature, then your interior space will be very warm.” Here’s the problem with what the host was saying: There are two AC/Heat units in the tiny home. They are both installed on the same side of the unit, and one of them is in the upper loft area. The host doesn’t seem to understand that heat rises, it doesn’t slope down to a lower level. So, even with both units at max temp and fan speed, we were freezing as it was in the low 30s outside. They offered to send the maintenance man over but we had already spoken to him as he was doing work on the property. The maintenance man was helpful in explaining why we weren’t receiving the hot water at a desired temperature as the unit isn’t supplied with enough electrical power to heat the water during the dead of winter. He also explained that the AC/Heater units need to be placed in areas that follow the basic laws of thermodynamics.

Ultimately, we were forced to find a new Airbnb as it was too cold to be anywhere other than the bedroom with the door closed and the unit on max heat. We left the unit spotless and requested reimbursement only for that (2nd) night. At that point, all communication from the host ceased.

I have now been playing phone tag with AirBnb’s Customer Service team for 2 weeks. I’ve yet to make phone contact with the Customer Service Reps as it’s impossible for me to answer calls when treating patients & my work days extend beyond their scheduled hours.

We are now into a new month, and the whole experience with this host was and continues to be a stress and complete inconvenience.

One more thing to note- there is a motion-activated security camera that is pointed at the front door of the tiny home. The front door has a large glass panel, and the hosts didn’t put blinds on the door. There is no privacy. A light is activated when the camera is turned on, but the light randomly turned on throughout the night. Be very careful where you change."]

highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["The balcony was pretty and the location was great. Not a bad stay for one person, but my major complaint is that two-three capacity as advertised is uncomfortable. The full bed really only fits one person comfortably and the futon is not comfortable for sleeping because there is a metal bar between the two seats. On top of that, we didn't find any bedding or even blankets for the futon. I ended up the only two full towels provided and some other clothing as a blanket.

Also the TV was frustrating since we used it a lot. It had Netflix and such, which was nice, but it kept shutting off entirely in the middle of a show. Actions from the remote lagged so much that it would freeze up and we had to shut the TV on and off and try again just to pick a show.","Great unit! Excellent location, walkable to fantastic restaurants, downtown, the library, and good coffee.

Very clean and comfortable accommodation, well equipped kitchen, private, comfortable, and secure, with a parking garage.

Excellent value. Would definitely stay again if I were visiting Salt Lake City.

Thanks Melissa!","Melissa was very responsive to my messages which was great. The apartment was clean and cute. I would recommend to anyone with 2 adults and 1 smaller child. It is definitely not big enough for 4 adults (unless someone sleeps on the floor) and even 3 adults is a tough because the couch/futon was very uncomfortable. It was about a 20 minute walk to the Salt Palace.","This apartment is within walking distance to many worthwhile places to visit such as the library and the cathedral. A quick drive to other wonderful spots such as Ensign Peak Park. If you want a taste of city living, I recommend staying here. As the owner states in the description, city noises are present. We slept fine after each active day!","It’s downtown salt lake, nice inside and out, everything works, listing is accurate, Melissa is a great host ! Don’t hesitate to stay here 🫶🏾👏🏾","The price, location, bed, and apartment were all good, but a few mechanical and execution issues we encountered were aggravating and keep me from giving a higher score. I think these can be easily fixed and I have shared this feedback with the owner to improve. These included:
- Garage entry door card didn’t work from within my car. I had to exit car and hold up card near sensor to get door to open. Other residents I asked did not have this problem with their cards. This was not fixed during my stay.
- Door lock / keypad mechanism sometimes didn’t work on several tries due to issue with alignment between lock and door frame.
- Stocking of some basics like paper towels, TP, dishwasher soap, kitchen sponge, and washcloths was not enough for 5 night stay which I booked.
- Bedding not provided initially for pull out couch (I had communicated that we needed the pull out made for a 3rd person daughter with us).

If these issues had not been encountered then I think I could give a better recommendation.","Great location with secure and safe parking! The apartment was of nice value. The cleanliness was okay. A previous guest's sock was still on the bedroom floor and the walls against the bed were a little smudged and dirty. Very few/limited cleaning supplies available for the guests to use. Bring your own laundry detergent if you intend to use the listed amenity. A little impersonal, but it was a very efficient and easy place to stay. Overall, I'd recommend!"]

reviews:
["Cozy place for one or two people.
Great for long term stays. Quiet street and easy parking. Nice neighborhood and right on campus. Kitchen had all amenities.
Great place. Great find on Airbnb.","Jon is an awesome host and his flat is beautiful! Looking forward to staying here every time we’re in SLC! Thanks Jon!","Great apartment, very nice space and in great condition. Very well stocked and in a convenient location.","Wonderful place to stay! Super close to U of U! Host was excellent and very helpful and accommodating. We will definitely stay here again!","Jon was a fantastic host. He was responsive to the issues we had and made sure our needs were taken care of. We stayed for almost 3 months and were treated well the entire time. The property itself was in an ideal location. A 5 minute walk to the university and Trax station and a 10 minute drive from pretty much any store you would need to go to. The house was very cute and had enough room to not make it feel crammed. Would highly recommend anyone stay here!","Simply a wonderful stay in a pleasant neighborhood with friendly neighbors; Close to U of U & UTA Trax Stadium Stop; Owner/Manager was extremely attentive to my needs; and easy to get around to grocery stores & restaurants.","We enjoyed our stay for the most part. We loved that it was within walking distance to the University of Utah. We went to see a Supercross race and really enjoyed the proximity to the University stadium. Since the building is older, the walls are paper thin! We could hear everything the neighbors were doing. We did not like that. Also, there is a window in the shower that needs frosted. Others could see right in when someone is showering. Other than those two things, we enjoyed the place. Jon was nice and allowed us to check in early. He also checked in with us to make sure we did not need anything."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"93% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Highly rated Host","value":"Skyler has received 5-star ratings from 90% of recent guests."}]

reviews: ["We rented the tiny apartment, but it just didn’t meet our needs, for my wife just had back surgery. He helped us to get into another one of his units that was perfect for our needs.  A very nice unit.  So, go with Skyler and contact him if you have any problem and I feel he will take care of it immediately.  Thanks Skyler…","Skyler was on it from the start. Everything was where it was supposed to be. Would recommend this host always!!!","Overall a good stay!","have had the pleasure of staying at this airbnb, and it was exactly what I needed for a one night stay.  Fabulous stay! The place is VERY tiny I will make that clear, but it has everything you really need! I am also sucker for a modern looking bathroom and a rain shower! I loved using the bathroom the most! it's small but a very good use of space! and the television was an added bonus for me. Think of the space like an upscale dorm room suite. Skyler was also very communicative throughout the whole process and I appreciated that so much! Just a tip, definitely utilize the pictures to finding the room! Since the room is tucked away, I felt very safe! Thanks for letting me have an acommodating stay! My only tip is that if you're bringing a tiny fur baby, avoid letting them under the bed, it's very hard to get them out. Other than that, I would definitely recommend this place. ["This place was perfect for me

The apt is nice and spacious,I would say for up to 3 adults. The place is clean and stocked with all amenities that help to make your stay pleasant. We came for a concert and the venue was located directly across the street,which makes it nice to not have to drive or pay for a ride. Should also mention that there is a nice little out door sitting balcony that is nice to get a breath of fresh air if needed, since this apt is in the 4th floor. Would stay here again.","Fabulous!!! Clean, comfortable and secure","The apartment was beautiful and the location perfect for our concert at the Complex. Anthony was a great and responsive host. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Allen is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Extremely clean and comfortable. Very satisfied with the space and we loved the washer & dryer that even included detergent. Well stocked. We were happy with our stay.
Only thing was that we couldn’t control the A/C/heat. (I believe it was controlled upstairs). But it was usually a comfortable temperature and we would just close the vents if it was too warm.","great place to stay and they were super friendly and helpful! it was a really nice little place","One of the best rental experiences we have ever had! Great location, few steps from bus station and grocery. Very clean and comfy apartment.","Perfect place to stay during my summer internship. Walking distance from parks, Smiths, and Anayas Market. 10 min drive from downtown SLC. AC works great. Had all the amenities I could possibly need during my 3 month stay.","We lived here for 4 months in 2022 while my husband had an internship in Salt Lake City. It was a miracle to find this spot! It was a perfect place for us to spend a semester!

It was immaculately clean the day we checked in. Check in was simple and easy! The owners sent us an email the day before we needed to check in full of helpful information, like the Wi-Fi password, etc. There were 2 twin beds in the kids room and we only needed one and room for a crib. We texted Joe (the one currently taking care of Allen’s place) and he came down and moved it out of the apartment for us and into their storage room. Within half an hour it was taken care of! Anytime anything needed Joe’s attention (very minor things, like once when we couldn’t find the water filter replacement), he communicated with us immediately and took care of it!

On the second week we were there, Joe’s wife left a pile of childrens books and coloring books on the step for my kids with a note! They were over the top kind and helpful! Anytime a package for hs came to their door they came down and brought it to our step. They took the trash to the curb every week. They are great!

The apartment itself is a little small, with kind of low ceilings in some spots, but it was so beautifully taken care of and met our needs perfectly! The kitchen doesn’t have a dishwasher but it has filtered water, a full sized fridge, a microwave, stove, oven, plates, cups, bowls, nice quality pots and pans , everything you need!

The beds were comfortable and the bedrooms were well decorated.

There is a high quality washer and dryer! And a large closet for storage!

The shower was roomy and had good water pressure!

The location is about 10 minutes from downtown Salt Lake! The beautiful Marmalade public library and the murals surrounding it are 5 minutes away. There is a Smiths grocery store and Dominos pizza 2 minutes walking distance away.

We loved living here!!!!","Great apartment, cute set up and wonderful hosts.","Awesome, homey space with everything you could possibly need. Very clean and perfect amount of space for our group. Allen was very helpful and friendly. Definitely a way better stay than any hotel :)"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Savarankiškas atvykimas","value":"Pateksite į vidų naudodami kodinę sistemą."},{"name":"Kelly yra superšeimininkas","value":"Superšeimininkai yra patyrę, puikiai įvertinti šeimininkai, kurie yra pasiryžę užtikrinti svečiams puikias viešnages."},{"name":"Puiki vieta","value":"100  % iš pastaruoju metu apsistojusių svečių vietą įvertino 5 žvaigždutėmis."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Juta, Jungtinės Valstijos
reviews:
["Kelly’s charming bungalow is incredible! When you step through the front door it’s like stepping back in time. Yet, mingled perfectly with the beautiful mid-century decor, are the modern day luxuries.

There is excellent internet connection, motion sensor lighting in the bathroom, closet, backyard, blue tooth devices to stream music, large screen tv, Netflix/hulu/prime access, and a small dishwasher, etc

Kelly really has though of everything. The kitchen has every device imaginable, including multiple devices to make coffee or espresso. There are even essential oils and a face mask in the nightstand.

I’d definitely stay here again she will recommend her place to my friends.

What a wonderful, relaxing stay! Oh… did I mention how cozy the bed here is? It’s phenomenally comfortable.

Thanks Kelly!","This place has a lot of soul. I loved every little detail about it.

It’s in a great location and it was great to walk around and explore.

Kelly was great with communication and very kind, which to me is very important.

I highly recommend this place for short or long term stays.","Kelly’s place is in a nice and quiet neighborhood about a mile away from the Salt Palace and the Vivint arena the two venues we visited the most. It’s also close to Harmons grocery store. The bed is very comfortable. The kitchen has all that someone needs for their stay. It is a clean place as well. Kelly is very prompt in replying to any question you might have despite being in England (7 hours difference)","Lovely space with all amenities you could need. It was the perfect spot for my month long stay.","Perfect location in the city. Tucked away but close to everything. Kelly was a fantastic host and provided a great place to stay. The great communication and coordination help alleviate all the stress of lodging during my trip. Highly recommended.","This is a really special place. Kelly has put a lot of thought into it. Clean and comfy. Would love to stay again.","Kelly is very communicative and goes out of her way in providing an exceptionally comfortable apartment with high quality furnishings, located in a walk friendly neighborhood minutes away from the heart of Salt Lake City."]

reviews:

I would stay here again.","I did not stay at the house - our son and daughter did, while we stayed with our son who lives very close by. It was convenient and served our purposes well. Also, note that there is no dishwasher. Listing does not include one, but it's an easy thing to miss. Bradley was great to work with.","We loved our stay here! reviews: ["Great stay. Easy check in and check out. Great location. Clean","Awesome stay! Had everything and more ! Great location!","For what we paid, it was a good stay! The layout was nice, allowing space but also having a nice community space in the kitchen & dining. There was no can opener to be found (I could have messaged and asked if one was hiding, but we improvised), and no hair dryer despite the listing saying one was available (again, could have asked but we looked high and low…) but otherwise the space was functional. Fantastic location & good price. One warning, if you are looking for a “quiet” place, if there are tenants downstairs you will hear every word and every pin drop, additionally you hear a decent amount of road noise. I did use a noise machine app on my phone and that covered it all up though! Overall, I would stay here again if I was looking for a cheap and reasonable option.","Quaint neighborhood, great space, comfortable accoutrements, and great kitchen!!!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Julie is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I stayed here for four weeks in November. It was an absolute dream! Julie is a wonderful host - attentive, provided thoughtful recommendations, and was very responsive to all my questions.

The apartment is perfect for a long stay. Very comfortable, clean and has all the necessities. It is located in the basement of their house, but I had complete privacy with a separate entrance. Parking was on the street and very easy.

The location was my favorite part. The house is located in an beautiful neighborhood. You are across the street from a lovely nature trail and walking distance to restaurants, bakeries and a wine bar. Highly highly recommend this Airbnb.","Amazing location and host. Everything was thoughtful and comfortable. I will be back for sure.","Pete and Rachel were incredible hosts. Their home was immaculate and had everything required for a quick getaway or an extended home away from home. The location is close to downtown, the mountains, and the airport. They sent me tons of recommendations and even helped me find some furniture for my new apartment. They were super quick to get back to me with any questions I had and exemplified hospitality and kindness throughout my stay.","Great stay! Julie was very communicative and accommodating. The location was excellent for our needs to be near family. Very clean and a very comfortable bed. Would stay again and would recommend to anyone needing accommodation in the area. Thanks again, Julie!","What an absolutely lovely, cozy retreat ... fabulous location, sparkling clean, decorated in welcoming neutrals. The apartment felt airy, with lots of natural light. The bathroom was modern and the towels were fabulous. Lots of handy hooks, too. The bed was super comfortable, and there was plenty of storage space in the closet. The upholstered rocking chair was great for reading. I didn't use the kitchen, but it had everything you would have needed to prepare simple meals. Although the guest cannot control the temperature settings, I was always comfortably cool, even though it was hot outside during my visit. There are 20-odd steps leading up to a private entrance, but the incline is gentle and it was easily manageable. I would give this Airbnb 10 stars if I could!","Wonderful stay, spotless clean, Next to a park with a nature path, 5 minutes from downtown. air conditioning working very well, full kitchen, in a quiet neighborhood. Well recommended","Julie is most definitely a super host! She responded quickly to this newbies questions. The location is perfect. You are 1 mile from Rice-Eccles Stadium, less than 1 mile from all amenities and less than 10 miles from the airport.
The apartment itself is exactly as described and pictured. Light, airy, well appointed and immaculate. The bed is VERY comfortable. The central air was a comfortable temperature and there’s a tower fan provided if needed.
Being new to Air BNB I wasn’t sure what to expect and was very pleased with our stay. Some things to be aware of are there’s a flight of stairs (28 steps) leading up to the entrance. For an older gal with neuropathy this was a challenge. Parking is on the street which is the norm for this lovely, safe neighborhood. Also, this apartment is the lower level of a split level home. You are sharing her home. There are small children with expected noise during the day. At night it is quiet and peaceful.
Julie’s place is highly recommended and I’d stay there again."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great host, great place. Loved the hot tub, such cute accommodations, always fun to stay in a cool interesting place","We loved staying here! Becca's place is absolutely adorable and very comfortable. Our pups had a great time as well; the door opens right up into a big yard, and they loved the outdoor time. This location is centrally located and hard to beat; my sister and I were able to go everywhere we wanted in Salt Lake City, and were able to return easily to the airbnb at any point to relax for a few hours during the day. Highly recommend Becca's place!!","Becca’s place was very clean and comfortable. Great communication and easy clear check in.","The treehouse is cute and fit my needs perfectly. Calm and private, just enough space, but not too much (I really didn't want a big house just for myself) and in a convenient location.
I admit that having to go outside and to the main house to use the bathroom and shower might not be for everyone, but it was fine for me.
Though I never got to meet her, Becca was responsive online and accommodating when I needed to modify my reservation or had questions.
Positive experience overall.","I love this space! The pictures are completely accurate. The bathroom was not an inconvenience at all. Very clean, safe, and homey. I would gladly stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting the area. Becca was awesome and very communicative.","Very nice tiny house, ideal for trips alone or for two. Everything you need is available in the house. The fact that the bathroom is in the main building wasn't a problem for me either. Check in is very easy, communication with Becca is uncomplicated.","This Tree House cabin has to be the coolest and coziest AirBnB I’ve ever stayed in. It’s separate from the residence so you have complete privacy during your stay. It was so cozy, I stayed in watching Netflix most nights on the big screen tv. The host Becca is super friendly and communicates really well. I will definitely stay here again on future visits."]

["This is my second time at Marla's place. It's a great value destination perfect for a solo ski trip being 45 mins drive to nearly all major resorts in the area. Would happily come to stay again!","really great location on a hill overlooking SLC, but still really close by to the city center by car (around 10 minutes). the room itself was great value, everything was really neat and clean and the amenities were sufficient. we also found the interior design really cozy and cute. Marla was also a responsive and responsible host, making sure to look out for our safety during the winter.

but just note that you are getting what you are paying for - it is a basement room with no windows, and you'll have to carry luggage down a short flight of stairs. but we were more than happy to accept that for the many pluses and the price point. thanks Marla for the great stay :)","Marla’s listing was exactly as she described. reviews:
["Absolutely loved my stay here. The kitchen was superbly stocked, the bed cozy, and all that natural light ✨. I could have stayed longer!

If you’re looking for a great neighborhood bar, Handlebar is a half mile away. And the library is a half block away! Out of towners can get a card in seconds. And as a remote worker, having access to a free printer was perfection.

Jenna and her husband were amazing hosts and I’d recommend their place to anyone.","Jenna’s place was great! We stayed for 5 weeks and worked remotely. The internet was great and the location is perfect!","Great place had just about everything I needed! Perfect location , there was a Grocery store in walking distance. I was at a Convention at the Salt Palace I either walked grabbed a scooter or a short Lyft ride. The host was there with any needs I needed right away! Definitely will be keeping this Airbnb in mind for the future! ❤️✨️","This is an amazing stay! My girlfriend and I lived here for 2 and a half months over the summer. The apartment was very nice and clean. The kitchen came fully stocked with cookware. The only thing we bought was a whisk; everything else was provided for us. The ac in the bedroom worked great and the bed itself was so comfortable. Overall a fantastic stay. Would 100% come back here again.","This unit is awesome! A perfect blend of older charm & updated functional. It is well decorated & newly renovated. The kitchen is very well stocked for cooking with great cookware, dishes, spices & some breakfast treats. Jenna responds quickly to any questions or concerns. The neighborhood is relatively quiet & walkable. It’s a close drive to all that SLC has to offer. I really enjoyed it & recommend it!","Great place. Easy check-in and check-out. Very nice, clean apartment. Close to everything downtown. Great neighborhood.","Loved this place. The wifi was strong. I was on video calls all week with no issues. The kitchen has everything I needed. Jenna was helpful and understanding and responded quickly. Would happily stay here again"]

If I'm ever back in SLC, I know where I'm staying!","We had an excellent stay. Convenient location and the unit had everything you could need. Super clean and comfortable, would definitely stay again.","Excellent location and clean, modern abode. Just right for a single. Would highly recommend. Hosts are very responsive. Plan to return when in SLC again.","We enjoyed our stay in the studio apartment. The Airbnb was extremely clean and very organized. Doug and Scott were very helpful, detailing everything we needed to know about our stay. We would definitely rebook with them.","The studio apartment was so cozy and I felt at home the minute I got there. The space felt clean and so comfortable. It’s in a great location with easy ability to get to any part of the city within 10 mins. I got locked out my first day (user error!) and Scott & Doug responded quickly to help me out. It was a pleasure staying there and I’ll definitely be booking this place again!","Very clean, great location and ample parking. There are restaurants and a grocery store nearby. Doug and Scott are great hosts.","Doug & Scott’s place was a true gem. First, the communication with them and overall check-in / check-out was a total breeze. Everything felt totally secure as well. The location is the next best part - a few blocks away from 9th and 9th with plenty of shops and restaurants. It’s also only a couple of miles away from Sugarhouse and U of U’s campus if you’re up for a longer walk.

The place itself was wonderful. While it is a studio, the finishes and amenities made it so cozy and luxurious. Brooklinen sheets, brand new appliances and a huge shower - what more can you ask for?! They even provided snacks and a local guide of places to check out. I would totally stay here again."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Random and Debbie's place was amazing! I stayed here for ~3 months, and had absolutely no issue with the place at all - they were extremely responsive for any issues that I might have had and the apartment had almost everything I needed. The location is also really nice!","Amazing apartment. Everything you need to cook is available.  Apartment was spotless.  The bed is super comfy. Close enough to walk to Main Street. Super market is close by.  This is a very comfortable place to stay for any length of time.  Debbie and Random were always easy to reach and very helpful.  They are super nice on top of it.","Random and Debbie's cute condo was honestly such a blessing for me. I stayed in SLC for 4 months on an externship and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. The location is absolutely perfect - short walk into downtown, beautiful/safe neighborhood, close to so many great food places and even walking distance to the grocery store. The ski slopes are also less than an hour away depending on which one you go to. The condo is so well stocked and upgraded I barely had to bring anything of my own. I was so impressed with every aspect, I would move in here if i could!! Debbie and Random were also amazing hosts - very communicative and understanding. During the winter one of the water heaters in the building broke and they kept me updated on the repairs the entire time (the whole system was replaced and is now new and upgraded!!). This place is an absolute gem, and I'm so grateful to have had the opportunity to stay here. If i'm ever back in SLC I will for sure be renting here again!","Very clean and perfectly situated in SLC.","Debbie and Random’s location is truly the definition of what it is to be a Superhost. Their space emits their genuine kindness and welcoming attitudes, and it was a pleasure as well as reassuring to know they fully look out for their guests. The location is cozy, the neighbors are friendly, the garage is a delight and maneuvering around the city to the mountains is a breeze. Book this location not simply for the location but for peace of mind. Thank you again.","Great place for an extended stay in Salt Lake City. It had everything I needed for a comfortable stay. Random and Debbie are great host and easy to communicate with.","Great place just a few minutes driving from downtown. Very comfortable and perfect space for a long term stay like I had.  Debbie and Random are such gracious hosts. I would definitely recommend staying here."]

["We can say with great confidence that Melonee's place has the most \"thoughtfulness per square inch\" out of any Airbnb on the platform. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Michael is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["My partner and I booked this for his Mother and needless to say she loved it! They were doing construction which did cause minimal issues getting to and from the entrance, but Michael was very responsive with my concerns and addressed them accordingly. Being downtown and close to everything, but having the neighborhood of the Avenues is amazing! I would recommend this place for any group between 1-3 people as it was roomy, but cozy.","Great location, very cute and comfortable space! Michael was very responsive with any questions. Street parking was great - never had trouble finding a spot. I would definitely stay again!","Highly recommend - it was a great location, communication with Michael was easy and quick, and the bnb had everything you could need for a trip to SLC (including thoughtful touches and tasteful/modern design)! We would definitely return here on our next trip! One thing we did notice was that there did not seem to be window coverings, so just something to keep in mind if you have a schedule where you’d need to sleep during the day, etc.","Perfect location. Great view out over the park and the conference center. Eclectic mid century vibe. Beautifully decorated. The most comfortable bed. Gem of a place.","Charming place! Close to downtown. We parked our car and didn’t drive it again until we left. The windows look out over a park, and has a balcony so I could sit and watch the sunset over trees and grass and not feel like I was just in the middle of a city. It’s perfect if you just want a cozy place to call home base. But also had all the amenities if you also want to cook or hang out at home for some time.

It does back up against a poorer section of town, but we felt perfectly safe and the owners did an excellent job of making the alley to enter feel safe. They also did an excellent job furnishing the house to feel classy. Would definitely stay here again!","This location was perfect! It was clean, organized, well stocked (tea/coffee/amenities), and so enjoyable for downtown SLC. Would book again in a heartbeat!","Thank you for such a welcoming, comfortable home away from home. I was able to stay for a full week and it was perfectly situated for my time doing research at the Family History Library. You were quick to provide information and support when requested in a way that made it easy to get myself situated for my stay. The suite is well-stocked, very clean, with a comfortable bed. The private entrance and being separate from your home allowed me to come and go without worrying about disrupting your family. An easy walk to amenities at the City Creek Mall, and to the major sightseeing and research facilities for the LDS church and those doing genealogical research. The location also has some well kept green spaces, parks nearby. I hope to return for a future stay. Thanks!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Wayne's loft is in the perfect location to walk to anything you need downtown.

Everything was very clean and Wayne's communication was A+.

The rooftop balcony was very unique for an Airbnb. Perfect during the night when the temperature cools down. (I stayed in Sept).

Parking was great as you had a private spot in a covered secured parking garage with it's own garage door opener.

The loft was on the 2nd floor so getting to the ground floor was no issue without the use of the elevator.

I stayed two weeks and the unit was generally quite with the expectation of Sat night. It does get a bit loud as there are a couple of restaurants that do stay open past midnight in what seems to be only on Fri and Sat.

Overall I highly recommend this loft.","Awesome hosts. They communicated so well with me. They made sure I had a great understanding of the unit. It’s a unique space that has a very comfortable feel."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Gary is a wonderful host and person! I loved getting to know him as we communicated prior to our arrival and visited when we arrived. The space is on the second (top) floor of an old home in the “Avenues” neighborhood of SLC. Huge space, very comfortable. If you are looking for modern, shiny finishes this isn’t your place. The space is characteristic of a century old home with blemished plaster, gorgeous wooden trim work, large windows, a bird’s eye maple trimmed fire place (not functional), and gorgeous sun room with a view of the city. Only a few blocks from the capital building. Gary was wonderful  AND thoughtful, including some fruit, coffee, cream, and other “must haves”. He was not intrusive, but responded immediately to any questions. The value given the low rate per night was huge. On street parking DIRECTLY in front of the house was easily available every time we returned “home”. I intend to return, and hope to grow a friendship with Gary as he is a great conversationalist!","What a pleasure it was to stay two nights at the Spalding Manor flat.  The 1904 Victorian was  charming - inside and out.  It was very comfortable, relaxing, and I even enjoyed working from the lovely 'plant room' full of windows with views of the neighborhood and the city.  Great for fresh air and bird watching!  The location is ideal since the grocery store, the liquor store, a pub and a chocolate shop are located within easy walking distance.  Thank you Gary and Spencer!","Great place","This place speaks for itself Gary and Spencer are extremely easy going and down to earth the place is beautiful we enjoyed every minute of our stay","Amazing location, beautiful flat, Gary and Spencer were quick to respond and supplied us with all that we needed. They also loved on our fur baby, Archie.","Love you guys! Friendly, So sweet, communication was top notch. Can’t wait to meet you!","This was a fun and comfortable place to stay.  An amazing amount of space, great location and Gary and Spencer are very welcoming.  Highly recommend.  Wish I had been there in summer to see the garden."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"92% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We enjoyed the location of Skyler’s apartment but would not stay there again.

There were many things that should’ve been taken care of before we arrived for our 4 week stay. The garage’s ‘ceiling’ tarp was hanging down and there were lots of paint cans and buckets that we had to move before we could park our car. There were only 2 plates, 2 forks, 2 towels, 0 pillowcases and empty soap containers for the 3 of us staying in the apartment. We also had to ask for lightbulbs (we had to change 9 when we got there). The internet only worked when no one else was staying in the other units since it’s shared. These were all things that should’ve been taken care of before we checked in. The cabinets were full of old, expired, opened food that we had to toss and we had to clean up spilled honey that was all over one of the cabinets and everything else inside.

Other things that should be fixed- the drip in the fridge that we had to keep a bowl to catch the water and empty every other day, the dryer that makes the loudest noise when in use, the ac filter needs changed and smells like wet dog when on, the microwave worked for the first 3 weeks (however you had to put something in for 4 minutes that a normal microwave would take 30 seconds since it’s so old) but stopped working our last week, some of the tiles are cracked and move when you walk on them.

We chose this Airbnb because of the garage however the parking situation was not easy. It is a shared driveway that is constantly getting blocked by the house in the back/other Airbnb guests/housekeeping/maintenance/neighbors. One day someone parked in the driveway and left the property making it impossible to get our car out and having to Uber to work. The other frustrating thing is that maintenance uses the room in the garage to store their tools and used it on a regular basis even though our car was parked in there. When we asked the maintenance man about not going into the garage he said he “had to because it’s where he keeps his tools and Skyler doesn’t know what happens on the property”.

We travel for work and stay in Airbnb’s 50 weeks/year. We like reading honest reviews before we choose an Airbnb which is why we are leaving such a long, honest one.","This was a cute little place. Excellent location for downtown, it was clean and well maintained. The host Skyler was very responsive.","Very comfortable and a convenient location.","Skyler was very responsive and accommodating which I really appreciated. The listing was accurate to its description on the site. Cleanliness could have improved a touch, but other than that, the experience was really good.","It would be great if bedding was supplied ahead of time for guests - especially when it’s advertised as a two bedroom residence. No sheets or pillow cases or blankets were supplied for the pullout couch bed. Constant checking in made the stay feel overbearing. We came to enjoy the weekend and were made to feel bad by not responding to insistent messages.","Great private place, great location 💯","it was very nice and cozy, maybe the best location."]

reviews:
["Great place. Instructions for check in were clear, right by cafes/restaurants in sugar house. We drove over to park city; only took ~30 min, so pretty convenient for that too!","Great host. Outstanding space and location. Close to everything but so quiet it feels far from it all. Would happily stay here again.","Wow. Alicia has done a beautiful job at creating a quiet, beautiful, homey place to stay. It was in a wonderful location, heart of Sugar House with many restaurants and shops nearby. I stayed only a few days here and I would love to book this place again for longer, I never wanted to leave!!! I highly recommend Alicia's place as it fosters a warm and cozy feeling and is great if you're looking for a weekend escape, spending quality time with friends/family, or for a romantic get away!","Super cozy, just like the pictures! Great location in Sugar House walking distance to some awesome local restaurants, coffee shops, and shops.

Check-in and checkout was extremely simple and easy—none of that “take out the trash and do the laundry” while charging you $200 for a cleaning fee nonsense.","Alicia’s place was such a great place to relax at after visiting a couple of national parks. The parking and check in was easy and simple. The place was super warm and inviting. It’s really well designed and decorated for being an older building. Lots of space for two people. The roof is a little thin and it was quite windy when I was there, so maybe bring some earplugs if you’re a light sleeper. Wouldn’t stop me from staying there again though! Having a washer and dryer right outside the bedroom was great too. And there’s a friendly cat! Loved staying here","Alicia’s place was great! Me and my wife loved it. Originally I was skeptical like some of the reviews about the neighborhood but it wasn’t bad at all. It was very quiet! My wife loved it as it was surprise booking for her. We enjoyed our time there and definitely will be coming back next time we are in the area! 20/10! Definitely recommend","My husband and I had SO much fun here! We celebrated our first anniversary and this was exactly what we needed! I was a little skeptical because of the location, but it REALLY does feel like you’re tucked away from society. It was clean and had just about everything we needed.
15/10!!"]

reviews:
["Very private and quiet, the perfect spot for my first visit to SLC! I very much appreciated the local recommendations and tried the majority--including Red Iguana, Cucina, and the Kura Door. Had a great visit. Very walkable part of the city and a 4 minute walk to the bus line. Very close to the University of Utah for any students or trainees. No problem getting Lyfts from this location. Plenty of parking available too! Since I was there for 2 weeks, I greatly appreciated the fully stocked kitchen and I was able to comfortably cook as much as I wanted. Wonderful amenities in the bathroom as well! A true home away from home.","Five stars all around!","Booked this place for my parents while they were in town visiting. They loved being so close to hiking trails and cute coffee shops. The apartment was very clean and cozy. Callee was super quick to communicate and made them feel very welcome.","Callee’s place was perfect! We loved the location and were able to try a few different food places! The apartment stayed pretty cool and it was so great to have the office as I was able to work remote.
Highly recommend!","This is a really amazing spot. It feels kinda like a really cool wine cellar, was spotless, and had all the amenities I needed. Thanks!","Callee's basement apartment was amazing and everything we needed during our stay! She was very communicative and responsive. Will definitely book again!","This was the perfect stay or at least I thought was going to be. I was there for my YoungLiving convention which is non toxic products including essential oils. When we arrive it smelled very old and musky. I decided to diffuse some lavender since after all that is my business. Unfortunately the owner from up stairs got a headache and so I couldn’t diffuse or even have my products on the property when that was the whole reason I was there. She was really nice about it but I swear if it was not one thing it was another. Really hard to relax and not feel like we were being watched or going to get I trouble. Towards the end we felt not welcome and walking on egg shells. The bed was very lumpy and killed our backs. Oh! And there was pet hair all over pillows on the couch/futon bed that my son had to sleep on. PS we don’t have or nor did we bring pets."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["We had the pleasure of staying at Bryan’s Airbnb and had the best time. It feels just like home and has the best decor. The kitchen and living room are fabulous and has such a cozy vibe. Easy to access and parking is right in the back which was awesome. We had a great stay, felt very safe and loved it! Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend!","Very cozy! Beautifully decorated and great location! Close to tons of great restaurants, coffee shops, and fun activities!","Bryan's place was great. Super beautiful, newly renovated, great space. The location by the U is awesome and everything about check-in and check-out were easy. Bryan was easy to message with and we loved staying here.","We loved this newly remodeled home/unit that is located in a beautiful neighborhood. We felt right at home and so cozy. We were the first to sleep on the new Casper mattress that was super comfy. Having the comfort of extra blankets is always a good feeling, especially on a cold Utah night. The kitchen has absolutely everything you need. Every room has everything you need and everything was super clean. We love going to watch the Utes game at the U of U and Bryan's place is super convenient for doing just that as it is only a couple of blocks away. Lots of good places to eat nearby. He has the unit next door as well and we were lucky enough to have the opportunity to see it before we left. It has a larger layout and would be an excellent place if you have additional family or friends - we'd love to rent both places next time. We will definitely stay here again, and will also tell others about it. Thank you Bryan, we loved staying here so much that I wish we could live there!!","The place is very cozy and conveniently located!","Great place to stay! I was hesitant at first, only because it is a newer place and maybe others are like me and will want to check reviews first, with which none were available when checking out the listing. I decided to take the risk and it was very much worth it! Looks exactly like the pictures, very clean, and host communicated everything that was needed for check-in. Would love to stay here again for another trip in SLC!","Great location in a quiet neighborhood, very close to the university. This would make a perfect game day airbnb because it’s walking distance to the stadium! Bryan was great with communication and the place was perfect for a weekend getaway."]

I would mention though that it’s listed with Mountain View and that’s not truly accurate.  You can see a corner of the mountain range through one of the small windows.  So if outside views are important to you, this isn’t the place for that.  Everything else is wonderful!","This Centric Apt has it all - 💯 Digital Nomad Proof","Joey’s place had everything one could ever ask for. Go for it without any second thoughts 👍😊"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Loved this Airbnb. It’s a very cute space. I wish we spent more time in it. Hopefully will on my next trip to SLC.","We came as a group of 4 to visit a friend in SLC. It had everything we needed. Two of us work remotely and were able to have meetings and do work with no problems. It’s also a super short drive to downtown, parks, the airport, and anything else you need. The dishwasher and laundry in unit was very handy","Perfect stay while transitioning to a new job in SLC. Centrally located, quiet, and clean.","Great location. It was as described. We brought our two dogs and the neighbors are great! It was so homey we barely left since our trip was to take out daughter to a grief camp, it was great to be “at home”","We had a nice time at Nichol's place. The house is centrally located, within reasonable walking distance to shops, restaurants, and grocery stores, and convenient for driving to places further. The kitchen was very well stocked and check-in was smooth and easy. We would stay here again.","The apartment had everything I needed and more -  a nice washer/dryer and big smart TV.  I love to cook and there was a good selection of spices.  Tiffany was very accommodating and came by to check the lock when I somehow forgot how to use it halfway through my visit (???)","I travel for work and have stayed at a few airbnbs and this place was by far the best. It has everything you would need during your stay and is is decorated to feel like home. The bed and couch were very comfortable, and the AC worked great too. I was here for a long term stay and the communication was on point, and Tiffany checked in with me to see if I needed anything and was very responsive if I did. The neighbor was extremely nice, welcoming, and respected my privacy. His dogs are the sweetest too. The street is pretty quiet and safe; I went for walks and never had a problem. If you are coming to SLC, look no further, this airbnb is perfect weather you are coming for a long weekend or a couple months. I will definitely be staying here again if my job ever takes me back to the area. 10/10, would highly recommend!!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Catherine is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["I stayed at this apartment in Salt Lake for 6 weeks - it was just perfect for me! Great neighborhood and location, very cute little apartment. Highly recommend!","I stayed in this listing from May to August for a college co-op. The location was close to my employer and downtown SLC, shopping, etc. Try to catch a SLC Bees baseball game when in town. Catherine was very responsive to questions about the property. Thanks for a great stay and experience.","I had a great month at Catherine’s place! Quiet neighborhood, great space to work from home, and just a few minutes to pop on the highway to the mountains. Highly recommend!","My boyfriend and I came to Salt Lake City for a month to snowboard and this was the perfect place for that! It took around 40 minutes to get to the mountains (we have an Ikon pass) and 10 minutes to anywhere you need to go in salt lake (groceries, bars, coffee/cafes, restaurants, etc.). Residential neighborhood located a couple blocks away from the Liberty Park (very nice). You have really nice neighbors to each side of you that we never heard while in the apartment since the walls are so thick! The apartment seems bigger then what the pictures show which was a nice surprise. Lots of storage and space which we definitely used during our month there. It even has a small private outdoor space which we didn’t use since it was too cold but I’m sure it’s great when it’s nice out! Catherine stocked everything very well and everything you needed was there - washer/dryer in the bathroom, kitchen supplies, coffee machine & extra bedding/pillows! Our favorite was the pull out coach she had in the living room which we kept in the bed set up when we watched TV. So comfy! We would definitely come back!","Catherine's place was perfect for a long stay. Great location close to Liberty Park, the mountains, and downtown, plenty of dishes and cooking supplies. She is a great host and responded promptly. I hope to be able to stay again in the future!","The apartment is chopped up a bit which is actually really nice. The pictures kind of portray it different but there is one bedroom and the kitchen and living room are separated by a wall. The area is a bit iffy as well.. just watch your surroundings!! We enjoyed our stay over all though! Catherine was very quick at responding to questions/issues and cares about the people that stay in her place!!","Had super good communication with Catherine for anything I needed during the stay, would stay again! :)"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Sattar is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["The hosts were very kind and helpful, fast responses and if there were any hiccups, I did not notice due to smooth and easy communication.
It's a fantastic place too! very nice and well maintained. Downstairs got very cold, and apparently heat was out for that area while I was visiting, but the loft Master Bedroom was SUPER cozy and warm. 5/5 would recommend, and would stay here again!","Sattar was very pleasant during our interactions and the neighbor/land manager who lives next door was also. However I felt the reviews and description left a lot to be desired. I have lots of photos of spider webs, small spiders and dirt in every window seal at check in, the velvet headboards also dusty, no vacuum provided to clean yourself, the laundry soap provided was covered in soap and debris and hair from previous renters… I assume. The neighborhood is definitely going through gentrification and I’m sure will be cute in a year or so, but the area is not walkable; especially for a young female. There are lots of homeless people around, and construction on every corner. The homeless never bothered me personally and I had no issues with them but this location is NOT 9th and 9. The dumpster behind the Airbnb was lit on fire twice while I was there. If it weren’t for the outrageous cleaning fees and prices people are trying to charge for these half done airbnbs I wouldn’t mind small things but the price gouging accompanied with lack of attention to detail just isn’t worth the price it for me. If you’re staying here long term be aware upstairs has a high turn over of visitors that are here to party and it’s very noisy. 😊 a little white noise machine takes care of most of it.","Windows have blinds, which I figured they would, but you can’t see that in the photos listed. Place was perfect - clean, had everything I needed. I was requested to strip the slept-in bed of sheets and wash the dishes I used before I left. I felt safe and I would stay there again.","When I arrived, it was late and cold, I could not get into the door with my code since the battery had died in the keypad. I texted the management company and they kept trying to say I was doing it wrong. I had to get batteries from the keypad in the front to get into my place. Once in, it had not been clean since the last tenets that were there in November. The bed was unmade, dirty towel and dishes. There was even men’s dirty underwear in the bed! A housekeeper was called to come and do a quick clean, but she was very flustered and uncomfortable that we were there while she was working. I was also paying $3000 a month while staying as a travel nurse and was denied the management company providing me any basic paper products, I had to buy my own because, “long term guests don’t get that amenity”. The door knob batteries also died at one point and twice I was provided with the wrong batteries to replace it. I had to buy them myself. The management company accused the owner of not understanding much English, and not understanding the battery situation properly. It would also be nice if the airbnb upstairs knew I existed downstairs, I had to knock on the door a couple of times to ask people to quiet down after quiet hours because I had to be up at 5 in the morning. A housekeeper even showed up at 11pm to clean after guests upstairs left, you can hear everything being moved. Other than these events, the place is convenient to many downtown locations, good restaurants, the light rail was out back, making it easy to get to the airport. It was nice for just me to stay in during my travel assignment. I do wish the management company did a better job of making my stay nicer, I felt brushed off, or annoying, anytime I reached out. I would more recommend it for a short stay rather than a long one.","The place was nice, clean and comfortable!","The place was nice and clean. The check in process was not a smooth as others I have experienced. The location is relatively central but in order to get to most places you have to walk through some shady areas. We ended up having to Uber because at night it didn’t feel safe. The front door opens up to the tram tracks so there would be homeless people hanging out and there was dog poop all over the front yard that seemed to be accumulating daily. The actual apartment was nice but for surrounding area did not match its value.","Cute studio with ample space for four people (but it was just two of us on this trip) and nice touches to the kitchen. We went in knowing about the noise from other reviews about the upstairs tenants - we didn’t mind it (heavy sleepers). We overall enjoyed experiencing SLC while staying here.

We had some hiccups with checking in and took us about 15-20 minutes to access the unit. Contacted the owner and was forwarded to voicemail - unfortunately, his mailbox was full. However, we got in contact with Courtney and she immediately helped us get into the unit smoothly.

Parking was very convenient. The property is close enough to many establishments that we were able to walk and grab coffee and food, as well as being centrally located to Downtown SLC."]

reviews:
["Great place to stay! Will definitely book again if the opportunity arises","Great location in the center of town. Very quiet neighborhood but close to great restaurants and major roads. Comfortable beds and all the amenities needed to be able to cook, do laundry and relax. Very easy access through separate side door. Stayed for a few days and loved it!","Loved our stay. Josh is great host. Would stay there again!","Great place to stay long-term","Wonderful host and wonderful air bnb! We really enjoyed the set up with a well stocked kitchen, clean bathroom, comfortable beds, couch family of 4 could all fit on, easy in and out. Thank you so much Josh!","House was clean and well-stocked with the essentials - - lines, towels, pots/pans. The location is fantastic if you are looking to ski as you are right near both Little and Big Cottonwood Road. Easy to get to Alta, Snowbird, Brighton, and Solitude within 30-35 minutes without heavy traffic. Deer Valley / Park City was only 45 minutes with light traffic. It's a basement apartment so not a light of natural light, but if you are spending most of your time outdoors it shouldn't be an issue.

Check-in / out is very easy. The host provides a code you can use on the private side door. Convenient street parking right in front of the house.","Josh was a fantastic host, always went the extra mile to ensure comfort during my one month stay. I highly recommend him as a host."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, États-Unis
reviews:
["Location was beautiful, easy to access and very peaceful. The apparment was very spacious and had a lot of amenities that made it feel just like home. would definitely stay again next time we are in SLC.","Very Convenient","It’s Convenient and Quite","The location of this place is great if you are looking to be close to the mountains, and it's in a great neighborhood. We booked in a pinch due to some unexpected weather. For this being a cheaper bn'b to stay in, I would say maybe we got what we paid for-- but on the other hand I've stayed in other airbn'bs in this price range and had much better experiences.

Just some honest things to expect-- the doorhandle to get into the airbn'b is loose. There were used, dirty paper towels lying on the counter in the kitchen when we got there. There was dirty silverware put away in the silverware drawer. The shower has a soap dispenser on the wall that drips soap down into the tub which looks like it's never been cleaned up. There was so much soap on the floor of the shower that a) it was extremely slippery and b) the shower wouldn't drain, leaving you to stand in a tub of dirty water from your shower. Had we paid more for this place, I would have been upset about it. For now, mostly just grossed out haha","We had a great stay.","The stay was pretty okay. A little expensive for the experience. They had a lot of slightly strict rules but every interaction we had with them was pleasant! They were very nice.","Loved the open feel of the living room area for my kids and I. It was a very easy check in. Would definitely stay here again when I’m in town."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Jeff and Amy's place was absolutely amazing! The location is absolutely perfect, quiet and peaceful but only a mile away from downtown. The place felt like home and it had everything I could have needed. Jeff and Amy were wonderful hosts, very responsive to any issues big or small and always willing to help out or provide recommendations. I would recommend their place to anyone and will be back!","Exactly as pictured and it was perfect for my visit to the area. Very comfortable and convenient to all of the local sights. Jeff and Amy were great host and went above and beyond to ensure a great trip.","Jeff and Amy have a great place in Salt Lake City, the location was great for where I worked. The apartment is clean well taken care of, abd close to many amenities such as grocery stores and coffee shops.

I stayed for about 4 months and never had any issues with the apartment. The host always reached out and asked if I needed anything. It was a great day overall and salt lake has a lot to offer.","Jeff and Amy are very warm, kind, thoughtful and generous hosts. The condo is great and has everything you need and more for a short or longer stay. It's in a cool, walkable neighborhood that's close to everything. The neighbors in the building are also very friendly. Bottom line, it's a true gem of an airbnb with top notch hosts. I would not hesitate to book it again! Thanks Jeff and Amy!","This condo in the Avenues is fabulous.

Jeff and Amy went out of their way to make us feel welcome from the very start.

Our stay was 2 months while we looked for permanent housing, and this unit met our needs perfectly with all amenities as promised.

We recommend this condo for anyone who is looking for a centrally located place to stay.

Gerry & Vicky","Jeff and Amy are awesome. Convenient location, perfect place. I used it for a month whole moving to SLC, and they were helpful and very responsive to anything I needed. I would highly recommend staying at their place for a worry free and convenient stay, be it a month or just a weekend!","I have nothing but amazing things to say about this Airbnb. If I could give this a 10 out of 5 stars, I would. Jeff and Amy were exceptional hosts and made my long-term stay incredibly comfortable. The apartment itself was beautiful (even nicer than the pictures), super clean, great location, and had everything I could possibly need. I have stayed in plenty of Airbnb's in the past, and this one is by far the best. Jeff and Amy were even kind enough to leave me a gift card apologizing for all of the construction going on in the complex at the time, and I was greeted with a gift basket upon arrival. They also made sure to check in with me every once in a while to make sure everything was okay. I am truly impressed with the quality of service from the hosts and the apartment. Very happy that I found this place. If I ever come back to Salt Lake City, I will be sure to stay with them again!"]
