reviews: ["Super cute stay during my month in SLC! Small, but perfect for one person. Tons of thoughtful touches with basically everything you would need to stay for a while. The area is really nice and safe, with public transportation nearby. I did not need a car to commute to work. Only thing to note for light sleepers is the fridge/AC is a little noisy and the room is not dark at night. Nothing a sleeping mask or earplugs can’t fix. Overall loved my stay and felt right at home!","Great and comfortable place to stay. I had an issue with the bed and they responded so quickly and took care of it!","Amazing! I loved how cozy it was and the area was great. Would definitely recommend!","Excellent location right next to a cute little coffee shop and super close to a bunch of great city hiking and pet-friendly fun!","Everything was wonderful! It has great space and comes with everything you can ask for. It feels like home when you head to bed and is very comfortable!","We had an amazing stay!","Rented this darling apartment for my son for the summer, as he was in Salt Lake for an internship.  This was absolutely the cleanest Airbnb I have ever rented!  That alone makes it deserve more than 5 stars!!   Its an ideal location, close to downtown in a very eclectic area called the Avenues.   Apartment is perfectly appointed, lots of natural light and very quiet.  Owner's were responsive and helpful.   How lucky I was to find this gem!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Maven is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Comfy space and great communication. Maven are great hosts!","Beautiful place in an awesome location! I loved walking the Avenues and it was just a short walk to downtown.","Great apartment. The bed is extra soft.","The AirBnB stay was definitely 50/50 great and not so great. The unit is clean and cute. The location is only a 20 min walk to downtown and I could easily find lime scooters to get downtown and back.
They messaged me the day before my arrival letting me know the AC was broken but they were able to fix it, however, the AC vent is quite loud in the unit. I had to hide air freshners as I am quite sensitve to artifical fragrances so that definitely gave me a headache. The worst part of my stay was the neighbours dog who would bark endlessly when the owners left. The dog barked non-stop on Saturday night from 10 pm - 2 am. There was also many bags of dog poop that were left right outside the unit's entrance. Not sure if it was the neighbours or someone else. The AirBnB manager did let me know they would file a complaint in a timely manner when I let them know.","I spent a week at this property and had a great experience. The property was immaculately clean, described accurately in the listing, and was nicely spacious for my solo trip. I worked from home on a few of those days and found the small table and seating reasonably comfortable with a laptop. The internet quality was very stable and fast, 100Mbit+ and I had no problems using Zoom or streaming 4K video. The bed was plenty comfortable, and the kitchen had all the essentials I needed. The off-street parking is shared with other units in the building, and I had to park on the street a few blocks away for two nights of my stay. The unit gets limited natural light due to all the windows facing a building about five feet away but there is very good overhead interior lighting, so the unit never felt dark inside. The location is in a great location for both driving and walking with plenty of restaurants and bars within a reasonable walk.","Spacious, clean, and well-appointed! Close proximity to several terrific coffee shops. Thanks for a great stay, Maven!","This place was adorable! I have high expectations for airbnb stays, and this place was absolutely amazing. It was very central to everything in SLC. Check in and check out was extremely easy. I was worried about parking, but that was just as easy! There is free street parking in front of the building or the designated spots. The place is very cozy. I loved all of the toiletries (shower care, body/bath oil, and feminine products). I highly recommend this place if you are visiting SLC."]

reviews: ["The place was very clean, well furnished, and a great place to stay for an extended period of time.","Good location and good value. You get what you pay for. Debbie has managed to provide all the essentials for a functional stay, but has added some great decorative touches that make the place very comfortable  (we felt right at home very quickly), without giving it a cluttered feeling.  The apartment is very close to the terrific Liberty Park and Tracy Aviary, and just over a mile to the downtown core.  We're hoping to stay here again some day.","Debbie was a fantastic host for my in-laws while my mother-in-law received cancer treatment at the nearby university.  The apartment was clean and beautifully cared for.  Communication was prompt and thoughtful during the 1-month stay.  The location was convenient and the availability of a ground floor unit was perfect.","I fell through the stairs after they put me up in the wrong place then when they replaced one stair and asked why I wanted my money back, this was day 2 into renting it for a month...","The apartments are the perfect place for any length of stay. Everything was very clean and decorated very nicely.","A great place to stay for an extended stay! Neat and clean, located close to downtown, hosts are easy to work with. I would recommend this property to anyone! I had a great time!!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Debbie is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Debbie’s description on her Airbnb couldn’t be any more accurate. What she post is true and pictures are very accurate.  My experience with her hospitality has been great. Her place is located close to Downtown Salt Lake and Trolly Center, which offer an assortment of food , drinks, entertainment, and nightlife. All within walking distance . Uber or Lyft rides are easy to get or electric scooters are everywhere to jump on and go !!! There are also place just around inn the neighborhood to do the same. I found this place nice, attractive, and relatively noise free.  I would recommend this place for long , intermediate , or long stays.","Cute awesome place! Close to everything","Debbie was a great host! The Airbnb was clean when I moved in and well stocked with just about all the cleaning supplies and cookware that someone would need. Debbie was also super responsive to any problems that I had, like when the microwave broke out of the blue and Debbie got me a new one within 48hrs, which I really appreciated that. I just want to note two things for future guests, #1 There isn't really a dedicated workspace in this apartment, just a small counter with two stools which I never really found worked out height-wise for doing dedicated work on the computer, so if you're intending to use this as remote work station just be aware of that. #2 You need quarters to do laundry here, if you run out and need to get more quarters, there's a coin laundry mat about 2-3 blocks southwest of the apartment which has coin machines that you can use to restock.","Good location to much of SLC. The apartment was clean and comfortable. I really enjoyed my stay!","Nice stay in a great location"]

reviews: ["I immensely enjoyed this stay when I was relocating for work. This was a peaceful and beautiful respite. I was always surprised by how quiet it was. I slept very well here. I loved all amenities especially the storage and so many appliances fitting in this modern design surrounding. Loved all the sunlight in the living/dining. The thoughtful interior decor and having use of the garage helped make this feel like home. Sandy was always responsive, kind and generous when I needed anything such as extra tp or hiking trip suggestions.","Great space, great location. My partner and I stayed here for the month and had an excellent time!","I'm a travel nurse and stayed at Sandy's  for 3 months.  After a year of traveling, I can honestly say this place was the first place that felt like a home to me. Although small, the layout of the home makes it feel more spacious. There is a fully stocked kitchen and spacious bathroom. I also felt like the space was very private although it's located in a backyard. Very convenient to downtown, but quiet and dark enough at night to where you wouldn't think you were in the middle of the city. If I come back to SLC again, I'd love to stay here!","Sandy’s place is in a quiet tree-lined neighborhood, and only a short walk from some great restaurants, coffee shop, etc.","Loved staying here for 3 months. The location is perfect- walkable to the 9th and 9th square and grocery store. Such a cute tiny home and Sandy is great! Responds quickly and is super helpful.","First time living in modular home. Very interesting experience. The host, Sandy, is very friendly and kind. Highly recommended for city trip.","Sandy is a great host, gets back to you very fast, and her home has everything you’ll need it’s great."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Fast wifi","value":"At 75 Mbps, you can take video calls and stream videos for your whole group."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Alex is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Comfy, cool, collected 😂","Alex and Amy are incredibly attentive, considerate hosts and the place is immaculate! You could not ask for anything more from an airbnb. The place is spacious, comfortable, well furnished and very clean. The location is central with easy access to groceries/restaurants/other shopping, and is a short drive to Park City for skiing!
I will not hesitate to book this place again when I am back in Salt Lake City.","We had an amazing stay at Alex and Amy's place. They were very friendly and communicative about any issues. We had a few issues with the hot water turning off but they were very quick to respond and solve the issues. The place has everything you could need for a long term stay and high quality. One thing to note is that it is a basement apartment so it does not get much fresh air (need to crack a window) or light when overcast day. We had a wonderful stay overall and would highly recommend.","Alex is as others have described him in reviews: very attentive, responsive, and easy to communicate with. His place is very clean and nice. I had some changes I needed to make with the reservation, and he was very great to work with me, despite it being a bit of a hassle. If you want to be close to the action in Sugarhouse and stay in a comfortable place, I recommend this.","Alex's place is in a great, convenient location and the layout of the space is great. Alex was a great host and was very responsive to our needs.

We loved the double access to the bathroom from either the bedroom or the hallway, and the open concept kitchen/living room. It was so nice to easily walk the the grocery (.4mi) or the park (.8mi). Having a private washer and dryer was a huge plus as well as the home office in the bedroom.

We had most of what we needed in the kitchen to cook every day. We appreciated the separate trash, recycling, and compost bins. The sofa is super comfortable and the TV is big and clear.

There was plenty of space to store luggage and clothes, although a little tight on storing dry foods, which we just put and the ledge in the kitchen, and that was fine.

The Internet was fast enough most of the time to upload/download my video projects. There was a couple of times that I had to go outside and hotspot 5G signal from my phone for large files. My husband did several virtual meetings via the Internet with no problem. I lost cell service downstairs once or twice but really wasn't an issue.

The only thing missing was private outdoor space, but I did enjoy sitting in my camp chair in the front yard when the weather was nice.

Overall, this was a great experience and a perfect AirBnB for long stays. I would recommend Alex's place to anyone looking to stay in Salt Lake City for an extended time.","Super location, super host, super place","This apartment is perfect for a long-term stay. I felt at home in no time. Alex put a bit of effort into setting it up with all of the convenience of home. The location is fantastic! I'll definitely seek out this neighborhood for future visits."]

The beds were comfortable and the kitchen was well equipped for our cooking needs. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Cassidy is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Dog charges were a little high. Affected the overall value. Otherwise, a great rental.","Cassidy’s place was peaceful to sleep at, close to the airport, and not far from the University Of Utah hospital. We enjoyed having the washer and dryer. The thoughtful neighbor even shoveled our walk for us and put ice melt on the stairs. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.","We had a great stay at Cassidy’s place and would definitely come back! The neighborhood is up and coming, but we never felt unsafe. There were lots of thoughtful details and the design and decor is beautiful!","The apartment was upgraded nicely! The bed in master bedroom was SO comfortable! The price fit the space and location. Host (or property management) was very helpful!

A couple things that were not major;
•the water in refrigerator door shoots out so make glass is in the right spot.
•the couch is not very comfortable to lounge and watch tv. (But the master bedroom is!)

I recommend to stay here.","It was clean. Not immaculately as expected from the description but clean. Most of the furniture is metal and you are above someone else so it was very difficult to be quiet with a toddler. It was a great size and had everything to meet our needs. Parking was pretty tight. It was mostly quiet. There were times that we could hear the people below us. All in all, we would be okay with staying here again.","Great location near the airport! Wonderful, clean, and cozy apartment! We enjoyed the stay!","Pros...
It's close to the airport. I was a $28.00 Lyft ride at 4:00am and estimated $14.00 at 5:00pm
The space is very clean
The furniture is all new, functional and nicely designed and laid out
The beds are comfortable

Cons...
Not much around
The pet policy is hidden in the \"house rules\" and does not show up on the fees when searching. (many other listings do, so this is a choice of the host)
I searched for a pet friendly place. Other listings showed a $25 fee or a $25 fee per pet ($50 total) in the overall price, and that had a big influence on my decision. This listing showed no fee.
8 hours before check-in, I get an email saying there's a pet fee of $25.00 per pet adding $50.00 to the cost, making the place more expensive than my first two choices. It was too late to change and the other two options weren't available. Basically, it felt like being scammed. I'm not complaining about the pet fees, I just don't appreciate them to be hidden."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Dave is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great,","Great location, clean, easy check in and parking. Exactly as described in the listing. Would 100% stay at Dave’s place again. Highly encourage booking here.","Great, centrally located airbnb! Very nice and comfortable. Was just right for us as a couple wanting to get out and see lots in SLC and then be able to come \"home\" and enjoy a relaxing evening. We highly recommend this place!","Enjoyed staying a this never and very well maintained home.","Nice place. Covered parking and good wifi. Clean and had everything we needed. Host is responsive and helpful.
You can sometimes hear noise of walking and tv/music from adjoining units.","This is a wonderful place to stay in SLC! Loved it! I really appreciated the amenities offered (soaps/hairdryer/makeup towel/washer& dryer) and the fully stocked full size kitchen. The shower/bath was very clean and the water pressure was great! The bed and pillows are extremely comfortable. The blackout curtains help with the sun if you want to sleep in which was great! I don’t have a single complaint about the home. The location is perfect & close enough to downtown where everything is either a scooter drive or quick car ride. (We didn’t walk anywhere because it was pretty hot during our stay.) It is in a safe area right next to a police station and park, solo travelers can feel safe inside/outside the building) I actually had trouble falling asleep the first night because it was so quiet. We rented a doorless Jeep for our stay and felt safe leaving it in the garage overnight.

It’s in a central location so restaurants and activities are within blocks of the stay. Even if you plan to explore Utahs wilderness you can do day trips while staying here. Each day we did something different: drove out to the salt flats, drove through Antelope Island, hiked in Uintah national forest, explored Timpanogos cave, and ventured out into Skull Valley. Everything was no more than a 1-2 hour drive in either direction which worked out perfectly.

Dave was quick to respond whenever I had a question and was extremely helpful. I had a wonderful stay and highly recommend staying here.","Great stay!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Airdream is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great stay, would totally book again when I come back to Utah <3","Accommodated us last minute and the house was decorated so cute and beds were comfortable with great smelling sheets and good pillows. Fully stocked with everything you would need. Few snacks and bottled waters in the fridge which was super nice. Quick response from host. Very nice experience, wish we could have stayed longer!","We met our two adult kids here and also brought a pet. The house was a quick drive from my niece's house where we spent Thanksgiving. The kitchen was functional and the living room seating was sufficient but pretty minimal. The house has some fun furniture and interesting decorations. We had a great time.","Loved staying here would definitely book again.","Great Place to stay at! Highly recommend it if ever in Utah.","Dirty dishes in the dishwasher, laundry in the dryer. a loud neighbor living under you. we were woken up daily by crying baby(ies) and Christmas Cartoons.
We were in Salt Lake on business and putting in 16hr days, to be woken up was not pleasant.

\"Hopefully it isn't too much trouble to get you to push the start button\" Re dishwasher, seemed a bit passive-aggressive lol. Also was told laundry left in the Dryer is \"Normal\".

I run 3 Airbnb's and that is not Normal.

The pictures look great, but TV is about 25ft (or more) from the couch, remote did not work that far away, had to get up just to lower the volume.
No welcome package, although for the price, I wasn't expecting much.

No thermostat on this floor, so I assume the people in the basement control the heat.

The place was nice enough, the beds were comfy, was clean (for the most part). You get what you pay for.
This place is very affordable for a last-minute business trip.","It was cute, cozy and clean! I enjoyed our stay here!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"John is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Top notch host and rental. Would absolutely recommend and can’t wait to go back! 10/10","The house is beautiful &in a great area! John put a lot of thought &details into the AirBnB &it’s appreciated! He was flexible with check in a hour &a 1/2 early based off our flight. It was close to many stores, eateries, &quick access to downtown. This is a great spot for a trip to Park City! It’s quiet at night &the black out curtains in the bedroom were great! I do wish there was more private curtains throughout the house. The yard is wonderful &makes it seem like you have your own private hangout area with the gated fence! We realized this may be shared with the duplex next door, so we were always mindful when in the yard. We thought it was very nice that John came and introduced himself &gave us a “how-to” type tour of things in the home. After flying for some hours, I wasn’t feeling well &wished these were written down instead. There weren’t any check out procedures written, but we’ve AirBnB’d before so we cleaned up as best we could. Overall this is a GREAT place!!! Thank you!!","The other reviews are not exaggerating, this stay is amazing. John is incredibly friendly and the house has anything you might want. It was spotlessly clean and the appliances and furniture were all very high quality. This place is well worth it. Our only regret was that we couldn’t stay a little longer.","Johns place was great! He met me there and explained everything, even had a dog bed and bowls for my pup! He also had things stocked like drinks and a welcome food as well as a binder with a list of place to eat and go in the area! Definitely would stay again!!","All I can say is WOW.  By far the BEST airbnb experience I have had to date and I've been staying at airbnb's all year, so this says a lot!  Not only is the place gorgeous, has everything you need including the most comfortable bed ever it is also in a perfect area.  The host is amazing and John went above and beyond with check in and every detail in between.  I honestly want to live in this place!  Thank you so very much John! This is now my GO TO every time I pass thought Salt Lake City.","You know sometimes you see pictures and wonder if the place is really going to be that nice? This place is even better than the pictures. John is a fantasic host and met us at the house with bagels and oranges! Not to mention the stocked fridge and coffee and hot chocolate. He taught us how to work all the nice features like the fireplace and zero gravity bed. The house is also very close to many restaurants and things to do. We wished we stayed more than one night!","John’s place was the best Air BnB I have stayed at. It was exactly as shown in the pictures. The electric gate for the parking area was really nice. John left wine, snacks, and a stocked fridge. He was also very responsive to any concerns."]

reviews:
["We had a fantastic time staying at this apartment, can't recommend enough. The space is newly renovated, more than spacious for three adults and a dog, and close to shops, restaurants, and the mountains. Whitney was an awesome host and great to our dog. The backyard was also fenced which made the location private and safe. We will definitely try and stay here again next time we visit.","Whitney's place is exactly what I needed. There is a private entrance to the rental in her back yard. Very clean and spacious place and clearly renovated recently. Kitchen appliances worked great for cooking meals on nights in. I stayed for about a month and had no issues with privacy or noise. Whitney is super friendly and introduced me to som neighbors which was a ton of fun. she was always available if I needed anything and even did my laundry for me! Not sure if that was special treatment though ;)

I highly recommend Whitney's place for any long term stay - safe neighborhood, great host and close to everything I needed.

oh and super bonus points, her black lab has access to back yard and sometimes he sneaks down for cuddles if you let him in. Stevie is the best!","This is a great place to stay if you are wanting a place with shops and restaurant near. Close to everything","Great communication, wonderful place to stay for family and pets. Very quiet and close to where fast food and stores are located.","Great place to stay, if you don’t mind the basement and people living in the main home. Very spacious and close to parks, restaurants and cinema. Whitney was very responsive.","I definitely recommend this rental for your stay!! It was immaculately clean, smelled amazing and was everything we needed. It was very homey and I will definitely be booking with her again when I come back to Utah.","My family and I were moving back to the US with our toddler and cats. We needed a spot to stay that allowed pets and still gave us the comfort of a home. This was perfect! Even though it’s a basement apartment, light comes through the windows and we got to use the yard and visit the lovely chickens. Nice and new appliances and a big bathroom. We were walking distance to parks and grocery stores. Plus there is a lovely bakery right around the corner."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Amazingly clean! Very private, and quiet. Could hear a neighbor but was pleasant regular life muffles, absolutely not distracting or annoying at all. Rarely heard noises.
Having a laundry inside was immensely convenient and much appreciated.
Everything we needed for multiple nights and days. Very clean and newly upgraded.
TV in bedroom tho was logged out of streaming so we either could stream from casting from our media devices or use livingroom TV.
this place is excellently located just 2 blocks smack into the convention center, and Temple Plaza Traxx stop and one block from other bus routes, but it's 2 darned quite blocks, so wonderful wonderful location.
An easy and nice stroll to the beautiful shopping mall too, easy access to Pharmacy and loads of restaurants.
Gotta try Mr. Shabu!!
All in all it was an excellent stay and extremely accurate, which is quite important when traveling for events or with family that you need things to be as you chose it.","Good stay, close to everything","Great stay! Cute, comfortable, & cozy! Easy walk to temple square & vivint arena. I would definitely stay again!","Had a great few nights, Home was cozy and cute also right next to everything in the city 😁💯","Nice space, exactly what we wanted (and exactly what was advertised). Quiet area with a delicious coffee shop about a 2 minute walk away","It was a nice stay close to where we were attending a concert. It was decorated nicely. It’s a remodeled older home with all its quirkiness!","Place was super easy to find, and the location was great. Just a quick walk to get to downtown, and it was only a 10-15 minute walk to get to the nearest transit station. Check-in was super easy and straightfoward, and the gated entrance (and driveway) made it feel safe. There were some small space heaters in the living room, which helped immensely because the place was a bit on the chilly side, but depending on time of year there's no real way to avoid that. All in all a great place to stay for a short trip!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Becky is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["It’s a great location with lovely hosts.

Having said that, I had heating issues during the entire stay. The air conditioner was stuck at pre heating 90% of the time. I was given a portable heater which was not much useful as it turned the room into a sauna if left on overnight. On the day of checkout, I developed a bad soar throat because of temperature variations.

One other thing to be cognizant of - the rooms are under a yoga studio and you can hear jumping noises early am and late evening.","Really nice really clean will be returning!","I often come to Salt Lake to visit family. This is the best place I've found and usually the only place I will stay--often if it's not available, I just don't visit. There is off-street parking and it is within walking distance of many stores and restaurants. There is also a quiet neighborhood feel and many pleasant areas to walk!","Becky’s place is very accurately portrayed - clean and simple - and overall an incredible value. The space is small and without windows (basement units), but is very well kept, functional, and appears to have newer furnishings and fixtures. While we did not make full use of the shared spaces, the shared kitchen and laundry areas were also quite nice. This place is conveniently located in Sugar House and Becky’s communication was excellent. If the parameters suit your needs, I would highly recommend this place!","This has been one of my top AirBnB experiences. The room was outstanding and in good condition & stocked. The hosts were superb — highly accessible and generous in spirit. Would offer my highest recommendation to others.","Highly recommend staying here! The unit is set up so well - feels VERY spacious for a studio and has everything you’d need. Great location, walkable to cute shops/restaurants/etc. Parking is very convenient and off-street. On top of all that, Becky is a friendly and welcoming host. Can’t say enough good things about this place.

My stay is a long term one and I worked remotely in the unit - no issues with the wifi and typically take a lot of video calls throughout the day. Only con is that there are no windows since it’s in the basement which can be kinda disorienting but there is so much to do in the immediate area and SLC as a whole so getting out and about is easy.","Awesome place to stay in the area. Very clean and the host is very accommodating."]

highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Ken is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Ken is a wonderful host. He was already super communicative before we arrived. Then we got caught up in the air cancellations this winter which screwed up all our plans. He already had the 50% back cancel policy, but was super helpful as we tried to reschedule. Said he would provide a little more refund - and was very generous on Xmas morning. I hope he was able to rebook someone else in there to enjoy the holiday ski days we missed.

I’m the same way so super appreciate it Ken - exactly the kind of Superhost we need more of! Way more personable and supportive than Airbnb, and that’s me saying that as a Super-host with an Airbnb Plus listing for many years.","Clean, accessible, convenient and modern. Ken was a great communicator and the space was perfect for us!","A perfect little apartment for me and my family to stay while visiting Salt Lake City. Walkable to a delicious morning bakery for coffee, a hot pastrami lunch at Caputo‘s or a visit to the Kings English Bookstore. Quiet neighborhood. You can hear some noise from the neighbors above but that didn’t bother us in the least. Just wanted to add that so if you’re not a downstairs apartment person, you don’t cause issues for the host. Ken was responsive, informative and very kind. Would stay again.","Great place","Ken was available and easy to communicate with. The apartment is cute and clean and surprisingly spacious; perfect for one or two people. The beds were comfortable. The apartment is situated in one of the best spots in east bench Salt Lake.","Great location with plenty of street parking. Beautiful place!","I highly recommend staying at Ken’s place. I like the neighborhood setting, local grocery stores & restaurants are within walking distance. Centrally located, and only 20 minutes from the slopes for skiing and hiking! Communication was excellent."]

Location_city: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Innsjekking uten vert","value":"Sjekk inn selv med tastelåsen."},{"name":"Bra innsjekkingsopplevelse","value":"90 % av de siste gjestene ga innsjekkingsprosessen en 5-stjerners vurdering."},{"name":"God kommunikasjon","value":"90 % av de nylige gjestene ga Quinn fem stjerner for kommunikasjon."}]
location: South Salt Lake, Utah, USA
reviews: ["The place was great. Good proximity to dining and the interstate. I would stay here again.","The house was beautiful and very clean. The only downside is the house was freezing and the heating system didn’t work very effectively.","Thank you Quinn! We were looking for a last minute SLC stay and ended up at Quinn’s place… thank goodness! Great stay for a great price. All the basics, all you need for a simple stay. Clean. Home-y. Good location. Pay attention to the directions given, it is a detached building IN the backyard, I worried for a second I was accidentally walking into a random persons backyard— but be confident! In the backyard, just past the garage the entrance IS there. And it leads to a great stay! Couldn’t get the TV to work(was an Apple TV but wouldn’t connect?) but not the end of the world. We were there on a particularly cold night but the small heater plus all the extra cozy blankets that were provided were more than enough  and we were super comfy. Would recommend!","A wonderful stay, with great amenities, and location within the South Salt Lake area.","great little place to crash for a night or two!","Clean, quiet place.","Quinn was a great communicator. She was willing to work with us checking in early. If you are in need of a place urgently and aren’t picky this would be the place. We had booked it for our last night in SLC. During the day we came from our 4.5 hour drive and went in to check out the space. We thought it was okay. Too tired to care we went to the coffee shop Bjorn ( great strong coffee and friendly people). Then we went around town and came back late in the evening. Now when we started to examine the airbnb we began to see things that were questionable. I found toenails on the blanket in the bed. Then when I looked under the bed there seemed to have been used sheets stuffed under the frame? Next I went over to the lamp beside the bed and saw several dead roaches in the bulb area. I took some pictures of the space. Unfortunately, I cannot share them. Then outlets were exposed which made us felt it may be a fire hazard. Needless to say we did not stay because it left us feeling so uncomfortable."]

reviews: ["Good little apartment close to SLC. Worth the price.","Had a great time. The place was so homey and we had a great stay. There was also great food nearby and friendly people! Gas station half a block away. Short drive to the airport. Quick responses to any questions.","While we did experience an issue during our stay, John and Emmalee were OUTSTANDING hosts (quite the opposite of Airbnb support, which was downright awful, but we’ll concentrate on John and Emmalee for this review). I travelled with my friend and the two of us found one of the beds not to our liking, but I’ll leave it as personal preference (it was extra plush, which may be a great thing for some people 🙂). My friend is heavy set and I’m on the heavier end too, so the extra plush wasn’t to our preference.  John and Emmalee were kind enough to deliver an air mattress to accommodate us. As for the place itself, it was fantastic. Honestly, the place could easily be listed for a lot more than what we paid so it was an incredible value. Super comfortable and comes with your own parking space, just to summarize quickly. I would highly recommend John and Emmalee’s place!","Very great location, close to airport. reviews:
["The spot was extremely clean and the hosts were very responsive! We absolutely loved all the amenties and the bed was so comfy.","Highly recommend this place, one of the best airbnb's I've stayed in!
The location is beautiful, and conveniently located to both city and ski resort access. The apartment is brand-new and has everything you need: a very comfortable bed, fully stacked kitchen, nice sitting area with TV and a workstation to work remotely. There even is a convenient 'mud room' with washer/driver where you can store your ski's (incl boot warmers!!) .
Katrina and her family were extremely welcoming and made our stay absolutely amazing!","Very clean and comfortable! Love the mud room and washer and dryer was a huge plus for us. Plenty of space to unwind after a day on the mountain. There was even a desk for us to do some work as we were remote during our stay. Private entrance and easy parking in their driveway.
Sometimes you could hear footsteps or vacuuming as you are in the basement but nothing to ruin your stay! Would return!","Great location and wonderfully appointed.","Such a great, clean, functional place. The location is perfect. We came for a snowboarding trip and the Airbnb is only 30 min from the mountains."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 254 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a private room."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Chad is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great place! Overall a great experience! Everything was really clean and the instructions to get in were really clear. They didn’t communicate that the washer and dryer wasn’t working until the second day we were there, which wasn’t a big deal since we didn’t need to wash clothes, but if we did that would have been nice to know beforehand. The water dispenser from the fridge didn’t work, and for our preference the bed was a little hard. We really did enjoy our stay, though! Really peaceful part of town and feels really homey.","Everything was great. Wish the place had an oven and wish there was more going on around the spot. Also, for anyone with allergies like me, it’s worth noting that all the pillows in this apartment are filled with down feathers. Not ideal for me, but some people probably don’t deal with dust allergies. Also wish that all of the lightbulbs in the apartment were a warmer shade. The whole place has those fluorescent, stark white, energy-saving bulbs. It felt a little sterile. But the shower is AMAZING.","Accurate, clean and a nice stay.","Amazing Spot!
The apartment was absolutely beautiful, the location was super close to everything and we loved our stay! The bed was pretty uncomfortable for my taste, but I also have a bad hip & back so anything hard is difficult for me. Besides that - 10/10!
The three headed shower was AMAZING 😍","Great place to stay in the area. Very clean, easy to get around, great host. Worth every penny.","Great chic and modern space that has awesome features inside and easy location close to the public transportation, airport, etc. The hosts communicated perfectly with any updates or answers to questions. I recommend this stay!","Excellent space to stay in a great location. Easy to settle in and feel comfortable but quick access to many nearby attractions. We stayed in more than usual because it was that enjoyable and similar to how life is at home. Highly recommended."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["This place was comfortable, clean, secure, and the Kasa staff were very accommodating. Be aware that the location is at the center of a dense concentration of the un-housed, some of whom we found to be mildly aggressive at times, but it was worth it to be within walking distance of lots of top notch restaurants and bars like White Horse, Takashi, and Lake Effect. The apartment, the staff, and the Kasa team were all excellent, and overall we would recommend this place to others.","We enjoyed the cleanliness and location. Excellent communication when I had a question and I would stay here again for sure.","We had a great stay at Kasa in SLC! Convenient location and very clean apartment! They even left balloons on behalf of my husbands birthday which was such a sweet gesture!","very nice place clean and convenient. quiet and a pretty good gym","Cool place.","Communication was difficult leading up to the trip. I asked multiple times for early check in, but with an automated system I just got a generic message bounced back to me. I definitely prefer the experience with a real host, not a big business.
The location is near many homeless people and encampments, so not very safe.
I left an item in the room, but the cleaner said she wasn't able to find it. Earbuds with locators - I know for sure I left them in the apartment and my locator also said they were there as well. I'm more than willing to pay for return shipping. And related to that, I'm not sure how thorough it's cleaned because there isn't much there, so it would be a very simple task to find. There was also dirt and crumbs on floor when I was given the apt - saw it daily during my morning yoga. Either that or they pocketed them.","Excellent location for all downtown activities on foot and light rail. Great place!"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Jared's place is exactly as pictured.  We stayed for 8 weeks, working remotely, and had everything we needed to be comfortable.  The kitchen is well stocked with appliances and anything you'd need for your average cook.  The beds and couch were comfortable.  The location is an easy walk to downtown (about 25 minutes), near some local coffee shops, and in a quiet area.  The apartment complex was quiet - we never had any difficulties working from home.  We had zero problems, but with any questions, Jared was quick to respond.  We very much enjoyed our stay and used Jared's place as a home-base while exploring all the beautiful nature that Utah provides. Would definitely stay again if in the area."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Matt is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Absolutely wonderful place. Felt right at home. My girlfriend and I loved staying here and we would definitely do it again. Matt is a wonderful host.","Great, cozy, and quiet apartment. We stayed with our young daughter and the portable crib, high chair, and toys that were provided were a huge benefit! Definitely recommend. There were also Christmas lights up and down the street this time of year which was fun to look at. Close to coffee and food places too. Great communication during the whole stay.","The place was clean and cozy. Check in was super easy. Matt was really nice, he made sure we were comfortable with our stay. I highly recommend!
Loan Romero","Our stay was great! Matt was very communicative and had everything we needed. We travelled with our daughter so having the small table and chairs, toys, books and a crib was wonderful. Also we really liked the cover on the couch; it put us at ease. The backyard also has a small play ground. It was too cold for us to play but I’m sure a great touch when it’s warm.

The kitchen was clean and accessible. We had dishes for ourselves and our daughter to use. There was a full sized oven, microwave and fridge. It also includes a toaster and kurig. I couldn’t find a tall broom to sweep but there was a dust pan and brush along with other small supplies.

The bathroom was small but manageable. The shower was the only issue as it truly is meant for exclusively one person. Only a toddler tub is available for baths.

We loved the small fireplace heater. We didn’t have access to our own thermometer but what it was set at was fine. The host was clear we could ask them to change it if we needed.","What a great place! Very clean, easy access, full kitchen, plenty of room for the 5 of us. We are already planning another visit, don't miss this hidden gem at a great price!","This is a great place for families who want to visit Salt Lake City. There was plenty of space and it’s optimized to house both parents and kids comfortably. The best amenities include a crib (an absolute game changer if you’re traveling with a baby), a washer and dryer, a fireplace, and a kitchen. The entrance is separate from the main level of the house and the hosts upstairs are great at giving guests their privacy.","Loved it would stay here every visit if we could very clean and prompt when we needed things awesome stay!"]

reviews: ["I really did love this place but unfortunately I had to leave early but I would stay another night for sure.","Our group had a very nice stay here. Would stay again!","Great place to stay in SLC. Good price, nice place.","This was the second time we stayed here this month. It is one of our favorites. It is comfy and cozy and has all the amenities.","Everything about our stay was great!","Great place to stay! We stayed here for a night while traveling to CO. Will stay again next time in SLC!","The place is centrally located in SLC and close to the University areas and restaurants within a short driving distance. It has a great outdoor patio but unfortunately since it was very cold we could not use it. This is essentially the attic area converted to living space so smaller space with roof walls juts out. The living room and the bathroom are particularly small but does give a cozy feel. The rooms have air conditioning / heating for individual spaces. Overall though we were crashing here only for a night we enjoyed our stay."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Evolve is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Very cute place. Had everything we needed and was right across the street from the convention center where our event was. That made it super convenient. A little trouble getting in, but over all was a great place.","In line with other reviewers the check process was miserable. The check in sheet is completely inaccurate. Do not expect the key to be found anywhere outside the building. The contact for the listing, as provided on the sheet, was completely unreachable. Evolve, the manager of the listing on Airbnb, thankfully was reachable and was able to get me into the building. My advice is just call and /or message evolve directly and tell them you are going to need the number for the building call box to contact a person in the building who will buzz you in, from that point the lock box will be next to the listing door.

Also in line with previous reviews, the door fob did not work at all. You will have to use the garage lot buzzer to get in and out. Evolve tried to help me, but again the actual contact for the property was unreachable so the fob never got fixed. I hope the evolve can address the issues with whoever is supposed to be the owner and contact person for this listing.

Other than that the place was great. Loved the space and good location for the city. I just can’t recommend the listing with the communication issues.","Pros: It’s across the street from the Salt Palace Convention Center, this is why we picked it.
Cons: Evolve doesn’t communicate well. They sent us photos & the night we arrived the keys weren’t placed where the photos showed they would be. We had to call Airbnb, who called Evolve several times, but Evolve never responded until the next day, so we slept in our van in the alley, not a pleasant experience at all! Airbnb did ask Evolve to refund us the first night & they did.
The 2nd BIG problem was that once we got the keys, the fob & the clicker, that we would need to get in the building, the Fob didn’t work from day one!
I immediately reached out to Evolve & asked if they could get us a replacement because we were staying for 5 days & they said, “that won’t be possible.”
So they gave us a code to get in the front door, but there were actually 2 doors to go thru before you got to the elevator. So they told us that we would need to go quickly to get thru the 2 doors or else the time would run out & we would have to start over. The problem is that the code only worked about Half of the time!
Our family has been attending this conference for over 10 yrs, so we chose this place specifically because it would be easy to go across the street several times a day.
But unfortunately because the Fob didn’t work at all & the code only worked half the time, we had to go thru the alley, where there was homeless people & use the Garage clicker to go thru the back of the building.
This was unpleasant because of the homeless people who were in the narrow alley. Our other choice was to go the long way down the street, where there was also homeless people. Also, you needed two people because there are 2 doors & they aren’t close together, so one person had to hold one door open, while the other person went to the front door to let the rest us in the building.
It was a HUGE inconvenience, to say the least.
Otherwise, the unit is quiet, clean & comfortable. It is a loft, but they make good use of the small space.
If it weren’t for the issue of getting in the building & the company Evolve, who never reached out to us, we would’ve really liked this space.
We did see other people from the conference staying in other apartments, but I didn’t know them & never had the opportunity to ask them who they rented from? But their key fobs did work.","Check in will be a hassle. Just plan on it. You probably will have limited access to the building after you finally check in. Expect it. You can only be buzzed into the building by a mysterious stranger and the fob doesn't work for anything. The lockbox is inside the building, no longer at the garage entry so you will have to get instructions for how to be buzzed into the building to get the key. The only way you'll have to access the building is through the garage with the provided garage opener.

There are smells.

However, the beds and bedding were clean. The couch was comfy. The kitchen was decently stocked. The location was awesome and if you’re lucky enough to be there on a stormy night, open the windows and listen as the city quiets from obnoxious, insecure owners of reviving engines to thunder and rain on the empty city streets.","The price is comparable to a boutique hotel in the area, without the same safety or quality of experience - so next time I'll PASS.

Cons:
-Overall this is a poor experience probably due to this condo being managed by 2 different companies, who I don't think have ever been in the space or communicate with one another. You are given a number and email to a property manager who isn't able to resolve issues onsite. There's someone else managing the Airbnb messages. There's no need for it to be so confusing.
-The check-in instructions are inaccurate. They sent maps, pictures, text instructions - which were incorrect.
-my key fob didn't work which I reported as soon as I found out the first night, and they never resolved it. I used a garage door opener to walk in and out of the building's basement garage door (yea where cars exit) since I didn't have a key fob for my whole 4 day trip. That's not a great feeling as a female. My preference is to enter and exit through well-lit main lobbies and elevators.
-There were no utensils which I found odd because the apartment was well-stocked otherwise, with coffee and everything. Usually I look for an Airbnb over a hotel (especially when costs are equal) because it feels more at home and there's a kitchen I can use. But no utensils at all, not even a spoon for the coffee, was odd. I did report it immediately and it wasn't resolved.

Pros:
-The apartment decor / interior was well done
-they extended my checkout for about 2 hours which helped

Again, if comparing this stay to the cost of a chic boutique hotel in the area, I may as well do that and know that my problems will be resolved, that I'm safely able to enter and exit, and that I don't have to do my own cleanup at the end. I love Airbnb and have used it for so many years, all around the world and these faceless management companies make it a poor experience.","This property has a good location; however, we did not have a good experience there. Once we got there, it was a little challenging to find the lockbox for a key. The worst issue was, although the property mentioned cleanliness and covid policy, this property was not clean nor ready for us. It was not prepared for us and everything was used from previous people stayed there; ex. Blankets and bed sheets were used and messed up, towels were used and wet, some hair was on the beds, dirty bathroom, …
The only good point other than the location of this property was the property reimbursed at least the cleaning fee. Also, the guest of this property (the phone number mentioned) was not responsive out of office hours either.","Excellent location and walking distance from attractions and restaurants."]

["Great place! The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept incredibly well. I spent multiple days here and it was a great home away from home. Had everything I needed and I would definitely stay here again!","Hc was a very responsive host making sure we had everything we needed and gave us recommendations of things to do. The place was great, super clean and comfortable. Super easy to book and check-in!","This is a decent place for a single person or couple. There isn’t a lot of closet space and no dresser to put clothing in. If you plan on an extended stay, I wouldn’t suggest this if you like to unpack and “feel at home”. As noted, it is on a busy street. It was a little disturbing at first (we are from a rural area), but we got used to it and didn’t have too much trouble sleeping. We did have the tenants above us watch a movie in surround sound one night (that was worse than the traffic). It is a comfortable place to sleep, but if you plan on staying there for work or “chilling out” inside, this is not the place to stay.","The apartment is super nice, clean and well furnished.
We loved our stayed.
Definitely a good place if you are visiting Salt Lake City.
Communication with our host was flawless. We got out quieres answered in a fast pace.","This is a perfect location for exploring Salt Lake City. Numerous grocery stores and restaurants nearby. Even for walking if the weather is good. Close to the airport. Plenty of space and nicely renovated. Provided a comfy night before we flew out in the morning."]

Location_city: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Benjamin is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Would definitely stay here again!","He was great to work with!","This apartment was convenient & very quiet. We had a small snafu checking in. Benjamins instructions were precise. But, in the listing info, it said \"Self check-in with building staff\". Thus, we panicked a little when the office was closed. But after talking to Benjamin, we went straight to the apartment with no problems.  The listing info has been corrected, so it doesn't say that anymore. There wasn't a hair dryer nor blankets. There were 3 throws, but they weren't big enough for the bed.  But Benjamin promptly purchased us both a blanket and a hair dryer and delivered them to us. The bed pillows were very flat, so we purchased pillows.  Benjamin did offered to reimburse us. There are no \"room darkening shades\". There are blinds, but they don't keep the light out from the security lights outside. No hand towels or kleenex in bath, we used toilet paper.  I think the cleaning and staging crew just missed a few things. We would stay here again due to promptness by Benjamin.","Great hosts, friendly, quick communication and very helpful with minor needs! Would highly recommend Benjamin and Ashley. Place was well stocked even for an extended stay!","Great place to stay The host was very accommodating and commutative.","great!","Highly recommend staying here! It’s not far from the city and local mountains for hiking. The apartment itself is super clean and comfy to work from, hang out in or come back to after a day of adventuring. Benjamin was a great host and cared that we had a good stay. There is a park right across the street that we enjoyed taking our dog to every day. We appreciated having a parking spot and the lot was very safe. Would definitely stay here again when in town!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We loved our stay! Such a convent location. We were in town for a wedding and were minutes away from everywhere we needed to be. We appreciated the thoughtful touches, especially some kid toys, and our daughter was so excited to sleep in a bunk bed! We hope to come back and explore more of their great recommendations!","Such a nice place! Great location and well-appointed.","This little home in the Avenues is absolutely adorable. Such a cozy place, decorated in a fun and unique way, and in a great location! Within walking distance to a grocery store, a liquor store, a great coffee shop, and a few fun restaurants.

The arrangement of the home is great, with two separate living room/seating areas, a kitchen with all the basic necessities, spacious bedrooms, a bathroom with a great shower, and a private, fenced back patio with a large table.

The hosts are wonderful! So helpful and easy to communicate with.
If we come back to SLC, we'd definitely choose to stay here again!","It’s a beautiful home in a beautiful safe neighborhood. We felt very comfortable and we highly appreciated the kind communication with our host.
Highly recommended!!","Beautiful home in a wonderful location","My family of four stayed here for about a month. Even though it’s not a large house it felt very spacious. It is very charming and very clean! The deck was great and they even put in a new picnic table while we were there which was amazing! Location can’t be beat, either - walking distance to coffee shops, restaurants and only 35 min and you are in Park City. When there was an issue w the hot water, which happens sometimes, Jamie, the house manager took care of it so fast. The communication was amazing and we truly felt cared for.","Fantastic location and house with every convenience."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Eric is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I stayed at Eric's place for most of my travel contract in Salt Lake. The loft is in a central location downtown and close to everything- no more than a 10-15 minute driving distance to wherever you need to go in the city. Eric was an awesome host and was very responsive. we had accidentally locked ourselves out within our first week and the washer and dryer had issues during our stay-Eric was very quick to respond and remedy the situations- he is a great host!","I stayed here for a couple months on an assignment in SLC. This is an amazing Airbnb. It was cozy, well stocked, and in a great location. Eric is an amazing, accommodating and flexible host. He was responsive and kind throughout my entire stay. One downside to mention is that the walls are pretty thin and you can occasionally hear neighbors. Overall I had an exceptional stay here and would recommend.","I really enjoyed my stay at Eric’s downtown loft apartment! The location was fantastic for city living and conveniently close to freeways at the same time. The space also had a lot of character as well. The host went out of his way to make sure my stay was enjoyable and when I mentioned that the sofa area could use more lighting, he brought a brand new lamp the next day.
I would stay at this property again for sure!","Eric’s place was very clean and easy to check in to. I had a longer stay, and he was thoughtful enough to continue to provide for me / the space along the way too… dropping things off as needed. He went above and beyond and was very responsive throughout my stay."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We were on road trip across the country with our dogs. Salt lake was a perfect first stop to snowboard and relax a little. Jennie was amazing right away! Communication was excellent and accommodating the dogs was so kind. She even gave them a Christmas present of treats. The amenities provided were more than expected and Jennie made sure we felt at home and welcome. The yard is a puppy paradise! So much space to run around and play fetch. The hot tub was exactly what we needed after a snowboarding and the cold.

The space is small but organized well and was just right for us. The kitchen has everything you would need, including a coffee grinder! 🙌🏼 the space does not take much to heat up with the efficient units in both rooms (we stayed when the winter storm came through so that was a really nice perk).

The neighborhood was quiet and walkable to several restaurants and coffee shops; and was super welcoming to all!:)

Will definitely stay again and can’t recommend enough!!","Cute, cozy, and comfy. A nice little space with everything you need all close at hand. The outdoor space was cool. The fenced yard and gated driveway made it very private. The bed was very firm which suited me fine but my partners’ back couldn’t handle it.","This amazing rental in Sugar House is owned by amazing hosts who revive the coziness and quality experience one would expect at a Bed and Breakfast (minus the breakfast). They have expertly designed their home to provide all amenities that are needed including the extras like games and snacks. All of their furniture was comfortable and made me really set in for a stay that made me feel like I was at home away from home.

Some people may find the small studio cramped. But some people may also appreciate the great lengths the hosts have done to decorate the place to make it feel larger than life.

I am looking forward to my next visit in the Salt Lake Area and will always hope to be able to book a stay at this wonderful listing."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Steve And Kristi is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"95% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Really enjoyed our stay at Steve and Kristi's suite.  It is very bright, well-furnished, and well-heated, which was greatly appreciated as we were there when it was quite cold.  Kitchen is well-equipped, beds are comfortable.  Loved the location - easy to get in and out, and great walking distance to City Creek and Temple Square for the Christmas lights.  Thanks for a very pleasant stay!","Awesome, safe place to stay in Salt Lake City. Restaurants, historic sites and walking trails all extremely close within walking distance. Very clean and comfy place with everything we needed and then some. Would definitely recommend!","Beautiful home, love the historic district. Walkable to city center too. Great accommodations and great hosts. I’d stay again!","Highly recommend","Gem in the city! This eclectic space close to downtown is a great getaway in a beautiful historic home! The landscape was a pleasure to return to each day. The artwork in the home was beautiful. We enjoyed our comfortable stay and will be staying here again! Thank you Steve & Kristi!","A lovely place in a great location when visiting SLC","This apt is so cute and cozy!! We enjoyed our stay and the hospitality by Steve and Kristi. The apt was clean and  we appreciated all the conveniences and little details provided. It’s conveniently located within walking distance to coffee, grocery store, and shops downtown. Make sure you stop in for breakfast at Eva’s bakery.  It’s quaint and delicious! I took a lovely 20 minute morning walk to the Capitol and was able to experience it without all the crowds. Our favorite part about this place was the granny apple tree and the lavender plant out front. Don’t hesitate…book now!!"]

reviews: ["I love everything about Tatyana’s place.She is a wonderful host with a beautiful home that feels warm, peaceful, and relaxing.Tatyana replied me quickly and patient on my every question.The place provided everything I need and the neighborhood is also quite and friendly. It was the absolutely best Airbnb experience I have had so far. I really look forward to staying again.","This accommodation is clean, quiet and comfortable. Tucked away against the Wasatch Mtns it offers a delightful view as well as all the amenities you could ever need! Tatyana is a wonderful hostess and very communicative and personable.","Tatyana is an amazing host. I stayed with my kids and she was so thoughtful and caring—she left toys and books out for them to have something to do. She even left a cute kids towel to use! Everything was clean and was nicely set up and easy to stay in. We will definitely be back to stay with her again!","Tatyana is an amazing hostess and the place is absolutely beautiful! It is clean, roomy, and separated from the host’s house making it feel completely private! The view is beautiful and is in a convenient location to get to Salt Lake City.","A beautiful space and wonderful host!","Tatyana is such a gem, as is her Husband! We really enjoyed our stay here, and highly recommend it to anyone! The bed was great, the basement is furnished and cozy! Tatyana will make you feel at home, and make sure you have all you need! Five stars, we will stay again!","What an amazing stay! Beautiful location and pretty close to everything. Great view of the sunset and cityscape in living room window"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"92% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Being in the woods was incredible, this studio is close to skiing and so many trails.","My stay was just ok. From the pictures, I was not expecting a luxury resort, but I still expected basic cleanliness. When I arrived, there was a bag of trash on the porch (that was later torn open by animals), old food in the fridge, and dirty diapers in the trash receptacle by the fire pit. The bed sheets, bed covers, and shower curtains are stained. There was what looked like pieces of dog food under the bed.

One afternoon, two men startled me by showing up to the property, asking me to move my car, and saying they were going to do construction in the house for 4 hours. The host did not give me a heads up about this, and I did not know if I could trust these men. Luckily, the men were kind and agreed to leave. I was grateful because if they started doing construction work, I would not have had the quiet escape in the mountains that I had paid for or been able to remote work like I was trying to do.

With a little bit more love and care and cleaning, I think this place has great potential. Especially if you are just wanting a place to sleep that’s close to skiing and hiking. Skyler is a very responsive host who was easy to work with.","Perfect, super comfortable space. Beautiful inside and out, could not have been happier.","This is a VERY quiet little place to stay. Very beautiful outside on the deck. Perfect for my needs. It is plenty big for one person, and two people would be fine. The kitchen is minimalist, so don't plan on cooking major meals. Everything was in good shape, and Skyler was available to answer any questions.","Very relaxing stay.","this property was just as described but the proximity to the bus route and Silver Fork Lodge are even easier and closer than described. the fully functioning kitchen made eating easier, I reheated several meals. the bed was super comfy, with luxurious, hotel quality sheets. if you're going to walk anywhere, be sure to bring appropriate boots as the driveway is muddy and rustic.","Skyler was really easy to communicate with and quick to answer questions. The lock-off is super clean and spacious. Follow the written directions provided when getting to the house (they're a lot easier than GPS). The location is great and very close to Solitude and Brighton, you'll need to drive or catch a ride - walking is a bit too far. I will definitely be back!"]

Location_city: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 58 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a private room."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Jalam is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
reviews: ["The place is really good and has everything you need! Would like to come back later!","We loved our stay in this space! Although it's a basement, you have your own dedicated off-street parking and don't feel like you intruding on your upstairs neighbors. The ceilings are slightly lower than normal ceilings, but I didn't feel cramped (I'm 6'2\"). The space is light, airy and clean with just enough outside light that you really forget you are in a basement. We loved the split floorplan and the TWO bathrooms in this space. The location is also super convenient to downtown (<5 mins) SLC, I-15, I-80 (both <2 mins), the airport (10 mins) and was really a fantastic central location for us to experience the entire area. The neighborhood was also very quiet. Our hosts were also very friendly and accessible though we didn't really need them for anything. I would absolutely stay here again if in SLC.","The immaculate house was very warm and welcoming. Jalam was a outstanding host, very thoughtful and courteous. We highly recommend Jalam’ beautiful house!!!","Jalam was responsive and friendly. Thank you!","Great location in South Salt Lake with all the amenities that you need. Perfect place to stay if you have a lot of adventures planned and need a comfortable, clean place to sleep and get ready for your next day of adventure that Utah has to provide. Highly recommend!","Highly recommend this unit. We stayed for over a month during a move and couldn't have asked for a better place. Jalam and Jocelyn's unit feels like home - with every possible amenity you could ask for. On the rare case we lacked something, the hosts immediately took care of it. For a basement unit, it's very spacious and bright. Fixtures and appliances are like new and well taken care of. Don't hesitate to stay here.","Everything was perfect and clean. Checking in was easy I would definitely stay there again."]

["Nice little stay, views are beautiful. The spa was very relaxing and within an hour from everything!","Great place with amazing views. The hot tub is awesome. The bed is the couch itself so might not be best for people with back issues. Perfect for vacation, would highly recommend it.","This stay is obviously maintained to a high standard, everything was clean and placed in a tidy fashion.

The main room of the basement consists of the kitchen area and a small lounge area with a sofa and wall mounted TV. Just a heads up, the sofa is a pull-out bed, which is the bed listed. The bathroom and gym are down a hallway directly off of the main room of the basement.

The location is great. It is situated in a quiet

highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Alex is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Nice place, clean and organized, big screen TV. There’s a grocery store within close walking distance, a restaurant or two but I didn’t try them. Parking a large SUV can be an issue but not terrible. We’re expected to park in spaces that say for office use only and that can be a bit unnerving but didn’t seem to matter my car was there each morning. I was there for a business trip so local POI were not a concern just wanted a quiet space to stay and have a kitchen so I didn’t have to eat out all the time. I would book it again","Great location, spacious unit.

One note: for anyone sensitive to scents, conventional, fragranced detergent is used here. There’s also fragrance-y air freshener throughout the apt building (in the lobby, elevator, etc). Though I wanted to love the place I ended up checking out early bc I personally started getting headaches.

If you’re normally fine with this though, it’s a great place!","Had a relaxing weekend at this gorgeous stay. The location was great. Very close to the airport and shopping options were right across the street. The hosts were extremely accommodating. They sent very detailed information which was super helpful to getting around Saltlake city. My boyfriend and I loved the convenience of having everything close by.","clean and comfortable! nice stay","Alex was a great host. This was a perfect place to stay; safe neighborhood and within walking distance of many shopping options."]
