Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["It was comfortable and a great location for us!","Very nice and clean place. Conveniently close to everything","This is a beautiful, cozy, centrally located Airbnb. Stay here! You will love what Jeff & Stacy have created in this lovely little space. We were home away from home.","I travel a lot, both for work and for fun, and this is undoubtedly the best Airbnb I have ever stayed at.  The house is impeccable: a free standing structure of your own, with ample room that maximizes the use of space in every possible way.  The high ceilings and many windows add to the feeling of openness.  All of the appliances are brand-new and and very high-tech.  The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in.  And the kitchen was well-stocked with all of the pots, pans, and bowls you might need for cooking.  Finally, the location cannot be beat -- the house is just a few blocks from a great park and a short drive to all of the best places in the city (not to mention only about 45 minutes from Snowbird/Alta and Deer Valley).  I could not recommend more highly.  Save yourself the time of looking around and book this spot now if you're coming to Salt Lake City.","Jeff an Stacy's little house was perfect. Awesome location with easy parking. One of the best equipped Airbnb kitchens I've ever stayed in. All the appliances were new. We only stayed for a few days, but it would be a great longterm stay as well.","Jeff and Stacy’s back house was the perfect place for our ski trip stay!! The house was clean and modern and equipped with all the amenities we needed for a comfortable stay, and more!! Thanks again!","We had a great stay: Super central, quiet, just right space for the two of us, etc. Most importantly, we would gladly stay again. Jeff and Stacy were hands off and great at communicating (which we really appreciate!)."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Experienced host","value":"Carol has 31 reviews for other places."},{"name":"Highly rated Host","value":"Carol has received 5-star ratings from 100% of recent guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Carol's apartment is beautiful and set in a quiet backyard. It features large windows that let in a lot of natural light, and it's plenty spacious for two people to live in. The apartment is handmade and features clever designs and nice accents throughout. For an Airbnb, the kitchen is particularly well designed and spacious, which is perfect for longer stays. Carol is wonderful host, and she's a pleasure to interact with. She may or may not be there during your stay, but expect to see her around if she's living in the main house. I highly recommend anyone to stay here.","This unit is beautiful, clean, functional, and just as advertised. The features of the unit have charm and character, as it is obvious that Carol dedicated a lot of time and love to the space. The unit is in a quite spot but is also conveniently located nearby the amenities of downtown. We particularly enjoyed; being able to have dinner on the deck, the great windows for natural light, and taking walks through the neighborhood.

Carol is extremely attentive, welcoming, and helpful. She was always immediately available if we had questions or required assistance. It was a pleasure to stay here and to know Carol."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 99 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a common area."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Leanne And Bill is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I needed a place to stay for a few nights for a work trip and found Leanne and Bill’s place. Prior to arrival they provided clear instructions on accessing the property with detailed pictures and wished me safe travels. The basement apartment was extremely clean and cozy and beautifully decorated. They left a handwritten welcome note with thoughtfully selected snacks and beverages which was unexpected. If that wasn’t kind enough they also provided an assortment of often forgotten toiletries as another mindful gesture. The bed was very comfortable and made for an enjoyable stay! Leanne was out shoveling every morning clearing the walkway as town was getting lots of snow. Overall the hosts are very thoughtful and take a lot of pride in creating a peaceful and wonderful stay for their guests. I highly recommend and will likely stay again for future work trips.","Leanne and Bill’s place felt like home, for a weekend stay in SLC. It had everything I needed and more — I could live there!

It was in a convenient neighborhood close to parks, good restaurants, and regular shops for restocking essentials. Was able to head out to dinner, downtown, east side neighborhoods, and up into the canyons with easy drives. The living and kitchen areas made for a great spots to rest in the evening, and even work from the kitchen table.

The parking spot was convenient and easy to get in and out. Would recommend for anyone stopping through SLC.","I come to SLC often. I started using AirBNB in SLC a couple of years ago. This stay was for the week of Thanksgiving. I can say without equivocation that this was the best place I’ve stayed in SLC.
Perfect space for a single person. Apartment was clean and well appointed. I wanted for nothing.
The location is so central to everything. Easy to get anywhere, really.
Leanne was on top of everything. Very communicative and quick to respond.
Thank you for a very comfortable stay!!","The perfect hosts. They went to the nth degree with snacks wine and water available.
I have stayed in a few AirBnBs. this was by far the best.","This place is 5 stars. We were in town for a phd interview and it was close to the utah campus and very close to the trails. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Jennifer is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We loved loved Jen's place! The aesthetic was so cute, bedding nice and warm, thick luxury hotel level towels, modern appliances, cute coffee station, and basically had all the amenities we would need for our 4 night stay. They even had a welcome basket of snacks waiting for us. It is located in the basement of their equally beautiful Victorian style home, so if anyone in your party is over 6 feet tall, then they may feel that the ceiling height may be a bit low, but it was perfectly fine for my 5'3\" self and my 5'6\" daughter. The neighborhood is nice and quiet with ample street parking for cars and only 10 min from the Salt Palace convention center. The little touches that Jen made to their place did not go unnoticed. We would definitely stay here again the next time we visit SLC!","This was such a great place. The host was a marvelously responsive and friendly person. Not only was the place great, but she made it even better. Left us a sweet note and snacks to welcome us.

I will stay again.","We loved staying at Jennifer’s place. She was so gracious and responsive. The coffee and snacks were so great too! Loved the blueberry scones and ate them all. The place is spotless, comfortable and adorable!","What a treat!!! We walked in to be greeted by music playing, essential oils, and snacks. After our flight, it felt like I walked into a spa retreat. The pictures do not do this place justice. The decor is amazing, and everything well thought through. Everything was very clean. The beds are comfortable and having 1 1/2 baths with four people was so nice. Parking on the street was very simple and never struggled to find parking. The neighborhood is very sweet and beautiful. Location was fantastic. Highly recommend!!!","Such a lovely place. Super comfortable bed, gorgeous neighborhood and very well appointed with lots of thoughtful touches. Thanks also for the great hiking recommendations!","I think this is the cutest air B and B I’ve ever stayed in. The attention to detail and to the comfort of the guest was incredible. Very clean and the small personal touches like the welcome basket with handwritten note was so nice. Jennifer is very quick to answer any questions! Great area of town. Close to everything."]

highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Myers Enterprises is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Clean, liked the set up of the unit! Had everything we needed! Fire place was amazing to keep us warm and cozy! Host was quick to respond and very helpful. Location was perfect to proximity of downtown and temple square!","To quote Mary Poppins, my stay was \"practically perfect in every way!\" This is a beautiful place that looks just as pretty as it does in the pictures. I really loved the look of the place and it was so comfortable for my toddler and I. It wasn't hard to childproof at all, so don't be intimidated if you have littles. Don't get me wrong, I had to move a few little things to ensure they wouldn't be smashed or broken by curious little hands. But it was quick and easy - I just hope I put everything back where it belongs.

I love the keyless entry and the fact that they don't expect you to clean the place when you leave. I appreciate that when I'm being charged a cleaning fee. I still stripped the beds and washed any dishes I used, but it was nice knowing it wasn't expected or required.

I would love to stay here again! 5 stars 🌟 !","Very nice and clean and instruction were helpful and clear.","this is a nice, cozy ground floor apartment in the older part of SLC at the foot of the hill below the Utah State Capitol building. the kitchen, bathroom and washer/dryer are clean and well equipped. There is a nice gas fireplace and also a front porch sitting area with a table and chairs. It's perfect for a couple.","This place is wonderful! It was clean and cozy! The fireplace was awesome. The bed was comfortable, we will for sure stay here again when we are in town! The location was great as well.","Great location, value, and clean! reviews:
["Great place to stay for easy access to downtown and the mountains for skiing / hiking. Just two of us, but enough beds for a few more, if needed. Parking right out front was awesome. The place is clearly aesthetically pleasing, and everything worked as it should as well!! The owners responded super fast, which helped majorly!! Highly highly recommended!!","What an awesome weekend! James’s place was perfect walking distance to the show we went to at Kilby Court and also close to Fishers brewery where we could hang out with our dog and also get some amazing tacos from the food truck after a full day on the ski slopes.

The place itself was cute and cozy; our dog especially loved the back yard where she was endlessly entertained by the squirrels of the neighborhood! Bed was nice and comfy and perfect for binge watching some Netflix before passing out after a long day!

It was also a very short drive (could have walked if it wasn’t cold and raining) to downtown where we enjoyed good eats and a fun night of trivia at the Green Pig Pub!

Couldn’t have asked for a better stay! Would definitely return!","Adorable home in downtown salt lake! reviews: ["Loud AC but great stay","Enjoyed my stay here! Good communication, clean home, and very comfortable. Would definitely recommend!","I stayed at Allison's place for about 45 days while my family was transitioning into the Salt Lake area from an international location. The house was perfect! The house was big enough for my husband and two kids under 12. It was fitted with all you would need to be comfortable. My husband and I also worked from home during this time. The kitchen was small but definitely accomplished its purpose. Beds were comfortable and great linens were fitted. The location is close to downtown (I walked to work on some days) and the neighborhood has charm and really friendly people which made me feel safe. A large smith's grocery is 2 minutes walk away. Allison the host was easy to reach and responded quickly. I could not have chosen a better home for my stay while I moved into the city!","This duplex apartment has everything you need for your stay in SLC. I loved the location: walking distance to a grocery store, café, restaurants and parks. A quick drive down the hill puts you right in the city’s downtown! The apartment was clean, nicely furnished, fully equipped, with hot showers and a great heating system. I used the office every day for remote working. Highly recommended!","we had a really nice stay, great location, very clean and Allison was very responsive","We stayed for over a month at Allison’s place and had a great time. The whole place has a very homey feel to it, is nicely decorated and has all the supplies and amenities you need. Allison was responsive to our questions and requests and easy to work with. I would definitely stay again!!","My girlfriend and I stayed here for 1.5 weeks while working remote during during the week and snowboarding on the weekends. House was nice to work from during the weeks with good internet and an office room to work from. It was also good location relative to SLC and local mountains."]

highlights: [{"name":"Espace de travail dédié","value":"Un espace commun avec wifi, bien aménagé pour travailler."},{"name":"Arrivée autonome","value":"Vous pouvez entrer dans les lieux avec une serrure connectée."},{"name":"Angie est Superhôte","value":"Les Superhôtes sont des hôtes expérimentés qui bénéficient de très bonnes évaluations et qui s'engagent à offrir d'excellents séjours aux voyageurs."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, États-Unis
reviews:
["Great Airbnb with amazing location! The only bathroom in the apartment is inside the king bed bedroom. Also expect a little noise from upstairs. Overall a really wonderful stay!","Great location and large space!","It was a perfect place for our stay. Great location for the park and trail up the canyon, and also for walking into into the Avenues to visit family. The host was easy to contact and helpful. Super clean and comfortable. A great find and definitely will book again....","Super central apartment, 10 minutes walk from downtonwn. Wonderful area, quiet and with parks ideal for walking or jogging. .I recommend 100%. Angie is a very attentive host and concerned about the well being of the guests. We will be back !","Mostly lovely.","I feel compelled to expound on the wonderful experience that I had at this AirBnb during my 8 week stay during January and February 2021.

First, the location is fantastic. The AirBnb is located a short walk from Memorial Grove Park and the Utah state capitol. In addition, you are within walking distance of the Morman Temple and the downtown nightlife. To the West lies the Avenues and the University of Utah. I mainly spent my time skiing at the local resorts. Solitude and Brighton are ~45 min away, Alta and Snowbird are ~55 min away and Park City is ~1hr away without traffic.

The AirBnb is well furnished with a full sized refrigerator, stove, dish washer, toaster, toaster oven, and coffee maker. The dining area has a good sized table for eating and working and a large smart TV sits in front of a sitting area with a couch and chair. The AirBnb is one of two downstairs apartments and spans the right side of the building. Windows are present on three sides of the unit which results in plenty of light. Curtains provide privacy in the evenings. The unit was recently renovated and it shows. The kitchen was bright, modern, and easy to keep clean. Cooking pots, pans, and utensils were provided. The WiFi was adequate for working remotely and streaming TV.

What set this experience apart is the supplies included with the stay. I was provided with trash bags, plenty of paper towels, dishwasher soap, dish soap and laundry detergent. The AirBnb owner also owns a nearby apartment four-plex and I was able to use the single washer and dryer in the basement to wash my belongings. This greatly cut down on my expenses and was very convenient.

If I had to find fault with my experience, I would have to comment about the beds. The queen mattress in the main bedroom was the softest I have ever experienced. The mattress sits directly on the frame without a box spring. I brought up this concern with the AirBnb host and she provided a firmer mattress pad for the bed. While I put the mattress pad on the bed, I spun the mattress 180 degrees to see if that would help. During this exercise, I noticed that the flooring in the bedroom dipped lower near the headboard and this was translated to the mattress. I suspect this was driving the uncomfort I experienced. Guests who stayed in the second bedroom reported some chilly drafts and beds that were sagging on one edge due to people sitting on that edge. I was able to spin these mattresses around as well.

However, my experience as a whole was fantastic. The host was responsive and provided a mattress pad and additional kitchen pots and bowls at my request. I do not hesitate when I state that this AirBnb and host represent the best of the AirBnb platform for longer term stays.","Amazing location! We did not have a car for the whole trip and had no problems. The park near by is so beautiful and great for running/walking, and downtown is a 10 minute walk. The house was cozy and had everything we needed."]

There is a lovely peaceful vibe here that is good for the heart. Buddhas communicates exceptionally well and every message was a joy. I am an Airbnb Superhost, and I know special when I see it. Do not miss this gem.","One of the best Air BnBs I have ever rented (I’ve stayed in over 30 all over the world) Perfect space, awesome location, and the yard was amazing. Can’t wait to come back.","The bungalow was the perfect spot for our trip to SLC. Centrally located, comfortable, super clean, and even came with snacks! Looking forward to staying here again the next time we’re in town","Beautiful peaceful place. We loved our stay","Great place with great views. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Debbie is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Debbie and Tom are fantastic! This space was fantastic for my month-long stay. Debbie provided essentials like dish soap and toilet paper to start off, and I was able to comfortably use the space to cook, live, etc. I had a great, clean, and comfortable experience here!","I stayed here for 1 month while studying at the U of U. The clean, nicely decorated apartment is conveniently located between downtown and the University, with easy access to the light rail and several buses. There are numerous restaurants and cafes within ~1 mile, including liberty park and the 9th and 9th district. I stayed in #5 on the top floor and it was very quiet. Debbie and Tom were both very responsive and accommodating. I would stay here again!","Eightplex, we stayed in the amazing unit 5. we had some difficulty connecting to the internet but Debbie was quick to respond and situation was resolved in less then 5 minutes.
Apartment was very cozy and room was very relaxing, just what one needs after hiking in Utah. location was close to parks, restaurant, shops, couldn't have asked for a better place in downtown Salt lake City.","I ended up having to cancel my stay at Debbie’s place last minute, but she was accommodating and refunded the majority of my payment.","Debbie was an outstanding host! Each time I had an issue, question, or concern she immediately address the issue. We had an experience where the AC was not working properly and she immediately sent her maintenance guy to fix the issue. He temporarily gave us a window AC unit while the AC unit was getting fix. I had a chance to meet Debbie and she has a remarkable personality. She is full of joy and happiness which makes your stay very comfortable and enjoying.","Great spot, centrally located with many amenities. Look forward to staying again soon!","I usually like to give good reviews. When I walk in, a place always starts with 5 stars and only major difficulties, disappointments, or complete variances from the description decreases that score. This place is nicely decorated and strong efforts were made in the surface appeal. Unfortunately, this place had more than a tolerable share of detractors.

Firstly, the description of the property includes “dedicated workspace”. From this, one should expect some reasonably typical office space. For instance, a desk near an outlet and a decent chair. This place had nothing even approaching that unless they were counting the tiny bar table and two rickety barstools? (More on those later.) Or perhaps they counted the bed or the short coffee table and uncomfortable couch? Dedicated workspace was something specifically needed on this trip. I feel that is a reasonable expectation for and “executive monthly rental” headline including the words “dedicated workspace”. I took off points for that.

Second, there isn’t a piece of furniture that’s comfortable in the whole place (or necessarily in good repair). The couch is a broken down hide-a-bed that is not at all comfortable to sit at. The bed was hard and unforgiving. It reminded me of beds I’d stayed on at cheap hostels when traveling in India. I had to go buy a foam mattress topper just to rest reasonably well. I took that home with me, sorry future tenants. There are also a lot of flimsy and/or broken pieces of furniture. For instance, the bench by the front entry has 2 broken legs. They must have known the first broke and turned it around before the second broke because they are kitty corner from each other. There were two barstools, one was sat on successfully and safely a few times. Then my sister went to sit on the other to visit with me while I was making dinner and it immediately and dangerously collapsed under her. She ended up bruised badly. The stool’s seat welds had broken before we got there and it hadn’t been taken care of, leaving guests to get injured. I feel that hosts should certainly inspect for damages between guests and resolve those issues before they become problems for the next guest. I took off more points for those issues.

Lastly, there are various other nuisances, like a sometimes dysfunctional tub and toilet, less than clean when we moved in, no warm water to the bathroom sink, almost not enough hot water to run a full bath, extremely poor water pressure, frequent noises as if a rock tumbler were running in the utility area, no potholders or kitchen dish towels (although they did provide a nice set of dish cleaning supplies), steep stairs with narrow treads that make it difficult and a bit iffy to haul luggage in and out, remote so dirty it grossed us out too bad to even use the tv, etc. I’ll stop there, you get the point. I just feel for the money we paid, dealing with that stuff was a big ask.

The host was polite and courteous and did respond to my messages promptly. I think this could be a decent stay if the hosts could fix most of the items I mentioned. We left a week early, losing money, and don’t regret it."]

reviews: ["Will stay again.  We travel frequently to SLC to visit family and this is now one of our favorite rentals! New, spotless and a fantastic location. Walking distance to some of our favorite restaurants and easy parking and access. Cody was extremely fast to respond to all communications!","This was such a delight for my son and I for a one night stay. Truly fun around every corner to experience the 1920s vibe throughout the unit. Such a great design effort to incorporate that theme with a new remodel. I adored the tile and wall paper that fits right in with todays style while still coordinating with the design of the roaring 20s. Cody was very responsive and accommodating to our last minute late night arrival and easy and friendly to communicate with. The off street parking was perfect for us and easy to find. We enjoyed our well needed rest on comfortable beds with many pillow options. I also appreciated the white linens and towels. I am looking forward to booking with Cody again at one of his other newly renovated units knowing that it would be on point with design and the hospitality that we experienced."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Bennett And Lori is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Wonderful place. Great location and very homey. Communication with the hosts was fantastic.","Stayed for a month of skiing around Utah. Great place to stay in SLC. Really enjoyed the fast wifi, garage parking, condo gym, and views from the balcony. Walking distance to the Utah Jazz NBA arena and several great restaurants. Would certainly recommend this place to friends and family.","Bennett and Lori’s space is phenomenal. It’s beautiful and the location is unbeatable. Do yourself a favor and stay here If you have the chance to book","Beautiful condo.  Tastefully decorated, well maintained, and very well located.  I especially appreciated how quiet the place is.  I don't think I ever heard the neighbors.  There are some events held at the Gateway on random weekends that I could hear.  But they were not obtrusive and they were shut down by 10 pm.  No big deal at all.  The location is walking distance to several restaurants, a small market, movie theaters, and Vivent Arena.  Other than that, you'll want to drive or take Trax.  Bennett and Lori were always very quick to respond and unbelievably kind.  I highly recommend.","Lori and her family’s downtown condo is an absolute gem of a place. The location simply cannot be beat. Overlooking the Gateway mall, you are footsteps away from shops, restaurants, and even a small grocery store. There are fun activities available each weekday night during the summer (yoga/pilates classes, free movie night at the mall, dance classes); a short walk to the farmers market on Saturdays; occasional weekend events and only a 30 minute drive to Park City for epic hiking.  For the air bnb itself, the place was exactly as listed, scenic views from the balcony, quiet neighbors and for those working while traveling…fast wifi and even a small desk with a computer monitor (major plus!). I highly recommend Lori’s condo and will honestly look to return of back in SLC. Thanks again Lori and family!","Was not able to stay here but the hosts are incredible!!!","Lori was super helpful. I loved the underground parking - extremely useful and my favorite item was the fireplace for the chilly nites. Everything as expected and Lori was super communicative and extended my late checkout after I had a run around with my car rental. Very clean, great communication - highly recommended.  One note: I was traveling solo and so I did want a car for ease of access to grocery stores etc, but parking was a breeze. Also gym in the building was closed to COVID, but the Metro gym was a few steps away and mostly empty and great rates."]

We will be back!!","Great location downtown Salt Lake City! The house was super cute with great accommodations! If we return to Salt Lake we will be sure to return to this place.","The house was in a great location, was very clean and really worked well for our group. reviews: ["A very comfortable & quiet spot for our sojourn in SLC.  The setting is lovely with historic interest as well. Learning about the history of the home made it feel more unique and inviting.","A lovely home in a nice location.  Nicely renovated and decorated to suit the history of the house.  It is a basement unit so the windows are small and at ceiling height.  The owner, Tino was very helpful and we appreciated his tour of the unit which included the history of the house.  It was very interesting.  We will definitely stay again at this property next time we are in town.","Awesome pad!","We loved everything about our stay at the Red House. Tino and Rebecca have put in a lot of thought to make our stay comfortable and homey. Highly recommend staying here if you are looking for some peaceful time in a gorgeous location.","What a wonderful place to stay!  The Historic Red House is one of the best Airbnb’s we have stayed in. Tino was excellent at communicating with us. He met us when we arrived and gave us a fun tour of the property. The yard area is gorgeous—all decorated for fall. The guest suite we stayed in was beautifully decorated, very clean, and so warm and homey. We had plenty of room with a full kitchen that was stocked with snacks and food for breakfast. The beds were very comfy.  The guest suite had lots of games, books,and magazines for entertainment. A great bedroom for children for sure with lots of things to keep them entertained. We enjoyed watching a movie in the reclining theater chairs. We had a wonderful time and just wished we could have stayed longer. We will definitely return to the Red House.","What a beautiful location!  I wish we had had more time to enjoy it!  Every convenience was thought about.  I loved learning the history of the building and other places in the salt lake area."]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["House was as described,was everything we expected and needed","We really loved our stay here. We have stayed here already a couple of times and plan on returning again. We had to come to SLC to take care of some medical issues and this was perfect as it is very close and easy to get to the University hospital. This little house is so very cozy, peaceful  and comfortable to stay in. It felt just like being at home. The kitchen is fully stocked with dishes and cooking supplies. It made it very comfortable to cook and stay there for my mom’s recovery, especially since we also had access to the beautiful, secluded backyard which felt like it was out in the country side even though it is right in the middle of the city with convenient access to everything. I highly recommend this rental and the hosts are very accommodating and pleasant to deal with. This is a space that I will try to return to whenever I go to SLC.","We had a wonderful stay in the guesthouse.  It was clean and well stocked with supplies.  The neighborhood is quiet.  We enjoyed the garden view.  Rachel was great with communicating.","Our family really enjoyed our stay here. The windows wrapped around to give a wonderful view of the yard and garden, which was lovely. Beds were comfortable, laundry next door to the unit was convenient, overall it was a great place to stay and spend time.","Great hosts! Rachel was super responsive and the neighborhood was fantastic. We enjoyed our time in SLC!","Wonderful place, exactly as described. It’s a friendly, bright space looking out into a beautiful backyard.","Rachel & David place is located in a great spot for getting access  to Deer Valley, Solitude, Brighten, Alta-Snow bird ski Resorts. Travel time is little over 30 minutes to any of the resorts. The guest house is very clean, laundry area in the garage works great. The best is communications, Rachel & David respond quickly to any questions  through the Airbnb message service. Rachel & David even found us a TV which we could use our steaming device. (TV was not included in the Airbnb offer.) The internet is blazing fast. The last point, Great place try it out."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 73 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a common area."},{"name":"Taunya & Christoph is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["We really liked the apartment. We were surprised with how spacious the apartment was, and we liked how there was a full kitchen and fridge. Plus, the living area was very cozy with a nice fireplace, comfy couch, and lots of blankets. We also like how the hosts welcomed us and gave us recommendations on food/activities/ driving safety in the snow. The hot tub was also super awesome and close to the door so you don’t have to be cold for long to access it in the winter.  Our only complaint is that you could hear the water running from the bedroom anytime someone used the sink/ shower in the house.","Taunya & Christoph went out of their way to be welcoming and accommodating, offering flexibility in check in and check out times. The spacious apartment provided a warm and comfortable space to relax and a well-equipped kitchen. The included coffee was a nice touch.  It is a short walk to Olympus Hills Park, with walking/running trails, beautiful  views of the mountains and city, and playground.","Taunya and Christoph are fantastic hosts - warm and welcoming and fun to talk to. Their set up is truly unique in that they live right there and are readily available if you have any questions or just want to say hello.  It truly feels like they have opened up not just their home, but their family (and their dogs are so sweet and well behaved!). The space is nicely decorated, clean, and comfortable. Complete lower level with everything you might need… served as the perfect “base camp” for my wife and I while we were visiting the area for a long weekend :)","We had an excellent stay and trip in the area.  The home was clean and comfortable.  You can hear the occupants upstairs so if you want total privacy/silence that is something to know but it was not an issue for us.  The hosts were extremely accommodating, friendly and easy to communicate with and provided excellent recommendations.  We loved our trip to SLC!","Taunya and Christoph are amazing hosts who were extremely welcoming and accommodating. They are very knowledgeable about the area and provide fantastic recommendations for things like food, outdoor activities, and entertainment. My stay with Taunya & Christoph was one of my favorite Airbnb experiences","Restful place to stay Taunya and Christoph were very welcoming and attentive.","Taunya and Christoph had a very lovely home. It was close to the city and close to amazing food and attractions. The home was serene and the two made sure all of our needs were met! You should definitely stay here! Thanks again!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Courtney & Brian is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great location, close to everything. Walkable distance and good restaurants in the neighborhood. Having the hottub was nice as well. We used it for 2 nights.","Great place! Would stay there again!","Great place! Very clean and great location. Loved the stay!","Courtney and Brian were communicative and friendly. They also left all necessities (towels, shampoo/conditioner/body wash, cooking supplies, dishes, silverware, etc) which was helpful. I was drawn to not only the fun art on the house itself but the unique artwork inside as well. Note that this is an old home, and it is drafty, so it can get cold in the cooler months despite the heat being turned up. The bedrooms are also very small, but there is a walk-in closet in one, so we had room for most of our luggage in there. Finally, the hot tub, which was one of the main reasons we booked here, was a bit dirty, so we ended up not using it. Overall, it's a unique find in a friendly and mostly quiet neighborhood! Also, if it's your thing, there's a cat café just a couple minutes away 😊","Great location!","Loved the house! Such cute character and so close to a lot of things. We even strolled down to Pig & jelly jar and had lunch there. Cute neighborhood with friendly people around. Don’t hesitate booking.","Such a fun little house and the hot tub was a great treat. The location is top-notch for all kinds of activities in the city. We had a nice, easy drive to Provo and had plenty of fun in the city.

The homeowners were very helpful and quick to respond to communication."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Toni is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Cute place, convenient location","We can highly, highly recommend Toni’s place for your Salt Lake City stay. We come into town frequently to visit our children (who live in the Avenues close by) and this stay was the best. Incredibly clean, comfortable and very well outfitted and organized. You’ll find everything you need for a great stay in a great location. Thanks Toni!","Best place in town! If you’re looking for somewhere to stay and reading through review after review your search over. Book this place! It has everything you could need. It’s truly a home away from home. Clean, close to downtown, quiet, quaint neighborhood. It’s checks all the boxes. Don’t hesitate and risk missing the chance to stay here.","Toni’s place is fantastic! Super clean, great location, and comfy bed. She has thought of every detail and if you are looking to make meals during your stay, she has every kitchen tool/appliance you would need. The unit is quiet, bright, and relaxing and close to restaurants, shops and grocery stores. Check out the neighborhood Harmmons, it’s wonderful! I would highly recommend staying at Toni’s and hope to stay there again soon!","We had an amazing weekend and Toni’s place was the perfect location! We walked almost everywhere we went, 10-15 min walk to a variety of shops, restaurants and historic landmarks. The place was super clean and in a very quiet and safe neighborhood. The bed was extremely comfortable and she provided plenty of pillows and blankets. We didn’t use the kitchen but it appeared to be fully stocked of anything you might need. Would definitely stay again!","This house is perfect!

At the time of booking, we knew we had to separate family adventures planned. Mom needed to stay in Salt Lake City so we wanted a place that was easily walkable for her. This place was perfectly situated between dozens of awesome restaurants, shops, and friendly neighborhoods. A Whole Foods is ~1.5 miles away which was a treat for us!

Half a mile down the road was also and excellent Thai restaurant. Everything is walkable, and the house is very clean and well appointed. I will admit we spent more time in front of the TV during the evening because it was comfy and awesome to watch!

You will be pleased staying here!","This is a really great place. Fantastic location in walking distance to numerous coffee shops in the Avenues and then many downtown sights and restaurants. Place was very clean, quiet and with great amenities. Manager was great to work with. Will be the first place we look for next time we’re in SLC."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Fast wifi","value":"At 101 Mbps, you can take video calls and stream videos for your whole group."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Elizabeth is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["This place was great for my gf and I to visit SLC for a weekend trip. Elizabeth was thoughtful, responsive, and friendly. Her place is cute, cozy, and located in an amazing part of town where everything is accessible. She was super flexible and a great host. Highly recommend. The sauna was a unique and great addition, especially since we visited around Christmas time.","Elizabeth’s place was perfect for our little family of 4 (two kids 1.5 and 2.5 years old). It had everything we needed from dish washer to laundry to books, toys and pack and play!

It was also such a great location. Easily walkable to tons of restaurants and shops.

Elizabeth was super kind and helpful.

Thank you!","Great stay. Light-filled clean space, perfect host, and great location. Would stay again.","My family all agreed that this would be our first choice for our next visit to Salt Lake City.
The loft is extremely clean, in a nice walkable location to the park and some cute stores/restaurants, and has a great kitchen area and bathroom! The bathroom is spacious with nice towels, washer and dryer, and good counter space. The kitchen had everything we needed to make a meal.
The host was very responsive and hospitable as well!
If you’re looking for a place near Salt Lake, this one is a great choice!","This place was beautiful, quaint, and clean! Loved our stay here","We had a fantastic stay in Elizabeth's Loft. The unit was very well appointed with a bright and airy atmosphere. The location is close to some great restaurants and the unit was very private.","Sometimes, pretty rarely, you stay at a place where the host has truly thought of it all and you can just breathe this sigh of relief. This is that place! We loved the location, the loft itself is clean, uncluttered, feels open and spacious even though it’s not a large footprint. It was perfect for our little family! My husband LOVED the sauna and my LO loved the little nook with the toddler beds. The kitchen was well stocked and had everything I needed to make meals. The bathroom was well laid out, plenty of counter space, ample towel hooks, and anything you might need was anticipated for you. We only stayed two nights but would have been very happy longer term!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Paul is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["It was my first time using Airbnb, and Paul made it an excellent experience. Paul was very accommodating and responsive during our stay. The location is in a perfect area and close to everything. I would definitely book again if I'm in the area.","Nica and quiet close to downtown good place to relax.","Paul was such a pleasant host and responsive. I needed to extend my stay due to my mothers failing health and he made it so easy. The condo was super cozy and the covered parking was very nice. Thank you again so much. It was so nice to have a hub where I and my family could discuss the urgent matters of my mother. The walking around the community was lively; especially on 900 south heading east. So many great food spots. I’m also a no shoe policy person in my own home and was delighted to see this rule. The small things 😊. I will definitely stay here again when I visit Utah. Cheers, Paul!!","Very clean, nicely decorated condo!","Have to be honest, this was my first use of AirBnB app and stays… was in town for an event at the university and this location was just outside the crazy surrounding the event, but close enough to ride scooters to the University.
The Unit was very clean, we had plenty of room for the four men that stayed here. If we return to the area I would surely look to reserve here again. Additionally I feel that the secure parking garage is a huge plus. All access to the facility is secure and safe despite what the area looks like.
The area is not that bad, but there are some transients in the area which I must be honest that they did not bother us at all. Once inside the building it is really quiet, I am more concerned that maybe by Boys were being a little to loud. The Host and his brother were very responsive and helpful to any possible issue we had.
My only real issue was likely my own fault, technologically impaired I guess, I struggled to get in the door to the unit as it is a programmable touch lock type lock, and I struggled to learn to use it. With a little patience, time, and rapid communication from Host I was educated on the proper use of the device and the rest was peaceful history.","Paul was a great host and was very accommodating and responsive to any questions I had. The unit was very clean and depicted as shown. The location is central to great parts of the city and there is secure and safe parking in the garage.","Paul was such a gracious host! We booked this place for one of my coworkers and he definitely enjoyed his stay while working in Utah. Would definitely book again and hopefully will!"]

Location_city: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Nathaniel is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
reviews:
["My roommate and I stayed at Nathaniel's house for 3 months to complete clinical rotations at the U. The commute via driving a car was about 15-20 min, with plenty of convenience stores along the way. The neighborhood is great for walking and our neighbors were welcoming to us. Nathaniel was extremely accommodating to our needs, proactively responding and ensuring we had a comfortable stay! The house felt \"homey\"-- two bathrooms, backyard gardening, and large kitchen w/ full equipment to cook. The most convenient aspect is the house's proximity and accessibility to nature. I would recommend staying at Nathaniel's house if you like the outdoors, as it is close to several great skiing, hiking, and camping spots!","worth 5 stars 👍👍👍👍👍","Nathaniel's place is super neat and clean. She provided everything a family would need for an extended period of stay: fully-stacked and equipped kitchen, lots of extra towels, amenities and much more! We had a wonderful time staying here. Pleasant neighborhood and nice neighbors. Liberty park is within biking distance. Highly recommend to anyone who wants to stay in a quiet neighborhood at a central location in the SLC.","A cozy home in a fantastic location that has everything that you need. Loved all the little touches in the house and the beautiful gardens. This place is a steal and can't recommend it enough.","Beautiful, cozy home. My daughter stayed here with her brother and his partner for the past month after not being able to see one another through the worst of Covid times.

The home was private, comfortable, and well appointed. Host was very kind and communicative.

Reasonably easy access to Trax and in a quiet neighborhood.

Bonus - gorgeous flowers.","Great house, central location, very responsive owner!","Beautiful craftsman style home in the heart of a very comfortable and quiet neighborhood. The home is clean and comfortable with lots of lights and outlets. It is near some major streets (not too near) that provide great access to food, shopping, or other parts of the city. Freeways to get to downtown or skiing are a short drive.

Nathaniel’s “rule /information book” had a light tone and even some humor. So much better than some of the more heavy handed approaches we’ve seen. Thanks Nathaniel!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Buddhas is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We really appreciated everything about this space! My wife and I stayed here for a few nights, and it was great. The rental was clean, with plenty of amenities and lots of extra touches to make it better. Even with a busy road right outside, the house is quiet and private, with a fenced-in backyard. Plus the hot tub was clean and the WiFi was fast!

The Liberty Wells location is a perfect headquarters for visiting SLC. Everything felt like it was less than 5 minutes away. The house has a great history, and all of the reclaimed decorations are thought out very well and give a bright theme to the place.

I'll be checking availability for this rental next time I'm in town. It's perfect for a couple or a small family (with a dog!) to get away and enjoy some privacy. We can't wait to return soon!","Buddhas Bungalow was awesome!!!
Exactly as described, check in/out was easy and the place is beyond adorable! Super responsive host that saw to everything prior to our visit to make for a thoroughly enjoyable stay. The description notes that there is some noise from the major street just to the east of the bungalow, but we didn’t experience that at all. We would definitely recommend it to anyone and we know where our stays in SLC will be in the future!","A fantastic place to stay, we will be back for sure. It felt so homey and there were SO MANY helpful touches that made the stay easier. Every time I was wondering how something worked or where something was, there was a helpful label telling me exactly what I needed to know. Everything you need, thoughtfully provided for a great stay!","Came in town for business. Buddha was a nice relaxing homebase. My friend and I enjoyed playing the guitar and hanging out in the common area. I made use of the jacuzzi. The spot was very nice and quiet. Only thing is there is no washer or dryer for clothes but there is a laundromat right down the road.","Buddhas was awesome!!!!!!!! They were incredibly helpful to us throughout the stay and the property was absolutely gorgeous. I’ll definitely stay with them again.","We had a great time here! It’s so nice and spacious that I wish we would’ve brought the kids, but it was a fantastic, clean space to relax, unwind, and enjoy SLC for the weekend. Highly recommend.","Awesome patio area and the host was super quick to respond to any questions. Kids and dog were happy there!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 348 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a private room."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Cathie is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["I could not recommend this place enough Cathie and Harry were such amazing hosts- constantly checking in to see if I needed anything, the place had everything you could ask for 10/10 experience","I can’t imagine a better stay in SLC than Lofty Dreams. Easily walkable to anywhere you’d want to go Downtown and in a wonderfully safe and relaxing community.

Harry and Cathie were communicative, kind, and engaging during the month-long stay. It feels like a fully stocked home upon arrival.

I would agree that the second “room” would be hard if you stayed for over a week. It worked wonderfully as a closet for me.

Such a joyful and relaxing stay in SLC. RUN to this Airbnb if you get the chance!","This was a perfect place for our month in SLC - I can’t imagine looking elsewhere our next time in the city. Hosts were so thoughtful and kind, just a wonderful stay!","We had a fabulous stay at Cathie and Harry’s loft! The location is perfect for many outings - walking, biking or by car. The hosts were super at communicating with us and checking in to see if all was good.

Some things that were mentioned in other reviews:

The staircase in the loft is a little steep but this just requires you to always use the handrail - That was good for us. Tall folks might have a little difficulty in the top level but you quickly get use to that.

If you are staying in the summer. A small tilted floor fan at the floor vent by the entry door will cool the upstairs perfectly - it was the perfect solution. Tilt the fan in the direction to blow the cool air from the floor vent to the upstairs. Also, we removed the thick comforter from the bed upstairs. We bring our own sheets and light blanket for summer stays.

We did not find the homeless issue to be a problem. SLC does a great job in managing the homeless and many of the homeless folks we encountered were calm and polite.

The neighbors in the complex were very kind and helpful. Typical for Utah!

Final note- The Rose establishment restaurant located adjacent to the lofts is fabulous. Mostly “farm to table” simple snacks, meals and coffee!","This Airbnb is very cool and whimsical. The pictures are exactly what you’re going to get! Easy check in, responsive host, and all the amenities you might need for a quick or long stay.

Things to note:
-the unit doesn’t get the best sunlight. The front door faces an interior courtyard. It’s an old mill building so just keep that in mind!
- stair case to loft is steep. So be careful! Second floor has short ceiling. I’m over 6’ so it was a bit of an issue.
- I wouldn’t recommend this unit for more than 2 people.

Overall, great stay!","We stayed here for the month of April and loved the apartment. Hosts were extremely responsive and very helpful. The apt had everything we needed. Perfect for working remotely with the big desk and computer monitor. Would love to stay again sometime!","An absolute dream! Everything was as described and Cathie was super responsive the whole time when I had questions about appliances, location and driving conditions!

You can tell this place is well cared for and I loved the well-stocked kitchen so that we could cook during our multi-week stay.

There are various nooks where a working couple can easily find their spot to work from home which is such a plus! Highly recommend this place and I would 100% book again.

We had a car, but even without one the location is very walkable with lots of entertainment and dining out options. We ate at the Rose cafe 5x I believe - definitely give them a try if you stay! Thanks again Cathie!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Jeff is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"90% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["The place was wonderful. We enjoyed the kitchen as we prepared our Thanksgiving dinner. The smart TV was great to use and the bed was very comfortable. Great location!! Hope to stay there again soon!","The place was conveniently located and perfectly suited our needs.

The only thing is that the hill was steeper than I expected to get downtown, so walking wasn’t as good of an option as I expected, but that mistake was on me, not une host.","This place was super comfortable and made a great central meeting spot for a business trip. Very clean, spacious and comfortable. Great view!!! .5 mile walk to a nice little coffee shop. Uphill walk back!! Great location to everything else. Very quiet street and house. Once upstair guest showed up a little nosier but nothing more than someone walking around. We will be back for sure!!!","I stayed there a week with my girlfriend and everything was perfect. The home is amazing and charming, well cleaned and in order. From the living room you can enjoy the beautiful sunsets on Salt Lake. The kitchen was well stocked with all you need to cook, from an easy breakfast to a special dinner. The coach and the bed are very comfy. The home is close to all you could need, from walmart to shops, city parks and the capitol building, but far enough to the traffic and noises to enjoy some relax time, the neighborhood is really quiet. The hosts are nice and thoughtful and they want to be sure that you feel like at your own home! They sent detailed informations about check-in and check-out, plus some other about the house. If we'll be again in Salt Lake, for sure we'd like to stay there to spend another great quality time. Really suggested!","Clean, spacious stay in a convenient location. The beds were very comfortable and having two bathrooms was really nice for our little group. Street parking was easy. As other reviewers noted, this rental is below an upstairs unit and you will hear plenty of foot traffic from above.","Great location. Quiet comfortable, very charming, We felt it was a very fair price for a fun, relaxing peaceful atmosphere. We would get it again. We would consider it a hidden gem. Thank you Jeff for sharing your lovely home.","Beautiful space with very comfortable beds and full kitchen."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 226 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a common area."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"McKay is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["If you enjoy tasteful interior design that is cozy and conveniently-located, this is your place. I chose McKay’s space for the good vibes and it did not disappoint. The kitchen was enjoyable to prep/cook in and I was able to enjoy the piano. Pictures are accurate! Quiet neighborhood with convenience to restaurants or activities. McKay topped it off with amazing communication and the ultimate host friendliness. I’d stay again!","Such a beautiful home!! The attention to detail and the styling was immaculate. McKay was friendly and so helpful with local recommendations and even helped clear some of the snow! I definitely recommend it and will stay here again.","Wow! What an amazing space. Loved it and will be my go to place to stay while at SLC! The host way responsive and helpful. All together an A+ experience.","McKay's house is beautiful; it looks exactly like the photos and is in a great neighborhood. My husband and I spent the week enjoying scenic walks to nearby restaurants and shops, despite the snow and cold weather! We stayed nice and cozy during our trip, and the driveway was even shoveled for us when it snowed. I was also pleasantly surprised to find the piano was (mostly) in tune, as I had music to rehearse while I was there.

The only hiccup was the very low levels of hand soap, dishwasher detergent, laundry detergent and toilet paper. Some of these we discovered the first night before a planned Target run, but others weren't discovered until the end of trip, and McKay did offer to come by with refills. The main bedroom has a comfy mattress that was neither too firm or too soft and a very warm comforter. (We didn't use the second bed.) The kitchen is fantastic and pretty well stocked, and you don't have to use your own login for the streaming services, which was a bonus.","We felt at home at McKay's place. It is very well designed to be beautiful, simple and sensible. We felt like we belonged there because everything we needed we were able to find and it was always in the right place. The location is very close to everything and very walkable (including Liberty park.) The beds were comfortable and the neighborhood quiet and safe. The house was really clean and the temperature was perfect and easy to regulate when we wanted to change it. I would list all the extras that we kept discovering to our delight but you can read a couple of reviews just to realize that there is a little for everyone in there. We hope to come back. Thank you McKay for being a good attentive host and for taking pride and such good care of your lovely home.","The most cozy cute bungalow! We absolutely loved staying here. Cozy beds, very clean, and charming interior design. This place is super close to anything downtown. McKay was an incredible host!","Well appoints with thoughtful amenities. We were able to enjoy morning and afternoon tea, quiet relaxing time, plus the location allowed for us to explore all of SLC easily. The Liberty park is an excellent evening walk. The home is designed well with quality finishes."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Lake City Flats is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["This was my second visit to this same flat. Very comfortable and well maintained. A clean, cozy, nicely styled apartment with a very comfortable bed!","Great location in The Avenues, well appointed all around!","The stay here was a great experience. Good location, close to downtown. Host responds promptly!","Great stay!","This is a wonderful property. It was spotless, had everything we need to cook or reheat leftovers, everything works, convenient to all the things we like to do, comfortable bed and furniture, very quiet building, nicely furnished, big TVs--including in the bedroom (husband happy), plenty of on-street parking, good communication.

And, it has a Nespresso coffee machine (why don't more places care enough about good coffee for guests?), and 2 fabulous coffee places within a block. It is also 1 block from my favorite cookie store 😋

We can't say enough about the accommodations, and hope to come back next year.

If you are staying longer than a few days, there really isn't too much space for your stuff. The bedroom doesn't have a dresser, just a bench. There is a small closet with shelves, but it was filled with extra linens and towels.

There are two flights of VERY steep stairs, so if you are older, disabled, or struggle with the elevation, you should know that.

Beautiful remodel. We loved staying here. Thank you for everything.","We had a very nice stay. Great location and neighborhood. I don’t recommend that f you have issues with stairs","The apartment is in the best neighborhood in SLC & everything within distance, including some great hiking trails & restaurants! Plus all the nicest finishes throughout!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Highly rated Host","value":"Alex has received 5-star ratings from 90% of recent guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Very cozy and close to everything!","Amazingly awesome 1st Airbnb experience!!! The pictures did not do the apartment justice. For how old the main house was we were skeptical on the functions of old house. But once we entered and checked everything out, we were amazed how modern and clean the apartment was. Location was amazing too…right across street from Liberty park where our daughter was playing High School state championship!! We walked there both days!!! Definitely will be staying again next yr.","I am a travel nurse with my family in tow and stayed in the apartment for the long duration of my hospital contract. We have everything we needed and was comfortable. Hosts are very responsive  to ensure all our needs and expectations are met. Highly recommended!😊","Excellent location to be able to walk to restaurants and location right next to the park was perfect for us traveling with two dogs. Also thank god for the air conditioning!","I had a very nice stay in this basement apartment unit located in a beautiful historic house. I was worried about not having control over the AC temperature but it was never an issue and the unit was nice and cool. I loved my morning walks at Liberty Park located right across the street and minutes away are fantastic cafes and a grocery store. Even though it is on a busy street, it was very quiet inside the unit. I could hear people walking around upstairs, but it wasn’t a problem at all. The wifi is super fast and the smart TV worked great. The apartment was very clean and comfortable and I really liked having a parking spot right outside my door. I had a small issue with the door locks, but Erika was very quick to fix the problem. I throughly enjoyed my stay here and look forward to returning again.","Perfect location in Salt Lake. Great value and amenities. Would stay here again.","A nice comfortable unit. The shower was really great!"]

reviews: ["Jennifer's Airbnb is a beautiful place to stay, with warm wood furniture and accents, and consistently thoughtful rustic charm throughout. It snowed a few times during my stay, and Jennifer even went above and beyond to shovel the sidewalks, and even shoveled the path from the back yard for my dog.  I give it my highest recommendation and it will be at the top of my list for future visits.","Jennifer is a fantastic host and was so friendly and responsive. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Morgan is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["The house was mostly ok, but I wish any of the other reviews mentioned the neighbor’s untrained German Shepard.
It barked constantly during my month long stay. Night and day.
The fence line is >10 feet away so there is no escaping it anywhere in the house.
Morgan was responsive and contacted the neighbor and animal control, but there was no real change.","Clean, cozy, and convenient!
Everything was as advertised and Morgan responded quickly to all questions. Will definitely stay at Morgan's again!","We enjoyed our single-nights stay. The house is on a dead-end, low-traffic street in a safe-feeling neighborhood. Parking is on the street or in the driveway. Access is by an app whose instructions you receive by text. The downstairs is surprising large, with a large 3/4 bathroom, laundry, exercise bike in relatively large den. The kitchen is well-stocked. The beds were comfortable, and we slept well. The upstairs bathroom has a 5’ jacuzzi tub and shower, bidet on the toilet. Communication was good. We would stay there again.","I booked this location for my mom and grandparents who were visiting from out of town for a few days. My grandparents had never stayed in an Airbnb before and had a great first experience at Morgan’s place. The house was clean and cozy and the neighborhood was quiet and felt very safe. Location is close to Sugarhouse Park and I-80 which makes it easy to get around town. Great little spot!","Morgan’s place is in an excellent location and she is super communicative.","This is a nice house in a lovely residential neighborhood. My boyfriend and I stayed here for a few days while exploring SLC. It was just a comfy, well decorated place to relax in the evenings. Morgan was really responsive when I reached out looking for a local food recommendation. I strongly recommend checking out Navajo Hogans for lunch while you’re in town! The TV is connected with Apple TV, which can be confusing for those not in the apple-sphere, (I am but know not everyone is) but can easily be figured out with a quick google search. There is a plethora of streaming apps available! I’m not usually a fan of memory foam mattresses, but the one here was really comfortable! I’ll be back in SLC next year and hope to be able to stay here again!","A nice place on a quiet dead end street in a nice neighborhood. For me a big plus was a big park within walking distance to unwind after travel.
Everything was functional, no problems. We had everything we needed to cook our meals. The back deck was really peaceful."]

highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Steven is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Stop searching. Stay here. Steven and Michael are impeccable hosts who made my wife and me feel right at home. From the heated tile and abundant towels and toiletries in the bathroom to the cookies, snacks and well-stocked fridge and kitchen, the hosts thought of quite literally everything to make our week-long Christmas stay beyond comfortable. This guesthouse is the perfect mountain retreat, surrounded by beautiful mountain vistas and unbeatably close to Alta, Snowbird, Brighton, Solitude, and downtown SLC. We had the option of staying with family or staying here. Choosing here was one of the best decisions I made in 2022. The experience was exquisite from start to finish. We’ll definitely be back.","Wonderful, flexible and accommodating hosts. Every amenity you can think of. Beautiful mountainside location with an amazing view overlooking the city. Heated bathroom flooring and exactly what we were looking for during our cozy stay. 10/10 would book again.","Steven and Michael were amazing hosts. From the start their hospitality was unmatched and the apartment was spotless! Would recommend to anyone who wants to see the city or ski (or both!).","Steven's place was wonderful for a 2 week stay while a new employee was out here for work. Cozy and felt right at home they said. Definitely a place to come back and would book again for any of our employees looking to stay out here longer than a couple of days. Very responsive host and communication was amazing even while they were traveling and on their own vacation!","Wow, what an amazing value with an excellent balance of function and luxury! An amazing living space, with fresh espresso and wonderful views to start your day, and also a great place to wind down from skiing with a luxurious bathroom (heated floor!) , bedroom and living room. Would absolutely stay here every time we come back to SLC!","It was nicer than a hotel with beautiful views! It was immaculate, private and quiet. It felt like a spa retreat! Steven was super friendly and I highly recommend staying here. The place is very high-end with beautiful design elements. Every detail is well-thought-out. I wish I could’ve stayed longer!","We loved our time here over the last week. It is ideal for a couple. You can show up with a bag and be \"at home\" in minutes. The amenities of the house make it great for escapes too. You don't need to leave to enjoy yourself."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Espace de travail dédié","value":"Une chambre privée avec wifi, bien aménagée pour travailler."},{"name":"Arrivée autonome","value":"Vous pouvez entrer dans les lieux avec une serrure connectée."},{"name":"Mark est Superhôte","value":"Les Superhôtes sont des hôtes expérimentés qui bénéficient de très bonnes évaluations et qui s'engagent à offrir d'excellents séjours aux voyageurs."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, États-Unis
reviews: ["We enjoyed our month long stay here. Mark is a gracious, communicative host. The house is located in a quiet, residential neighborhood with easy street parking. The unit is the lower level of a house and feels completely private, we never heard or saw anyone upstairs. Our favorite feature was the huge deck with a table and loungers to sit outside and enjoy the spectacular view of the city and beautiful sunsets every night. We worked from home and the internet speed was adequate for telework and zoom calls.  Bedrooms are big and the beds were comfortable. Great location for exploring the area, convenient to both the city and the mountains. There are two great trailheads right up the street!","Nice place, has everthing you need. Outside area is very nice with a view over the city. Would definitely recommend.","You will not believe how cool this place is! The view is amazing, the beds are super comfy and the style of this suite is clean and attractive. The owners are incredibly kind and helped make my stay one of the best I have ever had.","Mark and Jess were excellent hosts and I am so happy to have stayed in this wonderful home. They were very responsive to our inquiries, and take the time to check on you every so often to make sure you have everything you need and are enjoying the space. If you've never stayed on a hillside before, the view itself is a vacation alone! The furniture and beds we're also incredibly comfortable and we had a good nights sleep every night we were there! Check in and check out were a breeze. Next time we are in Salt Lake City, we'll definitely be checking to see if this place is available!","We can’t recommend staying at Mark’s place enough if you are visiting SLC! The views are unbeatable, it is walking distance to hiking trails and a great location to do things both in the city and the mountains. The house is beautiful, clean and the deck is amazing. Mark is extremely hospitable and available if anything is needed during your stay!","Fantastic place with one of the best views in St lake city","Absolutely stunning home, the viewes are incredible and the hosts very kind."]
