Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Kj is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great place and large space! Thanks so much and all the best to you!","My partner and I and our dog are full time nomads traveling around the US while working traditional corporate jobs.
We picked Kj’s place because we wanted a quiet sanctuary where we can do our work and spread out between 3 bedrooms but also host guests when they come visit. One thing to note that if you book a place for 2 people, you will be charged $25/night per person who visits.

The location can’t be beat! We loved watching the sunset over the mountains while sitting in the hot tub after work.
There is also a deck where you can do yoga or read. The edible garden was amazing! As fellow vegans we appreciated having access to fresh veggies. You are also right next to big cottonwood canyon for hiking, rock climbing, mountain biking and skiing depending on the season (less then 10 mins drive)

Kj also went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable while working. When the internet speeds were too low for my work, she scheduled an appointment with the internet company to upgrade to the fastest speeds in her area. Internet without VPN was about 50/60 download and 20 upload during our stay.

She also brought our 2 ergonomic chairs for us since we were working so late every day and she wanted to make sure we are comfortable.

Overall great place if you are looking for a quiet place to work, relax and explore the area.","KJ is an awesome host. Her property is beautiful. The place was super clean and had everything you need! KJ even welcomes you to her gorgeous garden. She often brought me Kale and squash right from the property! Beautiful view. Super cool spot!","Perfect, so close the mountains, makes for a very nice summer getaway as you can drive up the canyons and escape the summer heat in 20 mins.","I just spent a delightful month in a lovely home on the side of a mountain in Holladay, Utah. The views from the apartment, back and front yards and deck were breathtaking—-day and night. It is situated in a beautiful, safe, friendly neighborhood. The birds were always singing and spring flowers were in bloom.

The apartment was immaculate, fully furnished, very comfortable and inviting.
The rooms are quite spacious with large windows providing sunlight and incredible mountain views.
The kitchen is updated with granite countertops, a nice bar area and a huge pantry. It is well equipped.
The bedrooms are large and inviting and reflect places around the world where the couple has lived. Beds and linens were very luxurious.

My hostess and host are the dearest couple—-available if needed but not pushy.

The location is perfect for sightseeing, shopping, dining, airport pick up or drop off, hiking and biking.
Big and Little Cottonwood canyons are close by whereas Bryce Canyon, Canyonlands and The Arches are a few hours drive. It is an easy drive to downtown SLC, Antelope Island and the Great Salt Lake. Park City is about 30 minutes away.

This is my recommendation if you want to experience a little piece of Heaven on earth.

I have absolutely no negative comments. I give it a 5+ rating.","I had always wanted to ski 30 days straight and when you are 71 years old, you can't put it off any longer. I was lucky enough to find this charming 3-bedroom apartment near Big Cottonwood Canyon. It was perfect in every way. It is located a half-mile to the 6200-South park and ride (where the ski bus stops), a short 20-minute ride to four terrific ski areas and is near dozens of restaurants.

The apartment was exactly as presented. There are three roomy bedrooms with big closets (for your ski gear) and one with amazing views of the Salt Lake Valley. My granddaughters will not soon forget the twinkling lights of the city. The kitchen is well-equipped and the living room is comfortable. A nice hot tub helps soothe the tired muscles after a day on the slopes.

The hosts are terrific and the unit is both perfect and a great value. I give this place five stars and two thumbs up! I shall return.","KJ's place is fantastic. It is extremely well located for anybody hoping to stay close to the mountains. You will feel right at home in the spacious apartment that has a very comfortable open layout. Even if you have many guests, you will not find yourself pressed for space. The beds are comfortable, and having three separate bedrooms really made having several guests totally manageable and comfortable - not your typical ski house situation with people on couches and air mattresses! The views from the apartment are to die for! Having coffee with the breathtaking views at KJ's will be something that I will miss dearly.

The location is extremely close to skiing. I was working from home throughout my stay and was able to get away from the Airbnb to both Alta and Brighton in less than 20 minutes! It is truly a skiers paradise.

The space is very well isolated from the owners upstairs and I felt like I had my own private space when staying at KJ's. KJ is extremely responsive and ready to provide information and insights on the neighborhood and what to do in the surrounding areas."]

reviews: ["This place is great. Lovely location, neat old time house with a warm cozy gas fireplace. Lovely yard with comfy outdoor seating. Nice mudroom with washer dryer. We just love it here.","Absolutely loved staying at Jennifer's place! It was impeccably clean and the kitchen was well appointed. Check in/out was seamless. Location was fantastic. Looking forward on staying there again on my next trip to Salt Lake City.","Comfortable and cozy place where we'd happily stay again. It was especially nice to have so many different rooms/areas in a one-bedroom (big mudroom, dining, two living room spaces, etc.), and the location was perfect for our needs, visiting friends in the area.","This place was awesome and the host was super helpful. Location was convenient, shower was amazing, and everything was very clean. No complaints whatsoever-- if you're thinking about staying here, do it!","I cannot recommend staying here enough! The house is absolutely charming with beautiful modern updates. It’s warm and welcoming. The neighborhood is quiet and safe, great for walking around. The backyard was great for us to sit and have coffee, and big enough for our pups to run around. Jennifer was a great and helpful host! We will 100% stay again next time we’re in Salt Lake City.","This is our second stay at this lovely home.  We were on a road trip and needed a place to stay on the way back.  I messaged Jennifer and she immediately responded and invited me to book.  So easy!  She left the lights on for us and everything was so welcoming.  The neighborhood is really cute and a fun one to walk through.  You can see the Capitol from the street!   A beautiful and well stocked kitchen to cook a meal in, comfortable and beautiful sofas to relax on, and then a quiet bed to sleep on.  We will be back this winter!  Hoping for some snow!  If you need a place to stay in Salt Lake City, this home is a great find.","What a great find!!  We stayed here on our way through Salt Lake City and wish that we had more time here.  The home is beautifully appointed, and so welcoming.  Jennifer left the lights on for us (we arrived late) and was quick to respond with any questions.  There is a driveway to park in, which is a bonus.  The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bed linens wonderful.  Kitchen great with everything you could need and there is a cute little outside area to relax in.  Even better - we were able to bring our pup with us!  We definitely will be back!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Cristina is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Such wonderful for everything!!","Great location, comfy house with a lovely back area to enjoy the beautiful weather.","My husband and I were visiting our son in SLC & Cris's place was perfect for the 2 of us. Clean, comfortable & efficient space on a lovely quiet residential street in a great central location. Larger inside than expected with an eat-in kitchen, nicely appointed rooms. Cris was extremely responsive , gave great recommendations for things to do/restaurants & cafe's. We will definitely rent again when in the area.","Nice place! Nice host!

When looking at the photos you can have impression that it is a basement apartment. It is not, it just has low windows high above the floor. I almost have not chosen it because of it. Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Ali’s place offers good value. It’s clean, safe and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. It was stocked with everything we needed.","A great place to stay! Ali is a very gracious and responsive host. Very quiet and private space —the perfect home away from home.","Ali was an incredible host. I had to extend my stay a few times and she got back to me right away and was so easy going about the changes I had to make. Her cottage is the best of two worlds - a quiet place to come home to and enjoy the lovely porch and outdoor fire and the equally inviting indoor where you will find all you need to cook or relax by the fire. The other world is a few steps away literally and you are in the heart of Sugarhouse. The beds are comfy and the home is orderly so everything you need is easy to find and clean! We will be back . Thanks Ali!!","Great, quiet spot in a great neighbourhood. Ali is an excellent host, and communicator. The space is clean, very nicely decorated, and offers all the essentials for a long term stay. We enjoyed the fireplace on chilly nights, and the outdoor deck on sunny, warm days. Would absolutely stay here again, and I highly recommend Ali's place to others looking to stay in SLC. Thanks again Ali!","My fiancé and I stayed here from early March to early April 2021. We were both working from home (connecting to our company’s networks) and never had a problem with the internet. There was plenty of space for us to both work comfortably! I worked at the desk in the smaller bedroom and my fiancé worked at the large counter/table in the kitchen.

The bed in the largest bedroom is SO comfortable! There were plenty of plates/bowls and utensils in the kitchen and the refrigerator is very spacious. The dishwasher is SO quiet!

The most important thing to understand about Ali’s place: you CANNOT beat the location! When you combine the location with the size of the house and the price, it’s a fantastic value.

You are centrally located between several hiking spots, with the University of Utah trails and Mill Creek Canyon around 15 mins away each (drive).

The area is very walkable! Within walking distance there are: three grocery options , several bars/breweries, coffee shops, and many restaurants. Definitely don’t miss visiting Sugar House coffee and Penguin Brothers (both right next door), they were staples for us when visiting!

Additionally, Liberty Park is about a 1 mile walk or a very quick drive! Sugar house park is even a bit closer.

Ali was very friendly and incredibly responsive when questions came up during our visit.

If I had to pick one drawback to Ali’s place it would be that, on weekend nights, you can faintly hear the bass from a club that is located a couple blocks away. Definitely don’t let that stop you from staying here, just something to be aware of if you’re a very light sleeper. It wasn’t a problem for us and, in fact, given the opportunity we plan on staying here again!

Overall, we’ve stayed in a lot of hotels/Airbnb’s and this is a gem!","Ali’s place was a perfect home for a getaway in salt lake. We worked remotely here for 2 weeks and skied on the weekends. It’s a perfect location to be able to both experience the city and drive to the mountains. Tons of restaurants and local breweries in walking distance in sugar house . The house was cute with all appliances and cooking materials needed. Loved the linens provided, and stylish design! Beds are a little soft, but everything else was amazing! Ali was so flexible and responsive- she even tried to help us find an additional place to stay when we wanted to extend our trip. Would definitely recommend and come back!","Ali's spot was the perfect getaway, located nearby mountain access, and in a fun neighborhood in Salt Lake. The house is nice and private, located off the street and surrounded by a large fence, so it stays quiet and has an almost hidden \"oasis\" sort of feel to it, without being remote. A handful of great shops, grocery stores, and restaurants/breweries are located within a 5-10 minute walk.

The location was perfect for quick trips into the mountains, with a handful of great ski resorts only a 20-30 minute drive from door to parking lot, and the base of the mountains and some trailheads maybe 10-15 minutes away.

The house itself was a clean and cozy, the bed in the master bedroom was incredibly comfortable, and the patio outside was perfect for evening hangs.

Ali was very responsive, friendly and accommodating, and was very respectful of privacy while still making sure she was available to be reached in case she was needed.

All-in, the spot was great, and I would definitely stay here again."]

location: South Salt Lake, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Nice hous, very clean room, nice location!","I believe this place is illegal, and definitely unsafe.

The host keeps the front door keys in the mailbox. Not only is this incredibly risky, but guests can take the keys and never return them. This leads to other guests being locked out. Within 3 days I was locked out twice, the second time the host literally told me to break a window to get in. Extremely sketchy. I left ASAP.

Bedroom doors also don't have locks on them. Anyone can enter while you're gone.

Don't stay here. Not worth the slight savings in cost. It's annoying to be locked out, but far worse to be robbed. In that Salt Lake City neighborhood it could definitely happen.","Bathroom lock didn't work. didn't feel I had privacy if I used toilet. didn't take shower because of no lock. Room wasn't ready at check in time. Rooms weren't clearly marked. they were marked as \"white curtains\", \"green curtains\". there were paper notes everywhere not to use many things. Note from manager after I booked room said \"for the love of God do not touch air conditioner control!\" and do not speak to neighbors even though they might seem friendly but they will report her! Had to park on a side street or manager said my car would be towed if I parked in front of airbnb.BE AWARE if using this Airbnb!!!!!","It was a great place I enjoyed myself very cheap and very easy and I recommend it to anybody","It’s a room. Other people will be staying there. Host was very easy going."]

Also, the host, Leslie, was a ton of help, offering up great spots to find dinner and drinks. I'd definitely stay again next time I visit Salt Lake!","Leslie is a wonderful host. She frequently got in touch making sure all our needs were being met…before and during our stay. The home was spotless and well maintained. All our needs were met 100%. The patio area was so relaxing and quiet. Perfect place to relax after a day of touring SLC. It is located a short distance to public transportation. Leslie was in frequent contact making sure our needs were being met. Even before we arrived, she sent messages making sure any questions were answered. She was very quick to respond. I would strongly recommend this property to anyone visiting SLC. A definite 5 star!!","Leslie's house was the perfect place for us to stay while we moved our son into college in town. It was so homey and comfortable. The neighborhood is adorable and very quiet which was unexpected being in the city. I slept very well (the blackout curtains helped a lot!) It's a 3-minute walk to the tram and a quick ride to downtown. Easy to hop on the highway as well. I really felt at home there! The kitchen is very well equipped and we were able to cook some of our meals when we wanted to. Some amazing restaurants are within walking distance. Leslie was very quick to respond to my messages at all times. We will stay here again when we come to visit for sure!","What a great condo! Pretty close to downtown but far enough away to be in a quiet little neighborhood. Very clean, remarkable kitchen, with lots of extras! It was around $10 uber ride to Convention center. Will definitely stay again! Great owners!","Absolutely recommend this house!!! It is in a fantastic location—lots of restaurants, breweries, and coffee is just a quick walk away. The house is very clean and well equipped. Wifi / internet was lightning fast and perfect for work from home. Parking was very abundant around the house. Hosts were very communicative and made check-in / check-out a breeze. I’d 100% stay here again!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Maven is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Definitely worth checking out. Good location that was always 5-10 mins from where we needed to go. The only thing I would warn you about if is you are going with a group of 4 (like we did); you might want to try somewhere else unless you really plan on spending little to no time in the Airbnb. The living room really only fits 2 people comfortably, and the dining table was tinyyyy. That said, the place was super clean, the beds are incredibly comfortable, and there were enough spices to cook a real meal without having to buy them at the store. I would definitely recommend.","The place was great! Clean, cute, had everything we needed. It’s an apartment building so you can definitely hear people living above you, but overall, our experience was great. The neighborhood is so cute! Lots of stuff in walking distance. We’d definitely stay again.","We enjoyed our stay! The space was Cozy. The washing machine was faulty and the hosts were quick to give solutions to help. The dishwasher was also malfunctioning and they offered a maintenance service asap. We left so we are unsure of the resolution. There were plenty of towels and extra toilet paper. There were leftover spices which were helpful. The bedroom with the double opening doors retains heat more than the rest of the home so we had to lower the heat on snowy nights and keep the doors open. Overall it was a nice stay and the Hosts were very accommodating!","Loved staying here. The house was in perfect location for everything we needed. Everything was clean and the beds were so cozy! Can’t wait to return and stay here!","The apartment was very cute and calming. I even loved the friendly neighbors. Parking was no issue.","THE BEST NIGHTS SLEEP EVER

BEDS — the supportive mattresses, plush pillows and soft sheets were of the highest quality.

KITCHEN — Staple items were handy; honey, chopsticks, low cal sweeteners for coffee and tea. The kitchen sink is massive and having a dishwasher made cleaning easy.

BATHROOM — little cosy and doesn’t have huge storage but totally not a dealbreaker for us — just mentioning for others.
The place felt incredibly homey and warm. The heating worked wonderfully well.

LOCATION — Easy to find and on a quiet street only 15 mins from their airport. Not the greatest spot for sight seeing — we ended up driving to the Salt Flats (1.5 hours away) and there tends to be better hot springs and hikes a while away from the city centre.
Fear Factory was close and running (went during Halloween time) and would highly recommend for some fun!

OVERALL — loved our stay. Having HBO Max, Netflix and more was great for nights in. The Harmons grocery store was a sight to see! Everything you need and more.
Space in the living room for yoga and exercise was great.
Highly recommend staying here.","Comfortable, nice location"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Absolute five-star hospitality during our stay in Utah! We couldn't believe Alexia was a first-time host - the basement apartment was exactly as advertised, with super thoughtful amenities including laundry detergent, dishwasher detergent, shower supplies, first aid kit, a bottle of wine, a bag of delicious coffee + coffee maker, snacks, Vitamix, high-quality cookware, Roku TV, excellent heating, and a comprehensive binder full of helpful instructions and recommendations on where to go and what to eat. The neighborhood is quiet, safe, close to grocery stores and restaurants, and a 10-15 minute drive to a number of bus stops that take skiers up to Snowbird / Alta / Brighton. Moreover, Alexia was so kind to go above and beyond in scraping our car after heavy snows, which we didn't ask for but was incredibly appreciated. She was highly communicative and accommodated our request for a later check-out time. Can't recommend this host and apartment enough!!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Poseban prostor za rad","value":"Privatna soba s bežičnim internetom koja je prikladna za rad."},{"name":"Samostalni dolazak","value":"Samostalan ulazak u smještaj uz pomoć digitalne brave."},{"name":"Margot je Superhost","value":"Superhostovi su iskusni domaćini s izvrsnim ocjenama koji se iznimno trude gostima osigurati savršen boravak."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Sjedinjene Američke Države
reviews:
["Margot was fabulous to communicate with, quick to respond. I booked the house the day of arrival and it was a smooth process. I was able to get in early (with a fee) which really helped with the plans that we had. The house is gorgeous, clean and comfortable. It felt like home. It had all of the amenities that we needed. I’m sure I will be back, thank you!!","Enjoyed our stay. Everything was exactly as described. Margot was very responsive and even allowed for a later checkout. I would definitely book this wonderful home again when and if I return to SLC.","Great location. We loved the open design and large kitchen. The decor was spot on. There is a basement unit that has guests/tenants, so consider that if you book this place.","Beautiful, quiet home!","Perfect location for us visiting family. Nice open and comfortable space. Great drive thru coffee joint just up the street.","The place was beautiful, but, after traveling for 12.5 hrs in a car they told me it was my responsibility to bring my own washcloth. They said a wash cloth is a personal item. I felt that was not right it wasn’t in the description that you need to bring your own wash cloth. Also, the host felt instead of fixing a problem on the day it was reported, (This is after letting me check in early) they wanted to wait until the next day. It was great I was able to check in early but if you missed something that you didn’t do then there should have been enough time to come in and fix it since it was still 2 hrs before regular check in time, and I called right away. (The ceiling fans were caked with dust and I like using them but couldn’t because they wouldn’t fix the problem on the first day and I refuse to let them interrupted my 3 day stay on the 2nd day.
The hosts made sure they answered the questions and I explained to them/him that I didn’t want to be bothered the next day but still at 3 (when check in was actually 5) they kept telling me it will have to wait until the next day. I was not happy with that service even though everything else was good.
If you have dust/dust mite allergies and you let the host know but they want to wait until the next day to fix the problem, then they are all about the money and not the customer. I explained all of this to them but their answer was wait until the next day. I feel I should get my cleaning deposit back and I tried to talk with someone from Air BNB but they just referred me back to the host.","Beautiful place and beautiful stay! The place is better looking than the pictures and the location is central and close to Salt Lake City attractions. Hosts are wonderful and easy to communicate with, and easy self check-in. Would stay again, thank you!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Michele is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"90% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Our stay was great! Wonderful location and had everything we needed for a nice weekend in SLC. Our dogs traveled with us (blue heeler & chi) and it was the perfect size for all four of us to be comfortable for the weekend. Heated floors in the bathroom were a nice touch. Only complaint was that the hot water heater doesn’t last long. You’ll have less than 5 minutes to take a shower before it gets cold. Oh and our dogs loved the small private yard you have access to. Would stay here again in the future!","This place is awesome! It’s super close to campus and it’s like staying at a mini house. Very convenient check in/check out and I’m hoping to stay again next trip. (If it’s not booked out)","Cute, private place! Super cozy too! Would definitely recommend.","My husband and I had an okay stay here. The location was very convenient and it was nice to have a little yard for our dog that was traveling with us. The kitchen was stocked with what we needed to enjoy making meals in the unit and the Murphy bed was also very comfortable! The shower has amazing water pressure; however, the hot water did not last long (maybe 5 minutes) making it so only one of us got to shower comfortably. The internet went out halfway through our stay, and we didn’t hear anything back from the host when I wrote them about it. Luckily we didn’t necessarily need it for anything. Overall, we were grateful to have a place to stretch out a bit as we were traveling in our van, but given the hiccups we ran into and the lack of communication; we didn’t feel it was a fair exchange for what we paid.","This is a fantastic spot! Wonderful cozy vibe. The apartment is clean and quite beautiful, and the private yard area is a huge plus. I'd absolutely come back.","The guest house was clean, cute, and functional. It was great having access to a small yard for our dogs. Check in/check out was easy and communication was efficient. We had a little trouble figuring out the heater at first, but other than that no complaints!","It's convenient for the University of Utah, has all the essentials, and is attractive."]

I would stay here again for sure."]

reviews: ["Amazing location, beautiful home with special attention to details. Breakfast was incredible!","Great place to stay!","Thanks for a great stay! Location is great if you want to explore SLC. The best part by far is the breakfast, which is different every day and made to your liking. Victoriya, the innkeeper, was so welcoming and cheerful. We'll be back next year!","This place is as charming as it gets. Fantastic  feeling throughout the house, great breakfast, and great service. reviews: ["The place is beautiful and had an amazing view. We stayed upstairs and the thermostat is located in the lower part of the house which gets alot cooler quicker than upstairs and that led to some uncomfortably hot days, of course we were there during one of the areas only heat waves so I doubt it's usually a problem. Matt is correcting the situation though. The owner is very kind and accommodating!","We have stayed at Matt's home multiple times and have never been disappointed. He is a tremendous host and takes great pride in his property. We keep this in mind when we are preparing to depart and make sure everything is as it was when we first arrived.","Matt's place is very clean, really great location, amazing views. Excellent experience!","We repeatedly book our stays in SLC at Matt's property (upstairs and downstairs) and have never been disappointed. He is a super host and we enjoy all the amenities that his home has to offer. I highly recommend his Airbnb to anyone looking for a hassle-free experience.","Great place with an awesome view of the city.","Thank you greatly for providing such a beautiful, cleanly, truly well-kept house for my stay. I loved every bit of it, the wide open kitchen, the. cozy living room, the lovely and spacious yoga room, even the comfort of the beds. The views around here are extraordinary, the window overlooking the city with shimmering lights, the nice garden area in the front yard, the mountains surrounding the neighborhood, and even the neighborhood itself emanates peace, happiness, friendliness, and joy of being in such a wonderful location. Thank you again Matt, I could go on and on, i wouldn’t have wanted to be anywhere else! I highly recommend this place to future travelers.","Great stay at a great place!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Estados Unidos
reviews:
["Fellow Airbnb members look no further as this is the best place to stay. The host made us feel like we were at home. Even before checking in the host asked if there was anything we needed. I believe one of the most inviting part of this Airbnb was the host left us with the tools to cook and bake cakes. That’s right thanks to this Airbnb we were able to save money on our trip and make eggs and bacon before heading to our events for the day.
Members this is the place. Just experience it yourself.","This is the best home away home place for family to stay ( though I am here alone ) but there are 3 rooms and all with different style. The living room is cozy . The kitchen is useful . The garage and laundry area is so convenient and the host has prepared everything you need. So you can just walk in and stay as home","Kristin was an amazing host that provided a dream transition for us moving to SLC! Her thoughtful touches went way beyond our expectations. She converted the third bedroom into an office and went shopping and stocked the fridge and pantry with the essentials. Kristin was responsive and available with all of our questions. We’ll definitely be referring Kristins’s amazing place to all of our friends & family that visit us.","Kristin worked with us for a last minute housing need. She's a great host with a great space.","As always, an all around excellent experience. Kristin is a great host with a great property. You won't be disappointed!","Kristin's place is very cute and cozy. She was incredibly responsive in getting back to us and meeting us to let us in. We hope to be able to go back in the future.","Kristin is an outstanding host. We've been lucky on Airbnb that all our hosts have been great, but Kristin was the best so far in thoughtfulness and helpfulness. I'd say the other great reviews that we read before booking with her were perfectly accurate. We're looking forward to returning next year!"]

reviews: ["This little apartment was very intimate, secure and clean.  Walkable to most everything we did and had planned for around Salt Lake City. Loved it overall!!","Super nice 10/10 great location too!","Such a cozy spot for a quick getaway to SLC. Such a central and great location everything is so close! Loved our stay here!","Very accommodating with a perfect location","Had a great stay!","Super cute condo that was centrally located and in walking distance from many restaurants, pubs, and shopping outlets. I am very detail oriented and I can tell the host(s) put a lot of work into the presentation of the condo. It was easy to check in and the instructions were crystal clear. My only suggestion for improvement would be a better mattress to sleep on as the one that was available was uncomfortable, wore out, and would cave in on the center of the mattress. Other than that, me and my husband really enjoyed our stay :)","Beautiful space/location."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Place is much smaller in person. Not enough light in one of the rooms and the parking is located on a very steep slope, making it dangerous and slippery during winter. Gabriel was great at responding but Skyler just sent automated messages the whole time. Ended up leaving and having to find a place that same night. Not worth the money.","This was a great stay. Skyler was super communicative and attentive.","My partner & I travel often, including overseas, stay in Airbnbs nearly every time, & usually love it. Sometimes it’s mixed & this was one of those times. I’ll do my best to give an honest assessment of what to expect:

What we liked
It was super cute w great light & beautiful views
The workers who helped us were polite & kind
It’s super walkable & close to a great coffee shop (district coffee)
After asking, our host Skyler got better about responding

What we didn’t like
The internet was slow. It only worked well in one room & was spotty in the rest of the unit. You share wifi w the downstairs unit and it caused problems

The response time was slow
It took over a week to get a new tv remote, we had to bug the host about the heat not working, several requests were never resolved, they would say OF COURSE! & then nothing would happen

The unit wasn’t well cared for
Overall it felt very corporate. The host seemed distracted. It would be fine for a short stay but for long stays w caution","Skyler was very attentive to our needs and messages.","Skyler had a lovely and cute space for our short stay. We enjoyed the location and quiet neighborhood. Most importantly, Skyler was extremely responsive and helpful—we had trouble getting into our unit in the middle of the night and Skyler responded immediately. Thanks again!","Super cute little apartment and a fantastic location. One of our favorite things going on a walk and watching the sunset from the hill. Be aware you do have to park on a VERY steep hill. The history of the area is incredible and so fun to walk around and see. Super close to all the things downtown. It was a wonderful getaway.","Wonderful location! Minuted to downtown yet cozy, quiet, and nicely renovated. Perfect place if you work remotely."]

Location is lovely and was walking distance to Whole foods / shopping and some dining.    Would stay again.      (Just an FYI:  only one small mirror in the apartment, but we made it work)","It was for my mom, but she said they were kind and it was a great place to stay.  They were easy to contact.","We enjoyed our stay – the place was just as advertised.  Easy enough to unload in the alley and then park around front on the street. Particularly nice were the big east and south facing windows in the living room /kitchen so there was good morning and daytime light.","The apartment was super clean, well-appointed and equipped, and in a great location (9th and 9th). Great restaurants, shops, coffee, supermarket and park nearby. All within walking distance. The host was very responsive. High quality linens and towels. Very comfy queen bed. We didn't have a car so cannot assess the parking situation. We would definitely stay there again.","This apartment is both beautiful and convenient to one of our family’s favorite parts of Salt Lake City….Liberty Park! We enjoyed being able to walk to the park to get some exercise and to go to visit the Tracy Aviary too. In addition, you can walk to shops and great food spots nearby. If you’re visiting Salt Lake for the first time or a frequent visitor, you will enjoy being at this unique apartment setting. The owners were great about responding to our needs right away. This trip allowed us to truly visit our family in the area for the first time since 2019. An apartment set-up was perfect for us, and we know we would appreciate staying here again!"]

location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Estados Unidos
reviews:
["Great place to stay when going skiing. Very nice location and clean.","Great spacious home. Great value. House was nicely furnished and looked just like the pictures.","This was my first time in Salt Lake City and with a air bnb Experience as great as this one it made the trip there that much better ! Nella is a great host , The bungalow was just as described and overall the place was very comfortable! especially in the cold weather. My friends and I enjoyed it a lot and would recommend everyone to stay here when Visiting Salt Lake City!","We really enjoyed our stay at Nella's place. The living and dining rooms are spacious and I really enjoyed the view of the mountains from the main window. The couch was nice and comfy and the setup was perfect to enjoy watching the world cup games. The kitchen is well equipped and there are a few supermarkets within walking distance, so if you planning on cooking, like us, this is a great option. The bedrooms are also cozy. One of the beds is very soft and the other one is harder (which I prefer), so you will have a choice, but it is important to know. The internet is fast and you can definitely have at least 2 zoom calls and stream TV at the same time.

Nella is a great host and she is very responsive. I had a question about the bathroom and she answered within seconds of me asking.

I would definitely recommend staying at her place if you find yourself in SLC."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 285 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a common area."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Tara is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Great little spot in the foothills! We loved the neighborhood and easy access to hiking trails. We got TONS of snow the first few days we stayed and the mountains were absolutely stunning. The space was clean and comfortable with everything we needed. Tara and Jeff were friendly and available if needed, but also gave us plenty of privacy. We would definitely stay again if in the area!","Quiet and clean stay! Highly recommend!","Wonderful stay at Tara’s! We stayed for 2 weeks and it was the perfect Airbnb for an extended stay. Great kitchen with dining set, comfy couch, huge bathroom and shower (and felt very luxe with the chic tile, amazing bath products, etc). The bedroom was so cozy- super comfy bed and TV in the bedroom. We parked right out front on the street - no problems there. Tara also has an extra storage closet available to use,  which was nice to offer. Communication with Tara was always quick and easy. The view at sunset at her home was incredible. Wonderful neighborhood in salt lake - tons of midmod homes there. Great neighborhood to take a walk in. Close drive to I-215 and I-80. Thank you so much for a great stay, Tara and Jeff!","Enjoyed staying at Tara’s comfortable and cozy bungalow. The unit is equipped with everything you could need and offers quick access to major freeways and outdoor activities. Lovely location and beautiful views of Salt Lake City.","Great location. Place was clean and quiet and bed was extremely comfortable. Would definitely rent it again.","Great stay at Tara’s. The location is perfect and the place is super comfortable and clean. I’d definitely stay again when visiting SLC.","Great, stylish place with everything you need. Easy drive to downtown and Park City. Highly recommend!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Deanne is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Deanne's place was the perfect place for my wife and I to stay on our short, family emergency visi. We were in admiration of her artsy style and very homey feel to her play. We could tell that a lot of love, heart, soul, and hard work went into the creation of this living space. And as a bonus, Deanne was more that accommodating to our special needs for the duration of our stay. She even sent me a message a week later because she was thinking of us and hopeful that \"Operation Rescue Grandma!\" was a success. It was. I would highly recommend Deanne and her place. Very good person and an adorable AirBnB.","This place was amazing! So clean and cozy--the beds were incredibly comfortable! You can't beat the location--5 minutes from campus, 5 minutes from downtown! Deanne was wonderful to work with...very communicative and accommodating. This place is just lovely...the perfect spot to enjoy your time in SLC!","Stylish and comfortable in a great location walking distance to restaurants, coffee shop, grocery stores, the U and the Trax. Wonderful front porch for morning coffee, comfortable beds and nice shower. The host went out of her way to make us feel right at home. Wou kid definitely stay again!","A lovely and centrally located home. The listing is exactly as advertised. It's clean, very tastefully decorated, stocked with everything you could need (even some snacks!) was the perfect amount of space for our group of 4. The location is on a quiet street in downtown SLC. There's a couple of great neighborhood coffee shops within walking distance, Whole Foods and Trader Joe's nearby and lots of restaurants. We'd stay here again without hesitation!","Wonderful place to stay! Cozy, quaint, and perfect location. Deanne was a gracious host! Will definitely plan another stay at this property!","Deanne is a host that lets no detail get past her. Her home is meticulously clean, comfortable and well furnished. With two students at the U, we’ll be back for several more visits.","If you are looking for a sanctuary, look no further! Deanne is an incredibly talented person who has added all of the touches of home with an artful eye. Throw blankets, spiritual books, even paper clips and snacks! You can even hire her to whip up a gourmet meal for you.
She is delightful, as is her family, who we had the pleasure of meeting, yet they give you space.

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A private room with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Great location","value":"91% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We were not able to visit Monica's place as our flight to SLC was cancelled. That said Monica was very helpful and proactive leading up to our trip. In particular she went out of her way to change laundry and cleaning products to accommodate one of our guests who has allergies to specific brands. We really appreciated the consideration and flexibility and look forward to visiting Monica's place for our next trip to SLC.","We loved our stay! Monica was so kind and helpful. The house is even more beautiful than the pictures. Everything is so nicely decorated and extremely clean! It felt newly remodeled like we were the first people to stay there! This place has everything you need to feel right at home. Nice perk - you're right next door to a delicious brunch restaurant!","We enjoyed our stay. However, I was a little disappointed at $302/night (said and done).
And upstairs shower wasn't really usable due to very little water pressure.","Excellent location. Walked Liberty Park every day. Very comfortable interior.","This place is very beautiful and luxe. You will enjoy spending time here! Very comfortable, with good heating when it’s cold out. Just a few minutes drive to downtown, and walking distance to good restaurants.","As a Salt Lake native who returns to visit family and friends several times each year, I can tell you that for some reason, SLC has a dearth of stylish and affordable AirBnBs in premium locations. This is one of very few. The decorations and furnishings are sheik. The location on the 9th South corridor is awesome, just steps from several coffee shops and restaurants and a nice half-mile walk through the gorgeous Liberty Park to the 9th and 9th commercial district, with even more shops and trendy restaurants. It’s also near downtown and the University of Utah. Great location to catch the train up to the football game at Rice-Eccles Stadium.

The unit itself is comfortable. It stays well heated and cooled with forced air and a couple window ac units in each of the upstairs bedroom in case it gets too hot (it didn’t on a hotter than usual fall weekend). The first floor with its spacious dining room, living room and kitchen was fantastic for a small family gathering we had. The beds were very comfortable and the bedding was first rate. Bathrooms were super stylish with good pressure in the first floor shower. Kitchen has everything you need, including a coffee maker, microwave, full range and oven, full fridge with ice maker and filtered water, washing machine, and an espresso machine. There is also a speedy clothes washer and dryer.

We will definitely stay here again and some family who came to visit us from out of town is also interested in renting this unit the next time they are in town.","Great location! Cute little pad that is nicely decorated and smelled amazing. Very tasteful. Walking distance to so many cute little eateries. Definitely recommend staying here to anyone and plan to stay again on a return trip!"]

Very clean, tidy and accommodating. Cisco was very attentive and helpful with any requests. I will definitely be returning to this property if/when I am in the Salt Lake area again.","I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. The interior is modern, there's plenty of space and natural light, and of course: the views of the Wasatch mountains and Great Salt Lake are amazing. I experienced so many beautiful sunsets here.

I spent the majority of my stay working remotely and the internet service was perfect for video conferencing. The check in/out process was convenient and I especially appreciated the electronic door lock (no need to keep track of a physical key).

This guest house is near so many mountain trails. Highly recommended!"]

reviews: ["Lovely home with charm, comfort, and cleanliness. The decor and furnishings are inviting and friendly.  The hosts were kind and accommodating.","Great rental. We stayed for a month. The place was clean, quiet, well stocked, fast 100 mbps+ wifi. Stylishly decorated and equipped with all of the necessitates for comfort and convenience. The host was very responsive.  Would gladly stay again and recommend to others.","Amazing house. My friends who saw it fell in love. If I go back I’d use this Airbnb again.","This was my worst airbnb stay ever but the host was very nice and a good communicator. My experience did NOT match what I paid ($272 a night after fees). I had the worst sleep of my life here and I'm usually a good sleeper. The sheets and pillows felt cheap, scratchy, hot and uncomfortable and therefore didn't regulate my body temperature so I slept really poorly. The back bedroom's bed was horrible - it needs to be replaced entirely. I don't even know where you'd find a bed like that. it was awful. The front room was a bit better but I still slept really poorly.  Would have appreciated a refund of some sort given how poor of a value I felt this stay was. Also lots of weird little noises throughout the night that weren't consistent and I don't know what they were so I got woken up countless times. I'm exhausted as a result.","Great stay in a really well-stocked home. We had everything we needed, and the dogs had plenty of room to play in the yard. Would definitely stay again!","John’s place was perfect for our weekend getaway. It was convenient to everything we could need or want to do.  The kitchen was fully stocked with all the dishes, pots and pans. Even spices etc. He had coffee there for us to use. It was extremely comfortable. John was quick to respond and was a great host. I would stay there again on our next trip","Beautiful place. Highly recommend especially if you have doggos. Loved every minute."]

reviews: ["Beautiful surroundings from the streams to the mountains. Gorgeous! Home is as described. Responsive hosts.","Cute and cozy place to stay and a great location! My only comment would be that the description doesn’t mention that you need 4WD or AWD in the winter if it has snowed at all the the past few weeks (unless I missed it). Sarieh did mention it in a message she sent before the stay, but the message came way past the cancellation deadline so if your vehicle isn’t equipped you might have to cancel with no refund. Other than that though the place was great and she was super helpful with instructions for check in and recommendations in the area.","Great people, cute place. :-)","It's cozy, comfortable, and very affordable. It's one of the best air bnbs we've ever been to. Tucked away in the mountains, “The Nest” gives you the feel of being deep off the beaten path while still being close to town!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["We loved our stay at Elle and Garrett’s home! We stayed for 2 months - my husband and I both WFH and overall this place was great.
First - the place itself is super cute and in the perfect part of town. You can walk to a lot of great restaurants or take the bus downtown easily. The neighbors are friendly and it’s safe - I went on a lot of walks around the area.
Second - the house itself worked out well. The working space in the back was chilly in the winter but we used a space heater so we could work from there. A note that it’s a standing desk but we were fine with that. The wifi was fast which is a big deal for us with working from home. The kitchen has all you need (note, no microwave if you use one often but we made do just fine) and the butler pantry has fun glassware to make coffee or cocktails. The fenced in yard was great and we sat on the front porch whenever it was nice out and met the neighbors. We also were there in the winter so we loved having the gas fireplace.
Third - Elle and Garret are wonderful hosts who were super responsive if we needed anything. They gave us lots of great local recommendations and we feel like we got the full Salt Lake City experience. If you’re looking to stay in the city with short drives to skiing, this is your place.","Our stay at Elle and Garret’s was fantastic! This is their home and it feels that way, it’s not like staying in an AirBnB. Their place has so much character and served as a terrific home base for our one month stay in Salt Lake. We went camping in the surrounding national parks every weekend and they were nice enough to leave a camping stove and cooler which made our trips that much more enjoyable. The location was perfect for taking walks to Liberty Park, enjoying the restaurants of 9th and 9th, and great access to road bike rides like City Creek and Emmigration.

The kitchen was fully equipped and we enjoyed making dinner, then sitting out on the front porch to eat each night. The grill was also very nice for bbq nights. We made the mini fridge our beer fridge and collected great beers from the surrounding breweries. I was at first concerned about the tub/shower, especially as a 6’ 5” guy, but had no problems and my head even fit under the shower with some slight bending of the knees. The beds were very comfortable and in the hot summer heat the A/C worked great. We worked from the dining room table and alternated taking calls from the porch or kitchen if we had overlapping calls. Our favorite place to hang out was on the front porch on the couch or chairs. Their neighbors are so friendly and great to talk to. Lots of cute dogs passing by to say hello to.

Lastly, Elle and Garret are really nice people. We were able to have drinks together one night. They had so many recommendations for things to do and see. Garret even took me on a road bike ride and introduced me to some other riders in the area. They were always available and so helpful and friendly.

A couple of things that took some getting used to:
1. The location of the silverware, it’s really not a big deal, but it’s in the dinning area not the kitchen.
2. The back door locks when closed, luckily we didn’t lock ourselves out once, but we were close!
3. The closet is in the back room. For two mix-gender friends this meant having to keep a set of clothes in our bedroom each night and also getting the clothes from the back room to bring them to a bedroom to change. The closet area is large and was great for storing all kinds of gear.
4. We loved that they had a Google Home for music. We did realize that we were playing off Elle’s Spotify and sometimes we we’re trying to listen to Taylor Swift at the same time, which Spotify doesn’t allow. So you may have to set up the Google Home with your own Spotify so you can jam out to Taylor, Yacht Rock or whatever floats your boat.

If you have the opportunity to stay here do it! You won’t regret the experience and the comfort in Salt Lake City.","Elle and Garret's home is everything we wanted for our stay in SLC, and more! The house is in a quiet neighborhood with very friendly neighbors and walking distance to a number of restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, and Liberty Park. And getting downtown is a short bike or Uber ride away. The house is well stocked with everything you could need for a short or long stay. My girlfriend and I worked the whole month we were there and never had one issue with the wifi, it is incredibly fast and reliable! We loved sipping coffee on the front porch every morning and eating dinner in the backyard every evening. And the hosts are super nice and responsive, and they gave us a ton of recommendations for things to do and see during our stay. I highly recommend Elle and Garret's house to every traveler - we cannot wait to be back!","Elle & Garret’s place was amazing! The home was beautiful, clean and comfortable for my husband and I and our small dog.

We cooked a lot while there and the kitchen had everything we could need. The wifi was great to handle both of our Zoom calls while WFH. We were initially nervous about the claw foot tub but it was so lovely, the shower had good water pressure and got hot, quick!

We loved spending time in the backyard and on the front porch where we were greeted by friendly neighbors. :) The neighborhood was so inviting and cute, with a park nearby where we went on daily walks.

The house is close to everything! Only 5-10 min drive to tons of great food, coffee, breweries, etc.

We would absolutely stay at Elle & Garret’s place again! Thank you guys for such a lovely stay!"]

reviews:
["Beautiful place with a nice backyard and great hot tub. Hosts are very thoughtful and stocked the kitchen with snacks, coffee, tea, hot chocolate and energy drinks. Comfortable beddings and spacious bedrooms. Plenty of fresh towels and toiletries. Overall great experience and would stay again when we come visit next!","Nate and Ren’e place was perfect! Well stocked kitchen, clean, and comfortable. We loved how close it was to downtown and the hot tub was a great addition. Definitely recommend!","Check-in was a breeze. The house was very clean. The beds were comfortable. There was a nice view of the mountains from the living room windows and the downstairs area was very open and inviting. There were even two desk areas, one upstairs and one down. Internet worked great.

We had gone to SLC to visit family and have an early Thanksgiving. The kitchen was equipped well enough to actually cook our meal. The only thing my daughter brought over was a couple of casserole dishes. The washer and dryer was a nice plus and allowed us to do some laundry.

As mentioned in other reviews, the upstairs bedroom has low ceilings, especially on the sides, so you must be careful to not bump your head, and there is no rail at the top of the stairs. Being older, I like to hold on to a rail especially when descending the stairs.","The place was beautiful me and my girlfriend had a great time!!","Great place to stay. Would recommend.","Great stay! I absolutely loved this place. The house was very inviting, comfortable, and clean. Nate and Ren have great attention to detail when it comes to providing all the appropriate necessities for a home away from home. The kitchen was well stocked. The beds were comfortable. The hot tub was a great addition.","Great location , very clean and had the little items that make an Airbnb great. Extra blankets , salt /pepper etc."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the smartlock."},{"name":"Cottonwood Lodging is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Stayed here for my sister’s wedding. Great spot the location to get away from my family’s madness. It would be an awesome place for a Ski weekend. Even let me check in early so I was able to get ready for the wedding. Highly recommended","Great Condo and great location and fun mountain to ski.","Very professional staff that answers any questions promptly. We are a family of five and the bunk bed was great, fully stocked kitchen was very helpful, underground parking was great for loading up at checkout during a pretty heavy snowfall. Ski equipment locker is great. Proximity to Apex Lift is great! The condo made our family ski trip extra special. Thank you.","Lovely condo, great location, fantastic game room for the kids and hot tubs for the adults.","The condo is perfect for our family of four. Solitude is a hidden gem - not crowded, still enough snow even though they haven't has snow in 3 weeks, and you can ski directly over to Brighton.
Powderhorn Lodge is in the heart of Solitude's little village, super easy and convenient to get to the slopes in your ski boots.
I would highly recommend - it was a great place!","Nice Condo, great location close to lifts and Club Solitude (hot tubs and game rooms) Also a gym and TV room which we didn't use.","Great location with lots of space and amenities!

I completely recommend Solitude. It is a hidden gem with the same great Utah snow as Snowbird or Park City with half the crowds. I also highly recommend Cottonwood Lodging. We had a little hiccup at check in, but Suzie and Morgan jumped into action and went above and beyond. It was a fantastic stay."]

Came with everything you need. No complaints! :)","This was by far one of the best places I have stayed. The host was easy to communicate with. The house has everything you need. I had my furbaby, Harley, with me and he loved the backyard. It is very relaxing. The kitchen even had snacks. I would highly recommend!","This house is close to so many things, very centrally located. It is in a lovely well kept neighborhood and has a friendly atmosphere. The back yard is wonderfully kept and quaint. The house is well stocked, we did not find ourselves needing anything.","Safdar's place had every essential amenity for an extended stay. Every single item was clearly labelled and neatly organized, making us feel right at home and we could not have gone with a better option for our stay.","A great location and a great stay! I would recommend this stay to anyone looking for a location close to any of the resorts in the cottonwood canyons or looking to be close to downtown but in a quiet neighborhood. Be aware the bunk bed was not comfortable for adults, and I wouldn't recommend more than two adults without separate accommodations. Overall a great stay and I'd recommend it to almost anyone!","Safdar's house was perfect for our small family of 4 for our ski trip. Very close and convenient to both the Park City ski areas and the Wasatch National Park areas. The house was very well appointed and clean. Very close to a supermarket for your grocery needs, and very reasonably priced. Check in & check out was a piece of cake.
A very nice place to stay for your next ski trip. Two thumbs up!"]

reviews:
["This home was remarkable for so many reasons! The location was perfect distances from the airport, downtown, parks, and shops. The home is located in a friendly and safe neighborhood. You can literally walk to so many cafes, coffee shops, restaurants, parks, and so forth. The home is comfortable, clean, and beautifully decorated. The home provided a great space to relax, play games, and unwind after a busy day. The bed was extremely comfortable and had great water pressure in the shower! Sarah was a great host and thought of everything a travel may need to be comfortable.","This is an awesome place to stay, it’s close to everything you’re going to want to see/do during your stay. And it’s all within a short commute or walk or bike ride, whatever your preference is for getting around. The space is EXACTLY as it’s photographed. It’s so cozy and comfortable, I started calling it “home” during my trip even though I only stayed for a few days. As a bonus, if you love plants, this is the place for you, there are so many pretty plants!
Sarah is an awesome host, super attentive and replies so quickly. This is the place I’ll look to book first when I come back to SLC.","The space was perfect for me while I was in the area. About half a mile to tons of shops/restaurants/etc and about a mile from Sugar House which has many more restaurants/shops, so you won't run out of things to do nearby! The space was clean and had all the necessities stocked up. Highly recommended!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Dedicated workspace","value":"A common area with wifi that’s well-suited for working."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Beehive is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Such a quaint place! Was great for me and my little family. The back yard is amazing and everything in the house is updated. Comfy beds. Smart Tv. And great location to get around Salt Lake.","absolutely amazing home! great host, felt like home. the area had great food, nice park , easy to get to everywhere from here! will definitely be coming back x","Perfect location. Walking distance to fun local eateries. We loved the back yard! We came on this trip to move my son out of his apartment. It was a fantastic spot because we could park the truck overnight behind the gate after it was packed and it was secure. We loved walking to Normal Ice cream and Barrio tacos after a long day of packing. The kitchen was well stocked and we cooked most days. The hot tub was wonderful. Close 5-10 minute drive to everything downtown. We truly enjoyed our stay.","We had a really great stay! The place was perfectly located for us and the amenities were everything we needed. Check-in was a breeze, all the appliances worked, and it was scrupulously clean. We especially appreciated that the hot tub was ready to go when we arrived. The backyard is really chill in general - maybe my favorite part of the whole place.

Note that the only full bath is located through one of the bedrooms. So, keep that in mind if you're visiting with multiple couples. There is a half bath, though, which I really appreciated.

Bottom line: we'll definitely stay here again next time we're in town.","Check this place out next time your in salt lake. A beautiful hidden gem in the city. Private, convenient and beautifully remodeled. Thanks again for hosting an awesome place.","This SUPER CUTE SUPER CLEAN home is the perfect location, while the houses around it are not the best you will be pleasantly surprised when you walk through the doors, the home is GORG!!! (there are cameras outside so that up'd the safety factor) and the backyard is the perfect place for the morning coffee (that you can get less then a 5 min walk away) or hangout in the hot tub and BBQ. There is a fun breakfast place called the Pig in a jelly jar, Basalt spa, Bean and brew coffee and many other fun shops just steps away. Easy access to the freeway and a 2mile drive to Rice stadium. Check in was a breeze, host was very prompt with response. Will for sure bool again and wound recommend to ANY go stay here","One of the best stays we have ever had! The hot tub was so nice!"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great check-in experience","value":"100% of recent guests gave the check-in process a 5-star rating."},{"name":"Great communication","value":"100% of recent guests rated Kristen 5-star in communication."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Beautiful views and home. Only problem was the ac was not good and the house temp our whole stay was 82 degrees (it was 100 outside).. not sure if the ac was crappy or broken but it was pretty miserable. Other than that everything was good.","Amazing time in a wonderful house with incredible views.","Great location, spectacular view. The house is beautiful and the setting is quiet and relaxing. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.","The house was even nicer than the pictures showed and the views truly are incredible. For skiing access to both the cottonwoods and park city was super convenient as compared to SLC. The furnishings were very well done and comfortable. Communication was great as well.","An amazing sanctuary peaceful quiet that meets all my expectations. The host has made it a very warm peaceful place to stay.
Very grateful I came across this opportunity.","The views from this house are outstanding! Taking care of their two wonderful cats was no trouble at all, and they are excellent company - especially Phoenix. As Kristen and some guests have mentioned, keep in mind that this is an occupied home, so closets and cupboards are quite full. The beds were very comfortable, and the swamp cooler worked really well during the hot days of our stay. Kristen was very prompt with all communications, and e-mailed us to make sure that check-in went smoothly and to answer any questions. She kept in touch with us throughout our stay, which was much appreciated. The driveway is steep, but we had no problems walking up (and we are in our 60's). Also keep in mind that the house has several levels, as it is built into a hillside, so there are quite a few stairs inside. If you're a coffee drinker, there is no coffee maker (we brought our own). The location was perfect for us, as we were visiting family who lived nearby. Thank you Kristen for a wonderful stay! Highly recommend this home!","This house was beautful. I absolutly loved this house. Great location Even better view. If you decide to stay here it was ment to be. The house is very very relaxing. I give it a 11 out of 10"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Spațiu de muncă dedicat","value":"O cameră privată cu Wi-Fi, care este potrivită pentru lucru."},{"name":"Jackie este o Super-gazdă","value":"Super-gazdele sunt gazde cu experiență, foarte apreciate, care se angajează să ofere oaspeților șederi de excepție."},{"name":"Poziție excelentă","value":"100% dintre oaspeții recenți au acordat poziției locuinței un scor de 5 stele."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, Statele Unite ale Americii
reviews:
["The apartment was very comfortable and quiet, and Jackie was a friendly and helpful host.","This place is awesome! I stayed for one month and constantly found something to do.
The space right next to the unit is the main area for a lot of the festivals in town, so it was super convenient to just walk right out the door and be in the middle of all the action.
Super close to Vivint Arena and Trax so the transportation through town was very easy.

The airbnb itself is great. 2 nice sized bedrooms, a really spacious kitchen, and plenty of living space for multiple people to live comfortably. I was here to work remote, and the office area was perfect for my set up.

Jackie is a great host as well. She was very communicative and helped me with anything that I needed. But, we barely talked because I never had any issues! The next time I am in Salt Lake City this will definitely be the airbnb I look to first.","Jackie was an amazing host who as always available when we needed!

My friend and I stayed for an internship for 9 weeks and the place was great! Walking distance to the free trax system that will get you into downtown in minutes! The location was great with restaurant options as well as free events in the area. The host made sure we had everything we needed with linens, kitchenware, Toiletries, cleaning supplies, etc.!

I would highly recommend this host and this airbnb!","Jackie is the most wonderful host. My parents (66 years and 57 years of age) and grandmother (82 years of age) were visiting me at SLC for a month and I needed to find a place with walk-in showers, and no stairs. Jackie's apartment was ideal. In addition to that, Jackie also installed a couple of shower-bars for the bathroom which my grandmother would use. So I cannot thank her enough.

The apartment has fantastic views of the west mountains and is close to downtown SLC and the University of Utah, where I work.

Jackie was always very responsive and accommodating and also let me have the apartment for a few extra hours since I was clearing out after a month's stay.

I highly recommend this apartment.

Thank you Jackie.","Great location and host. Highly recommended. Will be back again.","We had a great stay at the Parc while working at the Eccles Theater a few blocks away. Jackie moved us to another unit on the 10th floor because the heat was out in the unit we'd booked. She was easy to get in touch with and really helpful with all our requests. The kitchen was well stocked and the apartment had pretty much everything we needed for cooking meals including spices and oils and tupperware and baking dishes. We really enjoyed the huge bath tub, the fireplace, and the proximity to downtown. You can hear the train from apartments on the north side of the building, but we're used to subway trains. There was plenty of room for 3 of us to spread out and it would've been a comfortable place to have people over for dinner in non covid times. The dedicated garage parking was another plus!","Jackie is a great host and her rental is right in the middle of a city with a lot to offer, lots of food and shopping within walking distance"]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["My son and I had a wonderful stay at Paul's place this summer. The location is near perfect - 15 min from the airport and walking distance to Temple Square and City Creek Center. The neighborhood is safe and quiet. Harmon's grocery is just down the street, and it is great. Covered parking underneath for one car, which is welcome especially in the summer. The unit is very clean and well-appointed. Recently renovated in a modern but cozy style. Views of the capitol and partial views of Temple Square. Wifi, TVs with Amazon Fire for all the streaming services, fireplace, and even a guitar, which my musician son enjoyed. We didn't have time for the pool, but it looked great from the window. The building does have a gym and ping-pong/pool rec-room downstairs. The gym looked good for cardio, but if you're looking to lift, you may want to supplement at a local gym. Paul thought of about everything you could need for a comfortable stay - starter sets of detergent, soaps, trash bags, zip locks, Keurig coffee maker and pods, and a complete kitchen. We hope to come back.","Paul went ABOVE & BEYOND as a host =) Our stay was so enjoyable, a few mins walk to the Convention Centre and City Creek Mall, and the condo was so great to stay in. We would 100% come back to stay and had a great experience. Thank you Paul!","This place is great! The location is ideal for walking to the convention center or capitol. The beds were very comfortable along with the couches. The apartment is very spacious with great views. Paul was a great host, he pointed out all the local spots. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it!","The host canceled this reservation 277 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.","The host canceled this reservation 33 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.","Great location for downtown Salt Lake City!","paul is nice and the house is clean. very close to the center. will come back again. "]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Cottonwood Lodging is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."},{"name":"Great location","value":"100% of recent guests gave the location a 5-star rating."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["Outstanding place to ski for a week!","Great location for skiing Utah.  It's only a short walk to the slopes with a small community vibe, no overcrowding to worry about!","Great unit and location. We had a blast!","Everything was above and beyond what we had hoped. The kitchen was very well stocked. We made full course meals everyday and had everything we needed to not only make the meals but clean up afterwards as well. Great view and quick walk to the lifts. Would definitely stay here again.","Perfect ski escape! We had a great long weekend skiing at Solitude. Very clean and comfortable condo, easily sleeps 4 (with 3 full bathrooms!). Quick walk to the lifts— utilize the lockers for shoes so you don’t have to walk the icy roads in snow boots. We cooked most meals at home and also enjoyed a few meals in the village. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.","The lodge at Solitude was great, all the amenities you need for ski vacation. Our group loved it, especially the view of the mountains. The only thing to note, this condo is on a fairly steep hill up from the village, so in practice I would go get the SUV to pick up the family at the end of the day. So you either need to be prepared for a steep (but short) hike or have an SUV with 4WD to get up and down. All-in would stay here again, the mountain and the lodge were great!","Solid listing, super convenient. Nice communication with with hosts"]

reviews: ["This little home is adorable with a fantasitc outdoor space. Very quaint and quiet. Communication with Betsy was so great. We did not need for anything.","We were happy to return to Betsy's place, and hope to do so again whenever we're in Salt Lake City. As with our first stay, Betsy was responsive and friendly, and it's always nice to walk in and find some tasty snacks, not to mention two adorable sweet cats, waiting for us.","Loved our time in this cute house, on a quiet nice street, with the two cats. Bed was comfortable, kitchen was nicely stocked, space was nice. Note that kitchen table is only really big enough for three (that was ok for us). Only bummer: we picked the place for the fireplace, and that was shut off. We look forward to coming back again, especially in a warmer season when we could take advantage of the outdoor space, which looked great.","Beautiful home and perfect location for downtown dining and eating. Very cozy and great remodel done to the home.","Unique place near the university. It's small, but has a lot of character. The garden area is very nice when in season. The decor is minimalist, but has well thought out pieces for the space. The host was very responsive and easy to work with. We really enjoyed our short stay. Would stay again.","Betsy’s place is awesome! Location, decor, amenities, even snacks! could not be better. And a top-shelf host—great communication, clear info, totally available and generous. Easy to get to downtown, cafes, dining, university. A great stay!","This little escape from the city was so fun for me and my friends!! I would 100% stay here again! Thank you Betsy"]
