highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 412 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a private room."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Nook is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["Great stay. Friendly Host. Good Location.","The gas hot water heater wasn't working when I arrived late in the evening. I informed them the next morning, and over the 12 hour day they were unable to get maintenance to come to fix it. In the end I managed to fix it myself right before I checked out. Because a gas appliance was malfunctioning, I checked whether they had a carbon monoxide detector. There was only one, and it had no battery and wasn't connected to power, so in reality they had a malfunctioning gas appliance and no carbon monoxide detector. I was really disappointed in the safety lapse as well as the host's inability to have a maintenance person even come look at the hot water heater.

The host offered to refund me $100 for my troubles, but only if I agreed to not leave a review or leave a 5 star review.","Very good communication!","Perfect location for staying in SLC! It has a wonderful view of the mountains. The host was amazing with communication and showing exactly where everything was. Highly recommend!","We were very happy with our stay, and especially enjoyed spending time on the balcony. The location was super convenient, with Trader Joe’s, Sprouts and a huge Smith’s (like King Soopers) just minutes away. The building feels very safe and secure. We were there for an event at the Salt Palace Conventiion Center, and it was quick to get an Uber to and from all three days.","We loved our time at this apartment! Location is awesome, Neal was extremely welcoming, and the apartment itself is amazing. Definitely recommend.","Beautiful, new, modern apartment in a lovely neighborhood. Clean and well outfitted with all necessities. Walking distance to plenty of restaurants and our fav, Trader Joe’s. Wish we could have stayed longer."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 266 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a common area."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the lockbox."},{"name":"Lisbeth is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews: ["What a wonderful stay and host! Attention to detail and over the top efforts to make us comfortable was so appreciated! Located in a nice neighborhood with a great park down the street, walkable coffee shop with excellent mochas, and short drive or downtown area. Had a fantastic stay!","The place is wonderful. Great neighborhood. Nice design. Beautiful back yard. Well-designed home. Perfect Sugarhouse getaway.","I cannot say enough great things about Lisbeth’s amazing place. This was the true Airbnb experience! Everything in the listing doesn’t do justice to how wonderful her place actually is. We had a wonderful dinner in the yard with friends and family that were in town from all over and the ambiance, the space the accommodating host experience and everything we experienced was amazing. Lisbeth even gave us a quick tour to show us the space beforehand and shared her home with us to make sure we knew where everything was and had everything we needed. The kitchen flowing to the backyard made everything easy and fun. The little touches from around the world helped make great conversation starters and it was more than the typical “flip for money” that you usually get in Airbnb’s in Salt Lake. This is her home, and she let us use it because she is a true host. If you ever want to feel immersed into the original experience that Airbnb initially started to offer, this is one of the rare places you should try. I was able to celebrate my overachieving daughter in a way I never expected. The house was in tip top shape with everything you need and don’t need, and I hope to stay here soon again. We loved it! Clean, fun, comfortable and without hassle, what more are you looking for? Kids playing downstairs while adults can mingle in the upper part of the home, or on the decadent patio or front porch. Safe neighborhood close to I-80 and sugarhouse shops and restaurants. Perfection.","Lisbeth was a wonderful host. This house was one of the best AirBnB's we've ever stayed in. Everything was well kept and clean. Beds were very comfortable. A nice quiet neighborhood with a beautiful front and back yard to hangout in. Walking distance to good restaurants and a lovely park. We'd absolutely stay at this location again when we return to SLC!"]

reviews:
["Arjun has been a wonderful host. He always responded to every request within the hour. The place was as described, with a well equipped kitchen. The amenities of the resort like pool, hot tub, pool table, goose ball and air hockey were great entertainment for the whole family. The ski in ski out feature of the resort is wonderful. We had a great time and felt right at home. We would return any time.","Firstly, Arjun’s place was great - had everything you would need on vacation, was very clean, and nicely situated in Solitude’s base. Arjun was very responsive and a great host","Beautiful spot","This was a great spot for our plans to attend a wedding at the lodge. Easy ski lift/walk home after everything, and fun restaurants in the immediate area! Kitchen was fully equipped as well.","This stay at Solitude was pleasant. The place was as described and Arjun was very responsive. Check-in info was prescriptive via a YT video. Thanks!","This place is perfect. We would definitely stay again. Beautiful surrounding area, nice room location (close to the pool, hot tub, restaurants), and fantastic room. Everything was clean and comfortable.

Arjun is a great host. He communicated very quickly and was happy to help. His handy \"how-to\" video made check-in a breeze.

My only warning is to just be aware that there is no air conditioning in the room (and, apparently, the rest of the rooms in Solitude). It worked out well for us because a rainstorm cooled things down. But if you are up there on a very hot summer weekend, it would probably be uncomfortably warm in the unit.","It’s a nice condo. One bed one bath. The proximity to the mountains is great."]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["An awesome place. Exceptionally beautiful and well maintained. Very quiet and comfortable. The hosts are super responsive and helpful. We definitely plan to stay again.","This house was absolutely magical. We thoroughly enjoyed staying here and did not want to leave. Amazing hosts with great communication. Highly recommend!","This place is an absolute gem. If you are looking to stay in the most gracious, beautiful mansion you've ever seen, book this. I was sad that I was here for a work trip and my husband wasn't with me! \r
\r
The house itself is a massive old mansion on a beautiful street with other historical mansions. It's near the fanciest part of town, which looks over Salt Lake City. It's about a 40 minute walk to downtown (or short uber/bus/drive). Right near the U of Utah, with a number of cute restaurants. There is an amazing walking/hiking/biking trail about 15 minutes up the hill from the mansion. \r
\r
Now on to the mansion: there are no words to describe this place accurately. It's stunning; perfectly maintained, stunning artwork on every well with custom lighting, antique furniture, beautiful decorations. I booked the master suite, and had a sitting room(!), a dressing room, a bathroom with every single amenity (including a bidet) and a massive bedroom space. I wanted to move in permanently. I felt like I was in a fairy tale. Would be a beautiful place to spend a weekend on vacation. The bed was a king and quite comfortable. Good AC. Daybed also in the master for an additional person or child. \r
\r
My colleague stayed in a bedroom across the hall, and that room was equally stunning. All have private baths. The downstairs area includes a full kitchen, a stunning dining room, an office, and several other common spaces. I worked in the massive office one evening while enjoying a glass of wine. \r
\r
Michael, the host, is wonderful, and was so kind and welcoming. He made me feel at home in this amazing place. \r
\r
Don't hesitate to book this. I can't imagine there is a single place better in the city (that wouldn't be possible, you'll see). "]

Location_city: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
highlights: [{"name":"Great for remote work","value":"Fast wifi at 87 Mbps, plus a dedicated workspace in a private room."},{"name":"Self check-in","value":"Check yourself in with the keypad."},{"name":"Bryan is a Superhost","value":"Superhosts are experienced, highly rated hosts who are committed to providing great stays for guests."}]
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
reviews:
["What a comfortable place to be for two months! We appreciated Bryan’s quick communication and hospitality. The place had everything we needed. This place was a saving grace and our appreciation for all the small details made some overwhelming circumstances seem more bearable. Highly recommend for an extended stay.","Great place to stay. Had everything we needed at the house and more! Very pleased with everything the house had to offer. Great communication from the host.","By far the most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept on at an air b n b! The majority of other air b n b’s I’ve been to have uncomfortable beds so I usually don’t get good sleep. The kitchen was fully stocked and bathroom amenities were available if needed such as toothbrushes etc which I appreciated. The host also left nivea lotion and peppermint chapstick as a welcome gift which was thoughtful. Great location with tons of restaurants, a park, and a strip mall all within walking distance. Downtown Salt Lake was only ten minutes away so I liked that it wasn’t expensive to get a Lyft ride home after a night out. Will definitely come back here next time I’m in town!","Owner easy to work with.","Great stay! AC got a little loud during the hottest days, however everything else was perfect and very comfortable. Everything you need is here!

Great fully stocked kitchen. I don’t eat out so I appreciated this very much, as well as the pans and pots that were very well taken care of ( not old and peeling which is what I’ve noticed a lot of other hosts tend to provide and is super toxic )

I loved every detail, including how the toilet’s lid didn’t slam shut. Plenty of nice towels that weren’t falling apart.

Extremely comfortable bedding and pillows without that way too common toxic bleach scent. Super comfy living room. Great work space and wifi.

You can tell they care! I also appreciated no shoes inside. It was a nice well kept and very clean home.

I booked elsewhere after my stay was over however I wish I could have stayed here instead! Thanks again for he hospitality.

One of my most comfortable and best stays. 4.9 stars as the AC was struggling a bit.","Great location. Well stocked kitchen and very comfortable beds & pillows. Two thumbs up!","This is a great spacious home with 2 wonderful bedrooms and baths. Check-in and out was so easy! Convenient to our family’s location in Sugarhouse. Would stay here again for sure!"]
